content: 1 Happy is the man who has not followed the counsel of the wicked, or taken the path of sinners, or joined the company of the insolent;
content_old: 1 Happy is the man who has not followed the counsel of the wicked, or taken the path of sinners, or joined the company of the insolent;

content: 2 rather, the teaching of the LORD is his delight, and he studies that teaching day and night.
content_old: 2 rather, the teaching of the LORD is his delight, and he studies that teaching day and night.

content: 3 He is like a tree planted beside streams of water, which yields its fruit in season, whose foliage never fades, and whatever it produces thrives.
content_old: 3 He is like a tree planted beside streams of water, which yields its fruit in season, whose foliage never fades, and whatever it produces thrives.

content: 4 Not so the wicked; rather, they are like chaff that wind blows away.
content_old: 4 Not so the wicked; rather, they are like chaff that wind blows away.

content: 5 Therefore the wicked will not survive judgment, nor will sinners, in the assembly of the righteous.
content_old: 5 Therefore the wicked will not survive judgment, nor will sinners, in the assembly of the righteous.

content: 1 Why do nations assemble, and peoples plot vain things;
content_old: 1 Why do nations assemble, and peoples plot vain things;

content: 2 kings of the earth take their stand, and regents intrigue together against the LORD and against His anointed?
content_old: 2 kings of the earth take their stand, and regents intrigue together against the LORD and against His anointed?

content: 3 “Let us break the cords of their yoke, shake off their ropes from us!”
content_old: 3 “Let us break the cords of their yoke, shake off their ropes from us!”

content: 4 He who is enthroned in heaven laughs; the Lord mocks at them.
content_old: 4 He who is enthroned in heaven laughs; the Lord mocks at them.

content: 5 Then He speaks to them in anger, terrifying them in His rage,
content_old: 5 Then He speaks to them in anger, terrifying them in His rage,

content: 6 “But I have installed My king on Zion, My holy mountain!”
content_old: 6 “But I have installed My king on Zion, My holy mountain!”

content: 7 Let me tell of the decree: the LORD said to me, “You are My son, I have fathered you this day.
content_old: 7 Let me tell of the decree: the LORD said to me, “You are My son, I have fathered you this day.

content: 8 Ask it of Me, and I will make the nations your domain; your estate, the limits of the earth.
content_old: 8 Ask it of Me, and I will make the nations your domain; your estate, the limits of the earth.

content: 9 You can smash them with an iron mace, shatter them like potter’s ware.”
content_old: 9 You can smash them with an iron mace, shatter them like potter’s ware.”

content: 10 So now, O kings, be prudent; accept discipline, you rulers of the earth!
content_old: 10 So now, O kings, be prudent; accept discipline, you rulers of the earth!

content: 11 Serve the LORD in awe; tremble with fright,
content_old: 11 Serve the LORD in awe; tremble with fright,

content: 1 A psalm of David when he fled from his son Absalom.
content_old: 1 A psalm of David when he fled from his son Absalom.

content: 2 O LORD, my foes are so many! Many are those who attack me;
content_old: 2 O LORD, my foes are so many! Many are those who attack me;

content: 3 many say of me, “There is no deliverance for him through God.” Selah.
content_old: 3 many say of me, “There is no deliverance for him through God.” Selah.

content: 4 But You, O LORD, are a shield about me, my glory, He who holds my head high.
content_old: 4 But You, O LORD, are a shield about me, my glory, He who holds my head high.

content: 5 I cry aloud to the LORD, and He answers me from His holy mountain. Selah.
content_old: 5 I cry aloud to the LORD, and He answers me from His holy mountain. Selah.

content: 6 I lie down and sleep and wake again, for the LORD sustains me.
content_old: 6 I lie down and sleep and wake again, for the LORD sustains me.

content: 7 I have no fear of the myriad forces arrayed against me on every side.
content_old: 7 I have no fear of the myriad forces arrayed against me on every side.

content: 8 Rise, O LORD! Deliver me, O my God! For You slap all my enemies in the face; You break the teeth of the wicked.
content_old: 8 Rise, O LORD! Deliver me, O my God! For You slap all my enemies in the face; You break the teeth of the wicked.

content: 1 For the leader; with instrumental music. A psalm of David.
content_old: 1 For the leader; with instrumental music. A psalm of David.

content: 2 Answer me when I call, O God, my vindicator! You freed me from distress; have mercy on me and hear my prayer.
content_old: 2 Answer me when I call, O God, my vindicator! You freed me from distress; have mercy on me and hear my prayer.

content: 3 You men, how long will my glory be mocked, will you love illusions, have recourse to frauds? Selah.
content_old: 3 You men, how long will my glory be mocked, will you love illusions, have recourse to frauds? Selah.

content: 4 Know that the LORD singles out the faithful for Himself; the LORD hears when I call to Him.
content_old: 4 Know that the LORD singles out the faithful for Himself; the LORD hears when I call to Him.

content: 5 So tremble, and sin no more; ponder it on your bed, and sigh.
content_old: 5 So tremble, and sin no more; ponder it on your bed, and sigh.

content: 6 Offer sacrifices in righteousness and trust in the LORD.
content_old: 6 Offer sacrifices in righteousness and trust in the LORD.

content: 7 Many say, “O for good days!” Bestow Your favor on us, O LORD.
content_old: 7 Many say, “O for good days!” Bestow Your favor on us, O LORD.

content: 8 You put joy into my heart when their grain and wine show increase.
content_old: 8 You put joy into my heart when their grain and wine show increase.

content: 1 For the leader; on nehiloth. A psalm of David.
content_old: 1 For the leader; on nehiloth. A psalm of David.

content: 2 Give ear to my speech, O LORD; consider my utterance.
content_old: 2 Give ear to my speech, O LORD; consider my utterance.

content: 3 Heed the sound of my cry, my king and God, for I pray to You.
content_old: 3 Heed the sound of my cry, my king and God, for I pray to You.

content: 4 Hear my voice, O LORD, at daybreak; at daybreak I plead before You, and wait.
content_old: 4 Hear my voice, O LORD, at daybreak; at daybreak I plead before You, and wait.

content: 5 For You are not a God who desires wickedness; evil cannot abide with You;
content_old: 5 For You are not a God who desires wickedness; evil cannot abide with You;

content: 6 wanton men cannot endure in Your sight. You detest all evildoers;
content_old: 6 wanton men cannot endure in Your sight. You detest all evildoers;

content: 7 You doom those who speak lies; murderous, deceitful men the LORD abhors.
content_old: 7 You doom those who speak lies; murderous, deceitful men the LORD abhors.

content: 8 But I, through Your abundant love, enter Your house; I bow down in awe at Your holy temple.
content_old: 8 But I, through Your abundant love, enter Your house; I bow down in awe at Your holy temple.

content: 9 O LORD, lead me along Your righteous because of my watchful foes; make Your way straight before me.
content_old: 9 O LORD, lead me along Your righteous because of my watchful foes; make Your way straight before me.

content: 10 For there is no sincerity on their lips; their heart is filled with malice; their throat is an open grave; their tongue slippery.
content_old: 10 For there is no sincerity on their lips; their heart is filled with malice; their throat is an open grave; their tongue slippery.

content: 11 Condemn them, O God; let them fall by their own devices; cast them out for their many crimes, for they defy You.
content_old: 11 Condemn them, O God; let them fall by their own devices; cast them out for their many crimes, for they defy You.

content: 12 But let all who take refuge in You rejoice, ever jubilant as You shelter them; and let those who love Your name exult in You.
content_old: 12 But let all who take refuge in You rejoice, ever jubilant as You shelter them; and let those who love Your name exult in You.

content: 1 For the leader; with instrumental music on the sheminith. A psalm of David.
content_old: 1 For the leader; with instrumental music on the sheminith. A psalm of David.

content: 2 O LORD, do not punish me in anger, do not chastise me in fury.
content_old: 2 O LORD, do not punish me in anger, do not chastise me in fury.

content: 3 Have mercy on me, O LORD, for I languish; heal me, O LORD, for my bones shake with terror.
content_old: 3 Have mercy on me, O LORD, for I languish; heal me, O LORD, for my bones shake with terror.

content: 4 My whole being is stricken with terror, while You, LORD—O, how long!
content_old: 4 My whole being is stricken with terror, while You, LORD—O, how long!

content: 5 O LORD, turn! Rescue me! Deliver me as befits Your faithfulness.
content_old: 5 O LORD, turn! Rescue me! Deliver me as befits Your faithfulness.

content: 6 For there is no praise of You among the dead; in Sheol, who can acclaim You?
content_old: 6 For there is no praise of You among the dead; in Sheol, who can acclaim You?

content: 7 I am weary with groaning; every night I drench my bed, I melt my couch in tears.
content_old: 7 I am weary with groaning; every night I drench my bed, I melt my couch in tears.

content: 8 My eyes are wasted by vexation, worn out because of all my foes.
content_old: 8 My eyes are wasted by vexation, worn out because of all my foes.

content: 9 Away from me, all you evildoers, for the LORD heeds the sound of my weeping.
content_old: 9 Away from me, all you evildoers, for the LORD heeds the sound of my weeping.

content: 10 The LORD heeds my plea, the LORD accepts my prayer.
content_old: 10 The LORD heeds my plea, the LORD accepts my prayer.

content: 1 Shiggaion of David, which he sang to the LORD, concerning Cush, a Benjaminite.
content_old: 1 Shiggaion of David, which he sang to the LORD, concerning Cush, a Benjaminite.

content: 2 O LORD, my God, in You I seek refuge; deliver me from all my pursuers and save me,
content_old: 2 O LORD, my God, in You I seek refuge; deliver me from all my pursuers and save me,

content: 3 lest, like a lion, they tear me apart, rending in pieces, and no one save me.
content_old: 3 lest, like a lion, they tear me apart, rending in pieces, and no one save me.

content: 4 O LORD, my God, if I have done such things, if my hands bear the guilt of wrongdoing,
content_old: 4 O LORD, my God, if I have done such things, if my hands bear the guilt of wrongdoing,

content: 5 if I have dealt evil to my ally, —I who rescued my foe without reward—
content_old: 5 if I have dealt evil to my ally, —I who rescued my foe without reward—

content: 6 then let the enemy pursue and overtake me; let him trample my life to the ground, and lay my body in the dust. Selah.
content_old: 6 then let the enemy pursue and overtake me; let him trample my life to the ground, and lay my body in the dust. Selah.

content: 7 Rise, O LORD, in Your anger; assert Yourself against the fury of my foes; bestir Yourself on my behalf; You have ordained judgment.
content_old: 7 Rise, O LORD, in Your anger; assert Yourself against the fury of my foes; bestir Yourself on my behalf; You have ordained judgment.

content: 8 Let the assembly of peoples gather about You, with You enthroned above, on high.
content_old: 8 Let the assembly of peoples gather about You, with You enthroned above, on high.

content: 9 The LORD judges the peoples; vindicate me, O LORD, for the righteousness and blamelessness that are mine.
content_old: 9 The LORD judges the peoples; vindicate me, O LORD, for the righteousness and blamelessness that are mine.

content: 10 Let the evil of the wicked come to an end, but establish the righteous; he who probes the mind and conscience is God the righteous.
content_old: 10 Let the evil of the wicked come to an end, but establish the righteous; he who probes the mind and conscience is God the righteous.

content: 11 I look to God to shield me; the deliverer of the upright.
content_old: 11 I look to God to shield me; the deliverer of the upright.

content: 12 God vindicates the righteous; God pronounces doom each day.
content_old: 12 God vindicates the righteous; God pronounces doom each day.

content: 13 If one does not turn back, but whets his sword, bends his bow and aims it,
content_old: 13 If one does not turn back, but whets his sword, bends his bow and aims it,

content: 14 then against himself he readies deadly weapons, and makes his arrows sharp.
content_old: 14 then against himself he readies deadly weapons, and makes his arrows sharp.

content: 15 See, he hatches evil, conceives mischief, and gives birth to fraud.
content_old: 15 See, he hatches evil, conceives mischief, and gives birth to fraud.

content: 16 He has dug a pit and deepened it, and will fall into the trap he made.
content_old: 16 He has dug a pit and deepened it, and will fall into the trap he made.

content: 17 His mischief will recoil upon his own head; his lawlessness will come down upon his skull.
content_old: 17 His mischief will recoil upon his own head; his lawlessness will come down upon his skull.

content: 1 For the leader; on the gittith. A psalm of David.
content_old: 1 For the leader; on the gittith. A psalm of David.

content: 2 O LORD, our Lord, How majestic is Your name throughout the earth, You who have covered the heavens with Your splendor!
content_old: 2 O LORD, our Lord, How majestic is Your name throughout the earth, You who have covered the heavens with Your splendor!

content: 3 From the mouths of infants and sucklings You have founded strength on account of Your foes, to put an end to enemy and avenger.
content_old: 3 From the mouths of infants and sucklings You have founded strength on account of Your foes, to put an end to enemy and avenger.

content: 4 When I behold Your heavens, the work of Your fingers, the moon and stars that You set in place,
content_old: 4 When I behold Your heavens, the work of Your fingers, the moon and stars that You set in place,

content: 5 what is man that You have been mindful of him, mortal man that You have taken note of him,
content_old: 5 what is man that You have been mindful of him, mortal man that You have taken note of him,

content: 6 that You have made him little less than divine, and adorned him with glory and majesty;
content_old: 6 that You have made him little less than divine, and adorned him with glory and majesty;

content: 7 You have made him master over Your handiwork, laying the world at his feet,
content_old: 7 You have made him master over Your handiwork, laying the world at his feet,

content: 8 sheep and oxen, all of them, and wild beasts, too;
content_old: 8 sheep and oxen, all of them, and wild beasts, too;

content: 9 the birds of the heavens, the fish of the sea, whatever travels the paths of the seas.
content_old: 9 the birds of the heavens, the fish of the sea, whatever travels the paths of the seas.

content: 1 For the leader; ˓almuth labben. A psalm of David.
content_old: 1 For the leader; ˓almuth labben. A psalm of David.

content: 2 I will praise You, LORD, with all my heart; I will tell all Your wonders.
content_old: 2 I will praise You, LORD, with all my heart; I will tell all Your wonders.

content: 3 I will rejoice and exult in You, singing a hymn to Your name, O Most High.
content_old: 3 I will rejoice and exult in You, singing a hymn to Your name, O Most High.

content: 4 When my enemies retreat, they stumble to their doom at Your presence.
content_old: 4 When my enemies retreat, they stumble to their doom at Your presence.

content: 5 For You uphold my right and claim, enthroned as righteous judge.
content_old: 5 For You uphold my right and claim, enthroned as righteous judge.

content: 6 You blast the nations; You destroy the wicked; You blot out their name forever.
content_old: 6 You blast the nations; You destroy the wicked; You blot out their name forever.

content: 7 The enemy is no more— ruins everlasting; You have torn down their cities; their very names are lost.
content_old: 7 The enemy is no more— ruins everlasting; You have torn down their cities; their very names are lost.

content: 8 But the LORD abides forever; He has set up His throne for judgment;
content_old: 8 But the LORD abides forever; He has set up His throne for judgment;

content: 9 it is He who judges the world with righteousness, rules the peoples with equity.
content_old: 9 it is He who judges the world with righteousness, rules the peoples with equity.

content: 10 The LORD is a haven for the oppressed, a haven in times of trouble.
content_old: 10 The LORD is a haven for the oppressed, a haven in times of trouble.

content: 11 Those who know Your name trust You, for You do not abandon those who turn to You, O LORD.
content_old: 11 Those who know Your name trust You, for You do not abandon those who turn to You, O LORD.

content: 12 Sing a hymn to the LORD, who reigns in Zion; declare His deeds among the peoples.
content_old: 12 Sing a hymn to the LORD, who reigns in Zion; declare His deeds among the peoples.

content: 13 For He does not ignore the cry of the afflicted; He who requites bloodshed is mindful of them.
content_old: 13 For He does not ignore the cry of the afflicted; He who requites bloodshed is mindful of them.

content: 14 Have mercy on me, O LORD; see my affliction at the hands of my foes, You who lift me from the gates of death,
content_old: 14 Have mercy on me, O LORD; see my affliction at the hands of my foes, You who lift me from the gates of death,

content: 15 so that in the gates of Fair Zion I might tell all Your praise, I might exult in Your deliverance.
content_old: 15 so that in the gates of Fair Zion I might tell all Your praise, I might exult in Your deliverance.

content: 16 The nations sink in the pit they have made; their own foot is caught in the net they have hidden.
content_old: 16 The nations sink in the pit they have made; their own foot is caught in the net they have hidden.

content: 17 The LORD has made Himself known: He works judgment; the wicked man is snared by his own devices. Higgaion. Selah.
content_old: 17 The LORD has made Himself known: He works judgment; the wicked man is snared by his own devices. Higgaion. Selah.

content: 18 Let the wicked be in Sheol, all the nations who ignore God!
content_old: 18 Let the wicked be in Sheol, all the nations who ignore God!

content: 19 Not always shall the needy be ignored, nor the hope of the afflicted forever lost.
content_old: 19 Not always shall the needy be ignored, nor the hope of the afflicted forever lost.

content: 20 Rise, O LORD! Let not men have power; let the nations be judged in Your presence.
content_old: 20 Rise, O LORD! Let not men have power; let the nations be judged in Your presence.

content: 1 Why, O LORD, do You stand aloof, heedless in times of trouble?
content_old: 1 Why, O LORD, do You stand aloof, heedless in times of trouble?

content: 2 The wicked in his arrogance hounds the lowly— may they be caught in the schemes they devise!
content_old: 2 The wicked in his arrogance hounds the lowly— may they be caught in the schemes they devise!

content: 3 The wicked crows about his unbridled lusts; the grasping man reviles and scorns the LORD.
content_old: 3 The wicked crows about his unbridled lusts; the grasping man reviles and scorns the LORD.

content: 4 The wicked, arrogant as he is, in all his scheming thinks, “He does not call to account; God does not care.”
content_old: 4 The wicked, arrogant as he is, in all his scheming thinks, “He does not call to account; God does not care.”

content: 5 His ways prosper at all times; Your judgments are far beyond him; he snorts at all his foes.
content_old: 5 His ways prosper at all times; Your judgments are far beyond him; he snorts at all his foes.

content: 6 He thinks, “I shall not be shaken, through all time never be in trouble.”
content_old: 6 He thinks, “I shall not be shaken, through all time never be in trouble.”

content: 7 His mouth is full of oaths, deceit, and fraud; mischief and evil are under his tongue.
content_old: 7 His mouth is full of oaths, deceit, and fraud; mischief and evil are under his tongue.

content: 8 He lurks in outlying places; from a covert he slays the innocent; his eyes spy out the hapless.
content_old: 8 He lurks in outlying places; from a covert he slays the innocent; his eyes spy out the hapless.

content: 9 He waits in a covert like a lion in his lair; waits to seize the lowly; he seizes the lowly as he pulls his net shut;
content_old: 9 He waits in a covert like a lion in his lair; waits to seize the lowly; he seizes the lowly as he pulls his net shut;

content: 10 he stoops, he crouches, and the hapless fall prey to his might.
content_old: 10 he stoops, he crouches, and the hapless fall prey to his might.

content: 11 He thinks, “God is not mindful, He hides His face, He never looks.”
content_old: 11 He thinks, “God is not mindful, He hides His face, He never looks.”

content: 12 Rise, O LORD! Strike at him, O God! Do not forget the lowly.
content_old: 12 Rise, O LORD! Strike at him, O God! Do not forget the lowly.

content: 13 Why should the wicked man scorn God, thinking You do not call to account?
content_old: 13 Why should the wicked man scorn God, thinking You do not call to account?

content: 14 You do look! You take note of mischief and vexation! To requite is in Your power. To You the hapless can entrust himself; You have ever been the orphan’s help.
content_old: 14 You do look! You take note of mischief and vexation! To requite is in Your power. To You the hapless can entrust himself; You have ever been the orphan’s help.

content: 15 O break the power of the wicked and evil man, so that when You look for his wickedness You will find it no more.
content_old: 15 O break the power of the wicked and evil man, so that when You look for his wickedness You will find it no more.

content: 16 The LORD is king for ever and ever; the nations will perish from His land.
content_old: 16 The LORD is king for ever and ever; the nations will perish from His land.

content: 17 You will listen to the entreaty of the lowly, O LORD, You will make their hearts firm; You will incline Your ear
content_old: 17 You will listen to the entreaty of the lowly, O LORD, You will make their hearts firm; You will incline Your ear

content: 1 For the leader. Of David. In the LORD I take refuge; how can you say to me, “Take to the hills like a bird!
content_old: 1 For the leader. Of David. In the LORD I take refuge; how can you say to me, “Take to the hills like a bird!

content: 2 For see, the wicked bend the bow, they set their arrow on the string to shoot from the shadows at the upright.
content_old: 2 For see, the wicked bend the bow, they set their arrow on the string to shoot from the shadows at the upright.

content: 3 When the foundations are destroyed, what can the righteous man do?”
content_old: 3 When the foundations are destroyed, what can the righteous man do?”

content: 4 The LORD is in His holy palace; the LORD—His throne is in heaven; His eyes behold, His gaze searches mankind.
content_old: 4 The LORD is in His holy palace; the LORD—His throne is in heaven; His eyes behold, His gaze searches mankind.

content: 5 The LORD seeks out the righteous man, but loathes the wicked one who loves injustice.
content_old: 5 The LORD seeks out the righteous man, but loathes the wicked one who loves injustice.

content: 6 He will rain down upon the wicked blazing coals and sulfur; a scorching wind shall be their lot.
content_old: 6 He will rain down upon the wicked blazing coals and sulfur; a scorching wind shall be their lot.

content: 1 For the leader; on the sheminith. A psalm of David.
content_old: 1 For the leader; on the sheminith. A psalm of David.

content: 2 Help, O LORD! For the faithful are no more; the loyal have vanished from among men.
content_old: 2 Help, O LORD! For the faithful are no more; the loyal have vanished from among men.

content: 3 Men speak lies to one another; their speech is smooth; they talk with duplicity.
content_old: 3 Men speak lies to one another; their speech is smooth; they talk with duplicity.

content: 4 May the LORD cut off all flattering lips, every tongue that speaks arrogance.
content_old: 4 May the LORD cut off all flattering lips, every tongue that speaks arrogance.

content: 5 They say, “By our tongues we shall prevail; with lips such as ours, who can be our master?”
content_old: 5 They say, “By our tongues we shall prevail; with lips such as ours, who can be our master?”

content: 6 “Because of the groans of the plundered poor and needy, I will now act,” says the LORD. “I will give help,” He affirms to him.
content_old: 6 “Because of the groans of the plundered poor and needy, I will now act,” says the LORD. “I will give help,” He affirms to him.

content: 7 The words of the LORD are pure words, silver purged in an earthen crucible, refined sevenfold.
content_old: 7 The words of the LORD are pure words, silver purged in an earthen crucible, refined sevenfold.

content: 8 You, O LORD, will keep them, guarding each from this age evermore.
content_old: 8 You, O LORD, will keep them, guarding each from this age evermore.

content: 1 For the leader. A psalm of David.
content_old: 1 For the leader. A psalm of David.

content: 2 How long, O LORD; will You ignore me forever? How long will You hide Your face from me?
content_old: 2 How long, O LORD; will You ignore me forever? How long will You hide Your face from me?

content: 3 How long will I have cares on my mind, grief in my heart all day? How long will my enemy have the upper hand?
content_old: 3 How long will I have cares on my mind, grief in my heart all day? How long will my enemy have the upper hand?

content: 4 Look at me, answer me, O LORD, my God! Restore the luster to my eyes, lest I sleep the sleep of death;
content_old: 4 Look at me, answer me, O LORD, my God! Restore the luster to my eyes, lest I sleep the sleep of death;

content: 5 lest my enemy say, “I have overcome him,” my foes exult when I totter.
content_old: 5 lest my enemy say, “I have overcome him,” my foes exult when I totter.

content: 1 For the leader. Of David. The benighted man thinks, “God does not care.” Man’s deeds are corrupt and loathsome; no one does good.
content_old: 1 For the leader. Of David. The benighted man thinks, “God does not care.” Man’s deeds are corrupt and loathsome; no one does good.

content: 2 The LORD looks down from heaven on mankind to find a man of understanding, a man mindful of God.
content_old: 2 The LORD looks down from heaven on mankind to find a man of understanding, a man mindful of God.

content: 3 All have turned bad, altogether foul; there is none who does good, not even one.
content_old: 3 All have turned bad, altogether foul; there is none who does good, not even one.

content: 4 Are they so witless, all those evildoers, who devour my people as they devour food, and do not invoke the LORD?
content_old: 4 Are they so witless, all those evildoers, who devour my people as they devour food, and do not invoke the LORD?

content: 5 There they will be seized with fright, for God is present in the circle of the righteous.
content_old: 5 There they will be seized with fright, for God is present in the circle of the righteous.

content: 6 You may set at naught the counsel of the lowly, but the LORD is his refuge.
content_old: 6 You may set at naught the counsel of the lowly, but the LORD is his refuge.

content: 1 A psalm of David. LORD, who may sojourn in Your tent, who may dwell on Your holy mountain?
content_old: 1 A psalm of David. LORD, who may sojourn in Your tent, who may dwell on Your holy mountain?

content: 2 He who lives without blame, who does what is right, and in his heart acknowledges the truth;
content_old: 2 He who lives without blame, who does what is right, and in his heart acknowledges the truth;

content: 3 whose tongue is not given to evil; who has never done harm to his fellow, or borne reproach forhis acts toward his neighbor;
content_old: 3 whose tongue is not given to evil; who has never done harm to his fellow, or borne reproach forhis acts toward his neighbor;

content: 4 for whom a contemptible man is abhorrent, but who honors those who fear the LORD; who stands by his oath even to his hurt;
content_old: 4 for whom a contemptible man is abhorrent, but who honors those who fear the LORD; who stands by his oath even to his hurt;

content: 1 A michtam of David. Protect me, O God, for I seek refuge in You.
content_old: 1 A michtam of David. Protect me, O God, for I seek refuge in You.

content: 2 I say to the LORD, “You are my Lord, my benefactor; there is none above You.”
content_old: 2 I say to the LORD, “You are my Lord, my benefactor; there is none above You.”

content: 3 As to the holy and mighty ones that are in the land, my whole desire concerning them is that
content_old: 3 As to the holy and mighty ones that are in the land, my whole desire concerning them is that

content: 4 those who espouse another god may have many sorrows! I will have no part of their bloody libations; their names will not pass my lips.
content_old: 4 those who espouse another god may have many sorrows! I will have no part of their bloody libations; their names will not pass my lips.

content: 5 The LORD is my allotted share and portion; You control my fate.
content_old: 5 The LORD is my allotted share and portion; You control my fate.

content: 6 Delightful country has fallen to my lot; lovely indeed is my estate.
content_old: 6 Delightful country has fallen to my lot; lovely indeed is my estate.

content: 7 I bless the LORD who has guided me; my conscience admonishes me at night.
content_old: 7 I bless the LORD who has guided me; my conscience admonishes me at night.

content: 8 I am ever mindful of the LORD’s presence; He is at my right hand; I shall never be shaken.
content_old: 8 I am ever mindful of the LORD’s presence; He is at my right hand; I shall never be shaken.

content: 9 So my heart rejoices, my whole being exults, and my body rests secure.
content_old: 9 So my heart rejoices, my whole being exults, and my body rests secure.

content: 10 For You will not abandon me to Sheol, or let Your faithful one see the Pit.
content_old: 10 For You will not abandon me to Sheol, or let Your faithful one see the Pit.

content: 1 A prayer of David. Hear, O LORD, what is just; heed my cry, give ear to my prayer, uttered without guile.
content_old: 1 A prayer of David. Hear, O LORD, what is just; heed my cry, give ear to my prayer, uttered without guile.

content: 2 My vindication will come from You; Your eyes will behold what is right.
content_old: 2 My vindication will come from You; Your eyes will behold what is right.

content: 3 You have visited me at night, probed my mind, You have tested me and found nothing amiss; I determined that my mouth should not transgress.
content_old: 3 You have visited me at night, probed my mind, You have tested me and found nothing amiss; I determined that my mouth should not transgress.

content: 4 As for man’s dealings, in accord with the command of Your lips, I have kept in view the fate of the lawless.
content_old: 4 As for man’s dealings, in accord with the command of Your lips, I have kept in view the fate of the lawless.

content: 5 My feet have held to Your paths; my legs have not given way.
content_old: 5 My feet have held to Your paths; my legs have not given way.

content: 6 I call on You; You will answer me, God; turn Your ear to me, hear what I say.
content_old: 6 I call on You; You will answer me, God; turn Your ear to me, hear what I say.

content: 7 Display Your faithfulness in wondrous deeds, You who deliver with Your right hand those who seek refuge from assailants.
content_old: 7 Display Your faithfulness in wondrous deeds, You who deliver with Your right hand those who seek refuge from assailants.

content: 8 Guard me like the apple of Your eye; hide me in the shadow of Your wings
content_old: 8 Guard me like the apple of Your eye; hide me in the shadow of Your wings

content: 9 from the wicked who despoil me, my mortal enemies who encircle me.
content_old: 9 from the wicked who despoil me, my mortal enemies who encircle me.

content: 10 Their hearts are closed to pity; they mouth arrogance;
content_old: 10 Their hearts are closed to pity; they mouth arrogance;

content: 11 now they hem in our feet on every side; they set their eyes roaming over the land.
content_old: 11 now they hem in our feet on every side; they set their eyes roaming over the land.

content: 12 He is like a lion eager for prey, a king of beasts lying in wait.
content_old: 12 He is like a lion eager for prey, a king of beasts lying in wait.

content: 13 Rise, O LORD! Go forth to meet him. Bring him down; rescue me from the wicked with Your sword,
content_old: 13 Rise, O LORD! Go forth to meet him. Bring him down; rescue me from the wicked with Your sword,

content: 14 from men, O LORD, with Your hand, from men whose share in life is fleeting. But as to Your treasured ones, fill their bellies. Their sons too shall be satisfied, and have something to leave over for their young.
content_old: 14 from men, O LORD, with Your hand, from men whose share in life is fleeting. But as to Your treasured ones, fill their bellies. Their sons too shall be satisfied, and have something to leave over for their young.

content: 1 For the leader. Of David, the servant of the LORD, who addressed the words of this song to the LORD after the LORD had saved him from the hands of all his enemies and from the clutches of Saul.
content_old: 1 For the leader. Of David, the servant of the LORD, who addressed the words of this song to the LORD after the LORD had saved him from the hands of all his enemies and from the clutches of Saul.

content: 2 He said: I adore you, O LORD, my strength,
content_old: 2 He said: I adore you, O LORD, my strength,

content: 3 O LORD, my crag, my fortress, my rescuer, my God, my rock in whom I seek refuge, my shield, my mighty champion, my haven.
content_old: 3 O LORD, my crag, my fortress, my rescuer, my God, my rock in whom I seek refuge, my shield, my mighty champion, my haven.

content: 4 All praise! I called on the LORD and was delivered from my enemies.
content_old: 4 All praise! I called on the LORD and was delivered from my enemies.

content: 5 Ropes of Death encompassed me; torrents of Belial terrified me;
content_old: 5 Ropes of Death encompassed me; torrents of Belial terrified me;

content: 6 ropes of Sheol encircled me; snares of Death confronted me.
content_old: 6 ropes of Sheol encircled me; snares of Death confronted me.

content: 7 In my distress I called on the LORD, cried out to my God; in His temple He heard my voice; my cry to Him reached His ears.
content_old: 7 In my distress I called on the LORD, cried out to my God; in His temple He heard my voice; my cry to Him reached His ears.

content: 8 Then the earth rocked and quaked; the foundations of the mountains shook, rocked by His indignation;
content_old: 8 Then the earth rocked and quaked; the foundations of the mountains shook, rocked by His indignation;

content: 9 smoke went up from His nostrils, from His mouth came devouring fire; live coals blazed forth from Him.
content_old: 9 smoke went up from His nostrils, from His mouth came devouring fire; live coals blazed forth from Him.

content: 10 He bent the sky and came down, thick cloud beneath His feet.
content_old: 10 He bent the sky and came down, thick cloud beneath His feet.

content: 11 He mounted a cherub and flew, gliding on the wings of the wind.
content_old: 11 He mounted a cherub and flew, gliding on the wings of the wind.

content: 12 He made darkness His screen; dark thunderheads, dense clouds of the sky were His pavilion round about Him.
content_old: 12 He made darkness His screen; dark thunderheads, dense clouds of the sky were His pavilion round about Him.

content: 13 Out of the brilliance before Him, hail and fiery coals pierced His clouds.
content_old: 13 Out of the brilliance before Him, hail and fiery coals pierced His clouds.

content: 14 Then the LORD thundered from heaven, the Most High gave forth His voice— hail and fiery coals.
content_old: 14 Then the LORD thundered from heaven, the Most High gave forth His voice— hail and fiery coals.

content: 15 He let fly His shafts and scattered them; He discharged lightning and routed them.
content_old: 15 He let fly His shafts and scattered them; He discharged lightning and routed them.

content: 16 The ocean bed was exposed; the foundations of the world were laid bare by Your mighty roaring, O LORD, at the blast of the breath of Your nostrils.
content_old: 16 The ocean bed was exposed; the foundations of the world were laid bare by Your mighty roaring, O LORD, at the blast of the breath of Your nostrils.

content: 17 He reached down from on high, He took me; He drew me out of the mighty waters;
content_old: 17 He reached down from on high, He took me; He drew me out of the mighty waters;

content: 18 He saved me from my fierce enemy, from foes too strong for me.
content_old: 18 He saved me from my fierce enemy, from foes too strong for me.

content: 19 They confronted me on the day of my calamity, but the LORD was my support.
content_old: 19 They confronted me on the day of my calamity, but the LORD was my support.

content: 20 He brought me out to freedom; He rescued me because He was pleased with me.
content_old: 20 He brought me out to freedom; He rescued me because He was pleased with me.

content: 21 The LORD rewarded me according to my merit; He requited the cleanness of my hands;
content_old: 21 The LORD rewarded me according to my merit; He requited the cleanness of my hands;

content: 22 for I have kept to the ways of the LORD, and have not been guilty before my God;
content_old: 22 for I have kept to the ways of the LORD, and have not been guilty before my God;

content: 23 for I am mindful of all His rules; I have not disregarded His laws.
content_old: 23 for I am mindful of all His rules; I have not disregarded His laws.

content: 24 I have been blameless toward Him, and have guarded myself against sinning;
content_old: 24 I have been blameless toward Him, and have guarded myself against sinning;

content: 25 and the LORD has requited me according to my merit, the cleanness of my hands in His sight.
content_old: 25 and the LORD has requited me according to my merit, the cleanness of my hands in His sight.

content: 26 With the loyal, You deal loyally; with the blameless man, blamelessly.
content_old: 26 With the loyal, You deal loyally; with the blameless man, blamelessly.

content: 27 With the pure, You act purely, and with the perverse, You are wily.
content_old: 27 With the pure, You act purely, and with the perverse, You are wily.

content: 28 It is You who deliver lowly folk, but haughty eyes You humble.
content_old: 28 It is You who deliver lowly folk, but haughty eyes You humble.

content: 29 It is You who light my lamp; the LORD, my God, lights up my darkness.
content_old: 29 It is You who light my lamp; the LORD, my God, lights up my darkness.

content: 30 With You, I can rush a barrier; with my God I can scale a wall;
content_old: 30 With You, I can rush a barrier; with my God I can scale a wall;

content: 31 the way of God is perfect; the word of the LORD is pure; He is a shield to all who seek refuge in Him.
content_old: 31 the way of God is perfect; the word of the LORD is pure; He is a shield to all who seek refuge in Him.

content: 32 Truly, who is a god except the LORD, who is a rock but our God?—
content_old: 32 Truly, who is a god except the LORD, who is a rock but our God?—

content: 33 the God who girded me with might, who made my way perfect;
content_old: 33 the God who girded me with might, who made my way perfect;

content: 34 who made my legs like a deer’s, and let me stand firm on the heights;
content_old: 34 who made my legs like a deer’s, and let me stand firm on the heights;

content: 35 who trained my hands for battle; my arms can bend a bow of bronze.
content_old: 35 who trained my hands for battle; my arms can bend a bow of bronze.

content: 36 You have given me the shield of Your protection; Your right hand has sustained me, Your care has made me great.
content_old: 36 You have given me the shield of Your protection; Your right hand has sustained me, Your care has made me great.

content: 37 You have let me stride on freely; my feet have not slipped.
content_old: 37 You have let me stride on freely; my feet have not slipped.

content: 38 I pursued my enemies and overtook them; I did not turn back till I destroyed them.
content_old: 38 I pursued my enemies and overtook them; I did not turn back till I destroyed them.

content: 39 I struck them down, and they could rise no more; they lay fallen at my feet.
content_old: 39 I struck them down, and they could rise no more; they lay fallen at my feet.

content: 40 You have girded me with strength for battle, brought my adversaries low before me,
content_old: 40 You have girded me with strength for battle, brought my adversaries low before me,

content: 41 made my enemies turn tail before me; I wiped out my foes.
content_old: 41 made my enemies turn tail before me; I wiped out my foes.

content: 42 They cried out, but there was none to deliver; to the LORD, but He did not answer them.
content_old: 42 They cried out, but there was none to deliver; to the LORD, but He did not answer them.

content: 43 I ground them fine as windswept dust; I trod them flat as dirt of the streets.
content_old: 43 I ground them fine as windswept dust; I trod them flat as dirt of the streets.

content: 44 You have rescued me from the strife of people; You have set me at the head of nations; peoples I knew not must serve me.
content_old: 44 You have rescued me from the strife of people; You have set me at the head of nations; peoples I knew not must serve me.

content: 45 At the mere report of me they are submissive; foreign peoples cower before me;
content_old: 45 At the mere report of me they are submissive; foreign peoples cower before me;

content: 46 foreign peoples lose courage, and come trembling out of their strongholds.
content_old: 46 foreign peoples lose courage, and come trembling out of their strongholds.

content: 47 The LORD lives! Blessed is my rock! Exalted be God, my deliverer,
content_old: 47 The LORD lives! Blessed is my rock! Exalted be God, my deliverer,

content: 48 the God who has vindicated me and made peoples subject to me,
content_old: 48 the God who has vindicated me and made peoples subject to me,

content: 49 who rescued me from my enemies, who raised me clear of my adversaries, saved me from lawless men.
content_old: 49 who rescued me from my enemies, who raised me clear of my adversaries, saved me from lawless men.

content: 50 For this I sing Your praise among the nations, LORD, and hymn Your name:
content_old: 50 For this I sing Your praise among the nations, LORD, and hymn Your name:

content: 1 For the leader. A psalm of David.
content_old: 1 For the leader. A psalm of David.

content: 2 The heavens declare the glory of God, the sky proclaims His handiwork.
content_old: 2 The heavens declare the glory of God, the sky proclaims His handiwork.

content: 3 Day to day makes utterance, night to night speaks out.
content_old: 3 Day to day makes utterance, night to night speaks out.

content: 4 There is no utterance, there are no words, whose sound goes unheard.
content_old: 4 There is no utterance, there are no words, whose sound goes unheard.

content: 5 Their voice carries throughout the earth, their words to the end of the world. He placed in them a tent for the sun,
content_old: 5 Their voice carries throughout the earth, their words to the end of the world. He placed in them a tent for the sun,

content: 6 who is like a groom coming forth from the chamber, like a hero, eager to run his course.
content_old: 6 who is like a groom coming forth from the chamber, like a hero, eager to run his course.

content: 7 His rising-place is at one end of heaven, and his circuit reaches the other; nothing escapes his heat.
content_old: 7 His rising-place is at one end of heaven, and his circuit reaches the other; nothing escapes his heat.

content: 8 The teaching of the LORD is perfect, renewing life; the decrees of the LORD are enduring, making the simple wise;
content_old: 8 The teaching of the LORD is perfect, renewing life; the decrees of the LORD are enduring, making the simple wise;

content: 9 The precepts of the LORD are just, rejoicing the heart; the instruction of the LORD is lucid, making the eyes light up.
content_old: 9 The precepts of the LORD are just, rejoicing the heart; the instruction of the LORD is lucid, making the eyes light up.

content: 10 The fear of the LORD is pure, abiding forever; the judgments of the LORD are true, righteous altogether,
content_old: 10 The fear of the LORD is pure, abiding forever; the judgments of the LORD are true, righteous altogether,

content: 11 more desirable than gold, than much fine gold; sweeter than honey, than drippings of the comb.
content_old: 11 more desirable than gold, than much fine gold; sweeter than honey, than drippings of the comb.

content: 12 Your servant pays them heed; in obeying them there is much reward.
content_old: 12 Your servant pays them heed; in obeying them there is much reward.

content: 13 Who can be aware of errors? Clear me of unperceived guilt,
content_old: 13 Who can be aware of errors? Clear me of unperceived guilt,

content: 14 and from willful sins keep Your servant; let them not dominate me; then shall I be blameless and clear of grave offense.
content_old: 14 and from willful sins keep Your servant; let them not dominate me; then shall I be blameless and clear of grave offense.

content: 1 For the leader. A psalm of David.
content_old: 1 For the leader. A psalm of David.

content: 2 May the LORD answer you in time of trouble, the name of Jacob’s God keep you safe.
content_old: 2 May the LORD answer you in time of trouble, the name of Jacob’s God keep you safe.

content: 3 May He send you help from the sanctuary, and sustain you from Zion.
content_old: 3 May He send you help from the sanctuary, and sustain you from Zion.

content: 4 May He receive the tokens of all your meal offerings, and approve your burnt offerings. Selah.
content_old: 4 May He receive the tokens of all your meal offerings, and approve your burnt offerings. Selah.

content: 5 May He grant you your desire, and fulfill your every plan.
content_old: 5 May He grant you your desire, and fulfill your every plan.

content: 6 May we shout for joy in your victory, arrayed by standards in the name of our God. May the LORD fulfill your every wish.
content_old: 6 May we shout for joy in your victory, arrayed by standards in the name of our God. May the LORD fulfill your every wish.

content: 7 Now I know that the LORD will give victory to His anointed, will answer him from His heavenly sanctuary with the mighty victories of His right arm.
content_old: 7 Now I know that the LORD will give victory to His anointed, will answer him from His heavenly sanctuary with the mighty victories of His right arm.

content: 8 They call on chariots, they call on horses, but we call on the name of the LORD our God.
content_old: 8 They call on chariots, they call on horses, but we call on the name of the LORD our God.

content: 9 They collapse and lie fallen, but we rally and gather strength.
content_old: 9 They collapse and lie fallen, but we rally and gather strength.

content: 1 For the leader. A psalm of David.
content_old: 1 For the leader. A psalm of David.

content: 2 O LORD, the king rejoices in Your strength; how greatly he exults in Your victory!
content_old: 2 O LORD, the king rejoices in Your strength; how greatly he exults in Your victory!

content: 3 You have granted him the desire of his heart, have not denied the request of his lips. Selah.
content_old: 3 You have granted him the desire of his heart, have not denied the request of his lips. Selah.

content: 4 You have proffered him blessings of good things, have set upon his head a crown of fine gold.
content_old: 4 You have proffered him blessings of good things, have set upon his head a crown of fine gold.

content: 5 He asked You for life; You granted it; a long life, everlasting.
content_old: 5 He asked You for life; You granted it; a long life, everlasting.

content: 6 Great is his glory through Your victory; You have endowed him with splendor and majesty.
content_old: 6 Great is his glory through Your victory; You have endowed him with splendor and majesty.

content: 7 You have made him blessed forever, gladdened him with the joy of Your presence.
content_old: 7 You have made him blessed forever, gladdened him with the joy of Your presence.

content: 8 For the king trusts in the LORD; Through the faithfulness of the Most High he will not be shaken.
content_old: 8 For the king trusts in the LORD; Through the faithfulness of the Most High he will not be shaken.

content: 9 Your hand is equal to all Your enemies; Your right hand overpowers Your foes.
content_old: 9 Your hand is equal to all Your enemies; Your right hand overpowers Your foes.

content: 10 You set them ablaze like a furnace when You show Your presence. The LORD in anger destroys them; fire consumes them.
content_old: 10 You set them ablaze like a furnace when You show Your presence. The LORD in anger destroys them; fire consumes them.

content: 11 You wipe their offspring from the earth, their issue from among men.
content_old: 11 You wipe their offspring from the earth, their issue from among men.

content: 12 For they schemed against You; they laid plans, but could not succeed.
content_old: 12 For they schemed against You; they laid plans, but could not succeed.

content: 13 For You make them turn back by Your bows aimed at their face.
content_old: 13 For You make them turn back by Your bows aimed at their face.

content: 1 For the leader; on ayyeleth ha-shahar. A psalm of David.
content_old: 1 For the leader; on ayyeleth ha-shahar. A psalm of David.

content: 2 My God, my God, why have You abandoned me; why so far from delivering me and from my anguished roaring?
content_old: 2 My God, my God, why have You abandoned me; why so far from delivering me and from my anguished roaring?

content: 3 My God, I cry by day—You answer not; by night, and have no respite.
content_old: 3 My God, I cry by day—You answer not; by night, and have no respite.

content: 4 But You are the Holy One, enthroned, the Praise of Israel.
content_old: 4 But You are the Holy One, enthroned, the Praise of Israel.

content: 5 In You our fathers trusted; they trusted, and You rescued them.
content_old: 5 In You our fathers trusted; they trusted, and You rescued them.

content: 6 To You they cried out and they escaped; in You they trusted and were not disappointed.
content_old: 6 To You they cried out and they escaped; in You they trusted and were not disappointed.

content: 7 But I am a worm, less than human; scorned by men, despised by people.
content_old: 7 But I am a worm, less than human; scorned by men, despised by people.

content: 8 All who see me mock me; they curl their lips, they shake their heads.
content_old: 8 All who see me mock me; they curl their lips, they shake their heads.

content: 9 “Let him commit himself to the LORD; let Him rescue him, let Him save him, for He is pleased with him.”
content_old: 9 “Let him commit himself to the LORD; let Him rescue him, let Him save him, for He is pleased with him.”

content: 10 You drew me from the womb, made me secure at my mother’s breast.
content_old: 10 You drew me from the womb, made me secure at my mother’s breast.

content: 11 I became Your charge at birth; from my mother’s womb You have been my God.
content_old: 11 I became Your charge at birth; from my mother’s womb You have been my God.

content: 12 Do not be far from me, for trouble is near, and there is none to help.
content_old: 12 Do not be far from me, for trouble is near, and there is none to help.

content: 13 Many bulls surround me, mighty ones of Bashan encircle me.
content_old: 13 Many bulls surround me, mighty ones of Bashan encircle me.

content: 14 They open their mouths at me like tearing, roaring lions.
content_old: 14 They open their mouths at me like tearing, roaring lions.

content: 15 My life ebbs away: all my bones are disjointed; my heart is like wax, melting within me;
content_old: 15 My life ebbs away: all my bones are disjointed; my heart is like wax, melting within me;

content: 16 my vigor dries up like a shard; my tongue cleaves to my palate; You commit me to the dust of death.
content_old: 16 my vigor dries up like a shard; my tongue cleaves to my palate; You commit me to the dust of death.

content: 17 Dogs surround me; a pack of evil ones closes in on me, like lionsthey maul my hands and feet.
content_old: 17 Dogs surround me; a pack of evil ones closes in on me, like lionsthey maul my hands and feet.

content: 18 I take the count of all my bones while they look on and gloat.
content_old: 18 I take the count of all my bones while they look on and gloat.

content: 19 They divide my clothes among themselves, casting lots for my garments.
content_old: 19 They divide my clothes among themselves, casting lots for my garments.

content: 20 But You, O LORD, be not far off; my strength, hasten to my aid.
content_old: 20 But You, O LORD, be not far off; my strength, hasten to my aid.

content: 21 Save my life from the sword, my precious life from the clutches of a dog.
content_old: 21 Save my life from the sword, my precious life from the clutches of a dog.

content: 22 Deliver me from a lion’s mouth; from the horns of wild oxen rescue me.
content_old: 22 Deliver me from a lion’s mouth; from the horns of wild oxen rescue me.

content: 23 Then will I proclaim Your fame to my brethren, praise You in the congregation.
content_old: 23 Then will I proclaim Your fame to my brethren, praise You in the congregation.

content: 24 You who fear the LORD, praise Him! All you offspring of Jacob, honor Him! Be in dread of Him, all you offspring of Israel!
content_old: 24 You who fear the LORD, praise Him! All you offspring of Jacob, honor Him! Be in dread of Him, all you offspring of Israel!

content: 25 For He did not scorn, He did not spurn the plea of the lowly; He did not hide His face from him; when he cried out to Him, He listened.
content_old: 25 For He did not scorn, He did not spurn the plea of the lowly; He did not hide His face from him; when he cried out to Him, He listened.

content: 26 Because of You I offer praise in the great congregation; I pay my vows in the presence of His worshipers.
content_old: 26 Because of You I offer praise in the great congregation; I pay my vows in the presence of His worshipers.

content: 27 Let the lowly eat and be satisfied; let all who seek the LORD praise Him. Always be of good cheer!
content_old: 27 Let the lowly eat and be satisfied; let all who seek the LORD praise Him. Always be of good cheer!

content: 28 Let all the ends of the earth pay heed and turn to the LORD, and the peoples of all nations prostrate themselves before You;
content_old: 28 Let all the ends of the earth pay heed and turn to the LORD, and the peoples of all nations prostrate themselves before You;

content: 29 for kingship is the LORD’s and He rules the nations.
content_old: 29 for kingship is the LORD’s and He rules the nations.

content: 30 All those in full vigor shall eat and prostrate themselves; all those at death’s door, whose spirits flag, shall bend the knee before Him.
content_old: 30 All those in full vigor shall eat and prostrate themselves; all those at death’s door, whose spirits flag, shall bend the knee before Him.

content: 31 Offspring shall serve Him; the LORD’s fame shall be proclaimed to the generation
content_old: 31 Offspring shall serve Him; the LORD’s fame shall be proclaimed to the generation

content: 1 A psalm of David. The LORD is my shepherd; I lack nothing.
content_old: 1 A psalm of David. The LORD is my shepherd; I lack nothing.

content: 2 He makes me lie down in green pastures; He leads me to water in places of repose;
content_old: 2 He makes me lie down in green pastures; He leads me to water in places of repose;

content: 3 He renews my life; He guides me in right paths as befits His name.
content_old: 3 He renews my life; He guides me in right paths as befits His name.

content: 4 Though I walk through a valley of deepest darkness, I fear no harm, for You are with me; Your rod and Your staff—they comfort me.
content_old: 4 Though I walk through a valley of deepest darkness, I fear no harm, for You are with me; Your rod and Your staff—they comfort me.

content: 5 You spread a table for me in full view of my enemies; You anoint my head with oil; my drink is abundant.
content_old: 5 You spread a table for me in full view of my enemies; You anoint my head with oil; my drink is abundant.

content: 1 Of David. A psalm. The earth is the LORD’s and all that it holds, the world and its inhabitants.
content_old: 1 Of David. A psalm. The earth is the LORD’s and all that it holds, the world and its inhabitants.

content: 2 For He founded it upon the ocean, set it on the nether-streams.
content_old: 2 For He founded it upon the ocean, set it on the nether-streams.

content: 3 Who may ascend the mountain of the LORD? Who may stand in His holy place?—
content_old: 3 Who may ascend the mountain of the LORD? Who may stand in His holy place?—

content: 4 He who has clean hands and a pure heart, who has not taken a false oath by My life or sworn deceitfully.
content_old: 4 He who has clean hands and a pure heart, who has not taken a false oath by My life or sworn deceitfully.

content: 5 He shall carry away a blessing from the LORD, a just reward from God, his deliverer.
content_old: 5 He shall carry away a blessing from the LORD, a just reward from God, his deliverer.

content: 6 Such is the circle of those who turn to Him, Jacob, who seek Your presence. Selah.
content_old: 6 Such is the circle of those who turn to Him, Jacob, who seek Your presence. Selah.

content: 7 O gates, lift up your heads! Up high, you everlasting doors, so the King of glory may come in!
content_old: 7 O gates, lift up your heads! Up high, you everlasting doors, so the King of glory may come in!

content: 8 Who is the King of glory?— the LORD, mighty and valiant, the LORD, valiant in battle.
content_old: 8 Who is the King of glory?— the LORD, mighty and valiant, the LORD, valiant in battle.

content: 9 O gates, lift up your heads! Lift them up, you everlasting doors, so the King of glory may come in!
content_old: 9 O gates, lift up your heads! Lift them up, you everlasting doors, so the King of glory may come in!

content: 1 Of David. O LORD, I set my hope on You;
content_old: 1 Of David. O LORD, I set my hope on You;

content: 2 my God, in You I trust; may I not be disappointed, may my enemies not exult over me.
content_old: 2 my God, in You I trust; may I not be disappointed, may my enemies not exult over me.

content: 3 O let none who look to You be disappointed; let the faithless be disappointed, empty-handed.
content_old: 3 O let none who look to You be disappointed; let the faithless be disappointed, empty-handed.

content: 4 Let me know Your paths, O LORD; teach me Your ways;
content_old: 4 Let me know Your paths, O LORD; teach me Your ways;

content: 5 guide me in Your true way and teach me, for You are God, my deliverer; it is You I look to at all times.
content_old: 5 guide me in Your true way and teach me, for You are God, my deliverer; it is You I look to at all times.

content: 6 O LORD, be mindful of Your compassion and Your faithfulness; they are old as time.
content_old: 6 O LORD, be mindful of Your compassion and Your faithfulness; they are old as time.

content: 7 Be not mindful of my youthful sins and transgressions; in keeping with Your faithfulness consider what is in my favor, as befits Your goodness, O LORD.
content_old: 7 Be not mindful of my youthful sins and transgressions; in keeping with Your faithfulness consider what is in my favor, as befits Your goodness, O LORD.

content: 8 Good and upright is the LORD; therefore He shows sinners the way.
content_old: 8 Good and upright is the LORD; therefore He shows sinners the way.

content: 9 He guides the lowly in the right path, and teaches the lowly His way.
content_old: 9 He guides the lowly in the right path, and teaches the lowly His way.

content: 10 All the LORD’s paths are steadfast love for those who keep the decrees of His covenant.
content_old: 10 All the LORD’s paths are steadfast love for those who keep the decrees of His covenant.

content: 11 As befits Your name, O LORD, pardon my iniquity though it be great.
content_old: 11 As befits Your name, O LORD, pardon my iniquity though it be great.

content: 12 Whoever fears the LORD, he shall be shown what path to choose.
content_old: 12 Whoever fears the LORD, he shall be shown what path to choose.

content: 13 He shall live a happy life, and his children shall inherit the land.
content_old: 13 He shall live a happy life, and his children shall inherit the land.

content: 14 The counsel of the LORD is for those who fear Him; to them He makes known His covenant.
content_old: 14 The counsel of the LORD is for those who fear Him; to them He makes known His covenant.

content: 15 My eyes are ever toward the LORD, for He will loose my feet from the net.
content_old: 15 My eyes are ever toward the LORD, for He will loose my feet from the net.

content: 16 Turn to me, have mercy on me, for I am alone and afflicted.
content_old: 16 Turn to me, have mercy on me, for I am alone and afflicted.

content: 17 My deep distress increases; deliver me from my straits.
content_old: 17 My deep distress increases; deliver me from my straits.

content: 18 Look at my affliction and suffering, and forgive all my sins.
content_old: 18 Look at my affliction and suffering, and forgive all my sins.

content: 19 See how numerous my enemies are, and how unjustly they hate me!
content_old: 19 See how numerous my enemies are, and how unjustly they hate me!

content: 20 Protect me and save me; let me not be disappointed, for I have sought refuge in You.
content_old: 20 Protect me and save me; let me not be disappointed, for I have sought refuge in You.

content: 21 May integrity and uprightness watch over me, for I look to You.
content_old: 21 May integrity and uprightness watch over me, for I look to You.

content: 1 Of David. Vindicate me, O LORD, for I have walked without blame; I have trusted in the LORD; I have not faltered.
content_old: 1 Of David. Vindicate me, O LORD, for I have walked without blame; I have trusted in the LORD; I have not faltered.

content: 2 Probe me, O LORD, and try me, test my heart and mind;
content_old: 2 Probe me, O LORD, and try me, test my heart and mind;

content: 3 for my eyes are on Your steadfast love; I have set my course by it.
content_old: 3 for my eyes are on Your steadfast love; I have set my course by it.

content: 4 I do not consort with scoundrels, or mix with hypocrites;
content_old: 4 I do not consort with scoundrels, or mix with hypocrites;

content: 5 I detest the company of evil men, and do not consort with the wicked;
content_old: 5 I detest the company of evil men, and do not consort with the wicked;

content: 6 I wash my hands in innocence, and walk around Your altar, O LORD,
content_old: 6 I wash my hands in innocence, and walk around Your altar, O LORD,

content: 7 raising my voice in thanksgiving, and telling all Your wonders.
content_old: 7 raising my voice in thanksgiving, and telling all Your wonders.

content: 8 O LORD, I love Your temple abode, the dwelling-place of Your glory.
content_old: 8 O LORD, I love Your temple abode, the dwelling-place of Your glory.

content: 9 Do not sweep me away with sinners, or snuff out my life with murderers,
content_old: 9 Do not sweep me away with sinners, or snuff out my life with murderers,

content: 10 who have schemes at their fingertips, and hands full of bribes.
content_old: 10 who have schemes at their fingertips, and hands full of bribes.

content: 11 But I walk without blame; redeem me, have mercy on me!
content_old: 11 But I walk without blame; redeem me, have mercy on me!

content: 1 Of David. The LORD is my light and my help; whom should I fear? The LORD is the stronghold of my life, whom should I dread?
content_old: 1 Of David. The LORD is my light and my help; whom should I fear? The LORD is the stronghold of my life, whom should I dread?

content: 2 When evil men assail me to devour my flesh— it is they, my foes and my enemies, who stumble and fall.
content_old: 2 When evil men assail me to devour my flesh— it is they, my foes and my enemies, who stumble and fall.

content: 3 Should an army besiege me, my heart would have no fear; should war beset me, still would I be confident.
content_old: 3 Should an army besiege me, my heart would have no fear; should war beset me, still would I be confident.

content: 4 One thing I ask of the LORD, only that do I seek: to live in the house of the LORD all the days of my life, to gaze upon the beauty of the LORD, to frequent His temple.
content_old: 4 One thing I ask of the LORD, only that do I seek: to live in the house of the LORD all the days of my life, to gaze upon the beauty of the LORD, to frequent His temple.

content: 5 He will shelter me in His pavilion on an evil day, grant me the protection of His tent, raise me high upon a rock.
content_old: 5 He will shelter me in His pavilion on an evil day, grant me the protection of His tent, raise me high upon a rock.

content: 6 Now is my head high over my enemies roundabout; I sacrifice in His tent with shouts of joy, singing and chanting a hymn to the LORD.
content_old: 6 Now is my head high over my enemies roundabout; I sacrifice in His tent with shouts of joy, singing and chanting a hymn to the LORD.

content: 7 Hear, O LORD, when I cry aloud; have mercy on me, answer me.
content_old: 7 Hear, O LORD, when I cry aloud; have mercy on me, answer me.

content: 8 In Your behalf my heart says: “Seek My face!” O LORD, I seek Your face.
content_old: 8 In Your behalf my heart says: “Seek My face!” O LORD, I seek Your face.

content: 9 Do not hide Your face from me; do not thrust aside Your servant in anger; You have ever been my help. Do not forsake me, do not abandon me, O God, my deliverer.
content_old: 9 Do not hide Your face from me; do not thrust aside Your servant in anger; You have ever been my help. Do not forsake me, do not abandon me, O God, my deliverer.

content: 10 Though my father and mother abandon me, the LORD will take me in.
content_old: 10 Though my father and mother abandon me, the LORD will take me in.

content: 11 Show me Your way, O LORD, and lead me on a level path because of my watchful foes.
content_old: 11 Show me Your way, O LORD, and lead me on a level path because of my watchful foes.

content: 12 Do not subject me to the will of my foes, for false witnesses and unjust accusers have appeared against me.
content_old: 12 Do not subject me to the will of my foes, for false witnesses and unjust accusers have appeared against me.

content: 13 Had I not the assurance that I would enjoy the goodness of the LORD in the land of the living …
content_old: 13 Had I not the assurance that I would enjoy the goodness of the LORD in the land of the living …

content: 1 Of David. O LORD, I call to You; my rock, do not disregard me, for if You hold aloof from me, I shall be like those gone down into the Pit.
content_old: 1 Of David. O LORD, I call to You; my rock, do not disregard me, for if You hold aloof from me, I shall be like those gone down into the Pit.

content: 2 Listen to my plea for mercy when I cry out to You, when I lift my hands toward Your inner sanctuary.
content_old: 2 Listen to my plea for mercy when I cry out to You, when I lift my hands toward Your inner sanctuary.

content: 3 Do not count me with the wicked and evildoers who profess goodwill toward their fellows while malice is in their heart.
content_old: 3 Do not count me with the wicked and evildoers who profess goodwill toward their fellows while malice is in their heart.

content: 4 Pay them according to their deeds, their malicious acts; according to their handiwork pay them, give them their deserts.
content_old: 4 Pay them according to their deeds, their malicious acts; according to their handiwork pay them, give them their deserts.

content: 5 For they do not consider the LORD’s deeds, the work of His hands. May He tear them down, never to rebuild them!
content_old: 5 For they do not consider the LORD’s deeds, the work of His hands. May He tear them down, never to rebuild them!

content: 6 Blessed is the LORD, for He listens to my plea for mercy.
content_old: 6 Blessed is the LORD, for He listens to my plea for mercy.

content: 7 The LORD is my strength and my shield; my heart trusts in Him. I was helped, and my heart exulted, so I will glorify Him with my song.
content_old: 7 The LORD is my strength and my shield; my heart trusts in Him. I was helped, and my heart exulted, so I will glorify Him with my song.

content: 8 The LORD is their strength; He is a stronghold for the deliverance of His anointed.
content_old: 8 The LORD is their strength; He is a stronghold for the deliverance of His anointed.

content: 1 A psalm of David. Ascribe to the LORD, O divine beings, ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.
content_old: 1 A psalm of David. Ascribe to the LORD, O divine beings, ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.

content: 2 Ascribe to the LORD the glory of His name; bow down to the LORD, majestic in holiness.
content_old: 2 Ascribe to the LORD the glory of His name; bow down to the LORD, majestic in holiness.

content: 3 The voice of the LORD is over the waters; the God of glory thunders, the LORD, over the mighty waters.
content_old: 3 The voice of the LORD is over the waters; the God of glory thunders, the LORD, over the mighty waters.

content: 4 The voice of the LORD is power; the voice of the LORD is majesty;
content_old: 4 The voice of the LORD is power; the voice of the LORD is majesty;

content: 5 the voice of the LORD breaks cedars; the LORD shatters the cedars of Lebanon.
content_old: 5 the voice of the LORD breaks cedars; the LORD shatters the cedars of Lebanon.

content: 6 He makes Lebanon skip like a calf, Sirion, like a young wild ox.
content_old: 6 He makes Lebanon skip like a calf, Sirion, like a young wild ox.

content: 7 The voice of the LORD kindles flames of fire;
content_old: 7 The voice of the LORD kindles flames of fire;

content: 8 the voice of the LORD convulses the wilderness; the LORD convulses the wilderness of Kadesh;
content_old: 8 the voice of the LORD convulses the wilderness; the LORD convulses the wilderness of Kadesh;

content: 9 the voice of the LORD causes hinds to calve, and strips forests bare; while in His temple all say “Glory!”
content_old: 9 the voice of the LORD causes hinds to calve, and strips forests bare; while in His temple all say “Glory!”

content: 10 The LORD sat enthroned at the Flood; the LORD sits enthroned, king forever.
content_old: 10 The LORD sat enthroned at the Flood; the LORD sits enthroned, king forever.

content: 1 A psalm of David. A song for the dedication of the House.
content_old: 1 A psalm of David. A song for the dedication of the House.

content: 2 I extol You, O LORD, for You have lifted me up, and not let my enemies rejoice over me.
content_old: 2 I extol You, O LORD, for You have lifted me up, and not let my enemies rejoice over me.

content: 3 O LORD, my God, I cried out to You, and You healed me.
content_old: 3 O LORD, my God, I cried out to You, and You healed me.

content: 4 O LORD, You brought me up from Sheol, preserved me from going down into the Pit.
content_old: 4 O LORD, You brought me up from Sheol, preserved me from going down into the Pit.

content: 5 O you faithful of the LORD, sing to Him, and praise His holy name.
content_old: 5 O you faithful of the LORD, sing to Him, and praise His holy name.

content: 6 For He is angry but a moment, and when He is pleased there is life. One may lie down weeping at nightfall; but at dawn there are shouts of joy.
content_old: 6 For He is angry but a moment, and when He is pleased there is life. One may lie down weeping at nightfall; but at dawn there are shouts of joy.

content: 7 When I was untroubled, I thought, “I shall never be shaken,”
content_old: 7 When I was untroubled, I thought, “I shall never be shaken,”

content: 8 for You, O LORD, when You were pleased, made me firm as a mighty mountain. When You hid Your face, I was terrified.
content_old: 8 for You, O LORD, when You were pleased, made me firm as a mighty mountain. When You hid Your face, I was terrified.

content: 9 I called to You, O LORD; to my LORD I made appeal,
content_old: 9 I called to You, O LORD; to my LORD I made appeal,

content: 10 “What is to be gained from my death, from my descent into the Pit? Can dust praise You? Can it declare Your faithfulness?
content_old: 10 “What is to be gained from my death, from my descent into the Pit? Can dust praise You? Can it declare Your faithfulness?

content: 11 Hear, O LORD, and have mercy on me; O LORD, be my help!”
content_old: 11 Hear, O LORD, and have mercy on me; O LORD, be my help!”

content: 12 You turned my lament into dancing, you undid my sackcloth and girded me with joy,
content_old: 12 You turned my lament into dancing, you undid my sackcloth and girded me with joy,

content: 1 For the leader. A psalm of David.
content_old: 1 For the leader. A psalm of David.

content: 2 I seek refuge in You, O LORD; may I never be disappointed; as You are righteous, rescue me.
content_old: 2 I seek refuge in You, O LORD; may I never be disappointed; as You are righteous, rescue me.

content: 3 Incline Your ear to me; be quick to save me; be a rock, a stronghold for me, a citadel, for my deliverance.
content_old: 3 Incline Your ear to me; be quick to save me; be a rock, a stronghold for me, a citadel, for my deliverance.

content: 4 For You are my rock and my fortress; You lead me and guide me as befits Your name.
content_old: 4 For You are my rock and my fortress; You lead me and guide me as befits Your name.

content: 5 You free me from the net laid for me, for You are my stronghold.
content_old: 5 You free me from the net laid for me, for You are my stronghold.

content: 6 Into Your hand I entrust my spirit; You redeem me, O LORD, faithful God.
content_old: 6 Into Your hand I entrust my spirit; You redeem me, O LORD, faithful God.

content: 7 I detest those who rely on empty folly, but I trust in the LORD.
content_old: 7 I detest those who rely on empty folly, but I trust in the LORD.

content: 8 Let me exult and rejoice in Your faithfulness when You notice my affliction, are mindful of my deep distress,
content_old: 8 Let me exult and rejoice in Your faithfulness when You notice my affliction, are mindful of my deep distress,

content: 9 and do not hand me over to my enemy, but grant me relief.
content_old: 9 and do not hand me over to my enemy, but grant me relief.

content: 10 Have mercy on me, O LORD, for I am in distress; my eyes are wasted by vexation, my substance and body too.
content_old: 10 Have mercy on me, O LORD, for I am in distress; my eyes are wasted by vexation, my substance and body too.

content: 11 My life is spent in sorrow, my years in groaning; my strength fails because of my iniquity, my limbs waste away.
content_old: 11 My life is spent in sorrow, my years in groaning; my strength fails because of my iniquity, my limbs waste away.

content: 12 Because of all my foes I am the particular butt of my neighbors, a horror to my friends; those who see me on the street avoid me.
content_old: 12 Because of all my foes I am the particular butt of my neighbors, a horror to my friends; those who see me on the street avoid me.

content: 13 I am put out of mind like the dead; I am like an object given up for lost.
content_old: 13 I am put out of mind like the dead; I am like an object given up for lost.

content: 14 I hear the whisperings of many, intrigue on every side, as they scheme together against me, plotting to take my life.
content_old: 14 I hear the whisperings of many, intrigue on every side, as they scheme together against me, plotting to take my life.

content: 15 But I trust in You, O LORD; I say, “You are my God!”
content_old: 15 But I trust in You, O LORD; I say, “You are my God!”

content: 16 My fate is in Your hand; save me from the hand of my enemies and pursuers.
content_old: 16 My fate is in Your hand; save me from the hand of my enemies and pursuers.

content: 17 Show favor to Your servant; as You are faithful, deliver me.
content_old: 17 Show favor to Your servant; as You are faithful, deliver me.

content: 18 O LORD, let me not be disappointed when I call You; let the wicked be disappointed; let them be silenced in Sheol;
content_old: 18 O LORD, let me not be disappointed when I call You; let the wicked be disappointed; let them be silenced in Sheol;

content: 19 let lying lips be stilled that speak haughtily against the righteous with arrogance and contempt.
content_old: 19 let lying lips be stilled that speak haughtily against the righteous with arrogance and contempt.

content: 20 How abundant is the good that You have in store for those who fear You, that You do in the full view of men for those who take refuge in You.
content_old: 20 How abundant is the good that You have in store for those who fear You, that You do in the full view of men for those who take refuge in You.

content: 21 You grant them the protection of Your presence against scheming men; You shelter them in Your pavilion from contentious tongues.
content_old: 21 You grant them the protection of Your presence against scheming men; You shelter them in Your pavilion from contentious tongues.

content: 22 Blessed is the LORD, for He has been wondrously faithful to me, a veritable bastion.
content_old: 22 Blessed is the LORD, for He has been wondrously faithful to me, a veritable bastion.

content: 23 Alarmed, I had thought, “I am thrust out of Your sight”; yet You listened to my plea for mercy when I cried out to You.
content_old: 23 Alarmed, I had thought, “I am thrust out of Your sight”; yet You listened to my plea for mercy when I cried out to You.

content: 24 So love the LORD, all you faithful; the LORD guards the loyal, and more than requites him who acts arrogantly.
content_old: 24 So love the LORD, all you faithful; the LORD guards the loyal, and more than requites him who acts arrogantly.

content: 1 Of David. A maskil. Happy is he whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered over.
content_old: 1 Of David. A maskil. Happy is he whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered over.

content: 2 Happy the man whom the LORD does not hold guilty, and in whose spirit there is no deceit.
content_old: 2 Happy the man whom the LORD does not hold guilty, and in whose spirit there is no deceit.

content: 3 As long as I said nothing, my limbs wasted away from my anguished roaring all day long.
content_old: 3 As long as I said nothing, my limbs wasted away from my anguished roaring all day long.
