content: 4 For night and day Your hand lay heavy on me; my vigor waned as in the summer drought. Selah.
content_old: 4 For night and day Your hand lay heavy on me; my vigor waned as in the summer drought. Selah.

content: 5 Then I acknowledged my sin to You; I did not cover up my guilt; I resolved, “I will confess my transgressions to the LORD,” and You forgave the guilt of my sin. Selah.
content_old: 5 Then I acknowledged my sin to You; I did not cover up my guilt; I resolved, “I will confess my transgressions to the LORD,” and You forgave the guilt of my sin. Selah.

content: 6 Therefore let every faithful man pray to You upon discoveringhis sin, that the rushing mighty waters not overtake him.
content_old: 6 Therefore let every faithful man pray to You upon discoveringhis sin, that the rushing mighty waters not overtake him.

content: 7 You are my shelter; You preserve me from distress; You surround me with the joyous shouts of deliverance. Selah.
content_old: 7 You are my shelter; You preserve me from distress; You surround me with the joyous shouts of deliverance. Selah.

content: 8 Let me enlighten you and show you which way to go; let me offer counsel; my eye is on you.
content_old: 8 Let me enlighten you and show you which way to go; let me offer counsel; my eye is on you.

content: 9 Be not like a senseless horse or mule whose movement must be curbed by bit and bridle; far be it from you!
content_old: 9 Be not like a senseless horse or mule whose movement must be curbed by bit and bridle; far be it from you!

content: 10 Many are the torments of the wicked, but he who trusts in the LORD shall be surrounded with favor.
content_old: 10 Many are the torments of the wicked, but he who trusts in the LORD shall be surrounded with favor.

content: 1 Sing forth, O you righteous, to the LORD; it is fit that the upright acclaim Him.
content_old: 1 Sing forth, O you righteous, to the LORD; it is fit that the upright acclaim Him.

content: 2 Praise the LORD with the lyre; with the ten-stringed harp sing to Him;
content_old: 2 Praise the LORD with the lyre; with the ten-stringed harp sing to Him;

content: 3 sing Him a new song; play sweetly with shouts of joy.
content_old: 3 sing Him a new song; play sweetly with shouts of joy.

content: 4 For the word of the LORD is right; His every deed is faithful.
content_old: 4 For the word of the LORD is right; His every deed is faithful.

content: 5 He loves what is right and just; the earth is full of the LORD’s faithful care.
content_old: 5 He loves what is right and just; the earth is full of the LORD’s faithful care.

content: 6 By the word of the LORD the heavens were made, by the breath of His mouth, all their host.
content_old: 6 By the word of the LORD the heavens were made, by the breath of His mouth, all their host.

content: 7 He heaps up the ocean waters like a mound, stores the deep in vaults.
content_old: 7 He heaps up the ocean waters like a mound, stores the deep in vaults.

content: 8 Let all the earth fear the LORD; let all the inhabitants of the world dread Him.
content_old: 8 Let all the earth fear the LORD; let all the inhabitants of the world dread Him.

content: 9 For He spoke, and it was; He commanded, and it endured.
content_old: 9 For He spoke, and it was; He commanded, and it endured.

content: 10 The LORD frustrates the plans of nations, brings to naught the designs of peoples.
content_old: 10 The LORD frustrates the plans of nations, brings to naught the designs of peoples.

content: 11 What the LORD plans endures forever, what He designs, for ages on end.
content_old: 11 What the LORD plans endures forever, what He designs, for ages on end.

content: 12 Happy the nation whose God is the LORD, the people He has chosen to be His own.
content_old: 12 Happy the nation whose God is the LORD, the people He has chosen to be His own.

content: 13 The LORD looks down from heaven; He sees all mankind.
content_old: 13 The LORD looks down from heaven; He sees all mankind.

content: 14 From His dwelling-place He gazes on all the inhabitants of the earth—
content_old: 14 From His dwelling-place He gazes on all the inhabitants of the earth—

content: 15 He who fashions the hearts of them all, who discerns all their doings.
content_old: 15 He who fashions the hearts of them all, who discerns all their doings.

content: 16 Kings are not delivered by a large force; warriors are not saved by great strength;
content_old: 16 Kings are not delivered by a large force; warriors are not saved by great strength;

content: 17 horses are a false hope for deliverance; for all their great power they provide no escape.
content_old: 17 horses are a false hope for deliverance; for all their great power they provide no escape.

content: 18 Truly the eye of the LORD is on those who fear Him, who wait for His faithful care
content_old: 18 Truly the eye of the LORD is on those who fear Him, who wait for His faithful care

content: 19 to save them from death, to sustain them in famine.
content_old: 19 to save them from death, to sustain them in famine.

content: 20 We set our hope on the LORD, He is our help and shield;
content_old: 20 We set our hope on the LORD, He is our help and shield;

content: 21 in Him our hearts rejoice, for in His holy name we trust.
content_old: 21 in Him our hearts rejoice, for in His holy name we trust.

content: 1 Of David, when he feigned madness in the presence of Abimelech, who turned him out, and he left.
content_old: 1 Of David, when he feigned madness in the presence of Abimelech, who turned him out, and he left.

content: 2 I bless the LORD at all times; praise of Him is ever in my mouth.
content_old: 2 I bless the LORD at all times; praise of Him is ever in my mouth.

content: 3 I glory in the LORD; let the lowly hear it and rejoice.
content_old: 3 I glory in the LORD; let the lowly hear it and rejoice.

content: 4 Exalt the LORD with me; let us extol His name together.
content_old: 4 Exalt the LORD with me; let us extol His name together.

content: 5 I turned to the LORD, and He answered me; He saved me from all my terrors.
content_old: 5 I turned to the LORD, and He answered me; He saved me from all my terrors.

content: 6 Men look to Him and are radiant; let their faces not be downcast.
content_old: 6 Men look to Him and are radiant; let their faces not be downcast.

content: 7 Here was a lowly man who called, and the LORD listened, and delivered him from all his troubles.
content_old: 7 Here was a lowly man who called, and the LORD listened, and delivered him from all his troubles.

content: 8 The angel of the LORD camps around those who fear Him and rescues them.
content_old: 8 The angel of the LORD camps around those who fear Him and rescues them.

content: 9 Taste and see how good the LORD is; happy the man who takes refuge in Him!
content_old: 9 Taste and see how good the LORD is; happy the man who takes refuge in Him!

content: 10 Fear the LORD, you His consecrated ones, for those who fear Him lack nothing.
content_old: 10 Fear the LORD, you His consecrated ones, for those who fear Him lack nothing.

content: 11 Lions have been reduced to starvation, but those who turn to the LORD shall not lack any good.
content_old: 11 Lions have been reduced to starvation, but those who turn to the LORD shall not lack any good.

content: 12 Come, my sons, listen to me; I will teach you what it is to fear the LORD.
content_old: 12 Come, my sons, listen to me; I will teach you what it is to fear the LORD.

content: 13 Who is the man who is eager for life, who desires years of good fortune?
content_old: 13 Who is the man who is eager for life, who desires years of good fortune?

content: 14 Guard your tongue from evil, your lips from deceitful speech.
content_old: 14 Guard your tongue from evil, your lips from deceitful speech.

content: 15 Shun evil and do good, seek amity and pursue it.
content_old: 15 Shun evil and do good, seek amity and pursue it.

content: 16 The eyes of the LORD are on the righteous, His ears attentive to their cry.
content_old: 16 The eyes of the LORD are on the righteous, His ears attentive to their cry.

content: 17 The face of the LORD is set against evildoers, to erase their names from the earth.
content_old: 17 The face of the LORD is set against evildoers, to erase their names from the earth.

content: 18 They cry out, and the LORD hears, and saves them from all their troubles.
content_old: 18 They cry out, and the LORD hears, and saves them from all their troubles.

content: 19 The LORD is close to the brokenhearted; those crushed in spirit He delivers.
content_old: 19 The LORD is close to the brokenhearted; those crushed in spirit He delivers.

content: 20 Though the misfortunes of the righteous be many, the LORD will save him from them all,
content_old: 20 Though the misfortunes of the righteous be many, the LORD will save him from them all,

content: 21 Keeping all his bones intact, not one of them being broken.
content_old: 21 Keeping all his bones intact, not one of them being broken.

content: 22 One misfortune is the deathblow of the wicked; the foes of the righteous shall be ruined.
content_old: 22 One misfortune is the deathblow of the wicked; the foes of the righteous shall be ruined.

content: 1 Of David. O LORD, strive with my adversaries, give battle to my foes,
content_old: 1 Of David. O LORD, strive with my adversaries, give battle to my foes,

content: 2 take up shield and buckler, and come to my defense;
content_old: 2 take up shield and buckler, and come to my defense;

content: 3 ready the spear and javelin against my pursuers; tell me, “I am your deliverance.”
content_old: 3 ready the spear and javelin against my pursuers; tell me, “I am your deliverance.”

content: 4 Let those who seek my life be frustrated and put to shame; let those who plan to harm me fall back in disgrace.
content_old: 4 Let those who seek my life be frustrated and put to shame; let those who plan to harm me fall back in disgrace.

content: 5 Let them be as chaff in the wind, the LORD’s angel driving them on.
content_old: 5 Let them be as chaff in the wind, the LORD’s angel driving them on.

content: 6 Let their path be dark and slippery, with the LORD’s angel in pursuit.
content_old: 6 Let their path be dark and slippery, with the LORD’s angel in pursuit.

content: 7 For without cause they hid a net to trap me; without cause they dug a pit for me.
content_old: 7 For without cause they hid a net to trap me; without cause they dug a pit for me.

content: 8 Let disaster overtake them unawares; let the net they hid catch them; let them fall into it when disasterstrikes.
content_old: 8 Let disaster overtake them unawares; let the net they hid catch them; let them fall into it when disasterstrikes.

content: 9 Then shall I exult in the LORD, rejoice in His deliverance.
content_old: 9 Then shall I exult in the LORD, rejoice in His deliverance.

content: 10 All my bones shall say, “LORD, who is like You? You save the poor from one stronger than he, the poor and needy from his despoiler.”
content_old: 10 All my bones shall say, “LORD, who is like You? You save the poor from one stronger than he, the poor and needy from his despoiler.”

content: 11 Malicious witnesses appear who question me about things I do not know.
content_old: 11 Malicious witnesses appear who question me about things I do not know.

content: 12 They repay me evil for good, seekingmy bereavement.
content_old: 12 They repay me evil for good, seekingmy bereavement.

content: 13 Yet, when they were ill, my dress was sackcloth, I kept a fast— may what I prayed for happen to me!
content_old: 13 Yet, when they were ill, my dress was sackcloth, I kept a fast— may what I prayed for happen to me!

content: 14 I walked about as though it were my friend or my brother; I was bowed with gloom, like one mourning for his mother.
content_old: 14 I walked about as though it were my friend or my brother; I was bowed with gloom, like one mourning for his mother.

content: 15 But when I stumble, they gleefully gather; wretches gather against me, I know not why; they tear at me without end.
content_old: 15 But when I stumble, they gleefully gather; wretches gather against me, I know not why; they tear at me without end.

content: 16 With impious, mocking grimace they gnash their teeth at me.
content_old: 16 With impious, mocking grimace they gnash their teeth at me.

content: 17 O Lord, how long will You look on? Rescue me from their attacks, my precious life, from the lions,
content_old: 17 O Lord, how long will You look on? Rescue me from their attacks, my precious life, from the lions,

content: 18 that I may praise You in a great congregation, acclaim You in a mighty throng.
content_old: 18 that I may praise You in a great congregation, acclaim You in a mighty throng.

content: 19 Let not my treacherous enemies rejoice over me, or those who hate me without reason wink their eyes.
content_old: 19 Let not my treacherous enemies rejoice over me, or those who hate me without reason wink their eyes.

content: 20 For they do not offer amity, but devise fraudulent schemes against harmless folk.
content_old: 20 For they do not offer amity, but devise fraudulent schemes against harmless folk.

content: 21 They open wide their mouths at me, saying, “Aha, aha, we have seen it!”
content_old: 21 They open wide their mouths at me, saying, “Aha, aha, we have seen it!”

content: 22 You have seen it, O LORD; do not hold aloof! O Lord, be not far from me!
content_old: 22 You have seen it, O LORD; do not hold aloof! O Lord, be not far from me!

content: 23 Wake, rouse Yourself for my cause, for my claim, O my God and my Lord!
content_old: 23 Wake, rouse Yourself for my cause, for my claim, O my God and my Lord!

content: 24 Take up my cause, O LORD my God, as You are beneficent, and let them not rejoice over me.
content_old: 24 Take up my cause, O LORD my God, as You are beneficent, and let them not rejoice over me.

content: 25 Let them not think, “Aha, just what we wished!” Let them not say, “We have destroyed him!”
content_old: 25 Let them not think, “Aha, just what we wished!” Let them not say, “We have destroyed him!”

content: 26 May those who rejoice at my misfortune be frustrated and utterly disgraced; may those who vaunt themselves over me be clad in frustration and shame.
content_old: 26 May those who rejoice at my misfortune be frustrated and utterly disgraced; may those who vaunt themselves over me be clad in frustration and shame.

content: 27 May those who desire my vindication sing forth joyously; may they always say, “Extolled be the LORD who desires the well-being of His servant,”
content_old: 27 May those who desire my vindication sing forth joyously; may they always say, “Extolled be the LORD who desires the well-being of His servant,”

content: 1 For the leader. Of the servant of the LORD, of David.
content_old: 1 For the leader. Of the servant of the LORD, of David.

content: 2 I know what Transgression says to the wicked; he has no sense of the dread of God,
content_old: 2 I know what Transgression says to the wicked; he has no sense of the dread of God,

content: 3 because its speech is seductive to him till his iniquity be found out and he be hated.
content_old: 3 because its speech is seductive to him till his iniquity be found out and he be hated.

content: 4 His words are evil and deceitful; he will not consider doing good.
content_old: 4 His words are evil and deceitful; he will not consider doing good.

content: 5 In bed he plots mischief; he is set on a path of no good, he does not reject evil.
content_old: 5 In bed he plots mischief; he is set on a path of no good, he does not reject evil.

content: 6 O LORD, Your faithfulness reaches to heaven; Your steadfastness to the sky;
content_old: 6 O LORD, Your faithfulness reaches to heaven; Your steadfastness to the sky;

content: 7 Your beneficence is like the high mountains; Your justice like the great deep; man and beast You deliver, O LORD.
content_old: 7 Your beneficence is like the high mountains; Your justice like the great deep; man and beast You deliver, O LORD.

content: 8 How precious is Your faithful care, O God! Mankind shelters in the shadow of Your wings.
content_old: 8 How precious is Your faithful care, O God! Mankind shelters in the shadow of Your wings.

content: 9 They feast on the rich fare of Your house; You let them drink at Your refreshing stream.
content_old: 9 They feast on the rich fare of Your house; You let them drink at Your refreshing stream.

content: 10 With You is the fountain of life; by Your light do we see light.
content_old: 10 With You is the fountain of life; by Your light do we see light.

content: 11 Bestow Your faithful care on those devoted to You, and Your beneficence on upright men.
content_old: 11 Bestow Your faithful care on those devoted to You, and Your beneficence on upright men.

content: 12 Let not the foot of the arrogant tread on me, or the hand of the wicked drive me away.
content_old: 12 Let not the foot of the arrogant tread on me, or the hand of the wicked drive me away.

content: 1 Of David. Do not be vexed by evil men; do not be incensed by wrongdoers;
content_old: 1 Of David. Do not be vexed by evil men; do not be incensed by wrongdoers;

content: 2 for they soon wither like grass, like verdure fade away.
content_old: 2 for they soon wither like grass, like verdure fade away.

content: 3 Trust in the LORD and do good, abide in the land and remain loyal.
content_old: 3 Trust in the LORD and do good, abide in the land and remain loyal.

content: 4 Seek the favor of the LORD, and He will grant you the desires of your heart.
content_old: 4 Seek the favor of the LORD, and He will grant you the desires of your heart.

content: 5 Leave all to the LORD; trust in Him; He will do it.
content_old: 5 Leave all to the LORD; trust in Him; He will do it.

content: 6 He will cause your vindication to shine forth like the light, the justice of your case, like the noonday sun.
content_old: 6 He will cause your vindication to shine forth like the light, the justice of your case, like the noonday sun.

content: 7 Be patient and wait for the LORD, do not be vexed by the prospering man who carries out his schemes.
content_old: 7 Be patient and wait for the LORD, do not be vexed by the prospering man who carries out his schemes.

content: 8 Give up anger, abandon fury, do not be vexed; it can only do harm.
content_old: 8 Give up anger, abandon fury, do not be vexed; it can only do harm.

content: 9 For evil men will be cut off, but those who look to the LORD— they shall inherit the land.
content_old: 9 For evil men will be cut off, but those who look to the LORD— they shall inherit the land.

content: 10 A little longer and there will be no wicked man; you will look at where he was— he will be gone.
content_old: 10 A little longer and there will be no wicked man; you will look at where he was— he will be gone.

content: 11 But the lowly shall inherit the land, and delight in abundant well-being.
content_old: 11 But the lowly shall inherit the land, and delight in abundant well-being.

content: 12 The wicked man schemes against the righteous, and gnashes his teeth at him.
content_old: 12 The wicked man schemes against the righteous, and gnashes his teeth at him.

content: 13 The Lord laughs at him, for He knows that his day will come.
content_old: 13 The Lord laughs at him, for He knows that his day will come.

content: 14 The wicked draw their swords, bend their bows, to bring down the lowly and needy, to slaughter upright men.
content_old: 14 The wicked draw their swords, bend their bows, to bring down the lowly and needy, to slaughter upright men.

content: 15 Their swords shall pierce their own hearts, and their bows shall be broken.
content_old: 15 Their swords shall pierce their own hearts, and their bows shall be broken.

content: 16 Better the little that the righteous man has than the great abundance of the wicked.
content_old: 16 Better the little that the righteous man has than the great abundance of the wicked.

content: 17 For the arms of the wicked shall be broken, but the LORD is the support of the righteous.
content_old: 17 For the arms of the wicked shall be broken, but the LORD is the support of the righteous.

content: 18 The LORD is concerned for the needs of the blameless; their portion lasts forever;
content_old: 18 The LORD is concerned for the needs of the blameless; their portion lasts forever;

content: 19 they shall not come to grief in bad times; in famine, they shall eat their fill.
content_old: 19 they shall not come to grief in bad times; in famine, they shall eat their fill.

content: 20 But the wicked shall perish, and the enemies of the LORD shall be consumed, like meadow grass consumed in smoke.
content_old: 20 But the wicked shall perish, and the enemies of the LORD shall be consumed, like meadow grass consumed in smoke.

content: 21 The wicked man borrows and does not repay; the righteous is generous and keeps giving.
content_old: 21 The wicked man borrows and does not repay; the righteous is generous and keeps giving.

content: 22 Those blessed by Him shall inherit the land, but those cursed by Him shall be cut off.
content_old: 22 Those blessed by Him shall inherit the land, but those cursed by Him shall be cut off.

content: 23 The steps of a man are made firm by the LORD, when He delights in his way.
content_old: 23 The steps of a man are made firm by the LORD, when He delights in his way.

content: 24 Though he stumbles, he does not fall down, for the LORD gives him support.
content_old: 24 Though he stumbles, he does not fall down, for the LORD gives him support.

content: 25 I have been young and am now old, but I have never seen a righteous man abandoned, or his children seeking bread.
content_old: 25 I have been young and am now old, but I have never seen a righteous man abandoned, or his children seeking bread.

content: 26 He is always generous, and lends, and his children are held blessed.
content_old: 26 He is always generous, and lends, and his children are held blessed.

content: 27 Shun evil and do good, and you shall abide forever.
content_old: 27 Shun evil and do good, and you shall abide forever.

content: 28 For the LORD loves what is right, He does not abandon His faithful ones. They are preserved forever, while the children of the wicked will be cut off.
content_old: 28 For the LORD loves what is right, He does not abandon His faithful ones. They are preserved forever, while the children of the wicked will be cut off.

content: 29 The righteous shall inherit the land, and abide forever in it.
content_old: 29 The righteous shall inherit the land, and abide forever in it.

content: 30 The mouth of the righteous utters wisdom, and his tongue speaks what is right.
content_old: 30 The mouth of the righteous utters wisdom, and his tongue speaks what is right.

content: 31 The teaching of his God is in his heart; his feet do not slip.
content_old: 31 The teaching of his God is in his heart; his feet do not slip.

content: 32 The wicked watches for the righteous, seeking to put him to death;
content_old: 32 The wicked watches for the righteous, seeking to put him to death;

content: 33 the LORD will not abandon him to his power; He will not let him be condemned in judgment.
content_old: 33 the LORD will not abandon him to his power; He will not let him be condemned in judgment.

content: 34 Look to the LORD and keep to His way, and He will raise you high that you may inherit the land; when the wicked are cut off, you shall see it.
content_old: 34 Look to the LORD and keep to His way, and He will raise you high that you may inherit the land; when the wicked are cut off, you shall see it.

content: 35 I saw a wicked man, powerful, well-rooted like a robust native tree.
content_old: 35 I saw a wicked man, powerful, well-rooted like a robust native tree.

content: 36 Suddenly he vanished and was gone; I sought him, but he was not to be found.
content_old: 36 Suddenly he vanished and was gone; I sought him, but he was not to be found.

content: 37 Mark the blameless, note the upright, for there is a future for the man of integrity.
content_old: 37 Mark the blameless, note the upright, for there is a future for the man of integrity.

content: 38 But transgressors shall be utterly destroyed, the future of the wicked shall be cut off.
content_old: 38 But transgressors shall be utterly destroyed, the future of the wicked shall be cut off.

content: 39 The deliverance of the righteous comes from the LORD, their stronghold in time of trouble.
content_old: 39 The deliverance of the righteous comes from the LORD, their stronghold in time of trouble.

content: 1 A psalm of David. Lehazkir.
content_old: 1 A psalm of David. Lehazkir.

content: 2 O LORD, do not punish me in wrath; do not chastise me in fury.
content_old: 2 O LORD, do not punish me in wrath; do not chastise me in fury.

content: 3 For Your arrows have struck me; Your blows have fallen upon me.
content_old: 3 For Your arrows have struck me; Your blows have fallen upon me.

content: 4 There is no soundness in my flesh because of Your rage, no wholeness in my bones because of my sin.
content_old: 4 There is no soundness in my flesh because of Your rage, no wholeness in my bones because of my sin.

content: 5 For my iniquities have overwhelmed me; they are like a heavy burden, more than I can bear.
content_old: 5 For my iniquities have overwhelmed me; they are like a heavy burden, more than I can bear.

content: 6 My wounds stink and fester because of my folly.
content_old: 6 My wounds stink and fester because of my folly.

content: 7 I am all bent and bowed; I walk about in gloom all day long.
content_old: 7 I am all bent and bowed; I walk about in gloom all day long.

content: 8 For my sinews are full of fever; there is no soundness in my flesh.
content_old: 8 For my sinews are full of fever; there is no soundness in my flesh.

content: 9 I am all benumbed and crushed; I roar because of the turmoil in my mind.
content_old: 9 I am all benumbed and crushed; I roar because of the turmoil in my mind.

content: 10 O Lord, You are aware of all my entreaties; my groaning is not hidden from You.
content_old: 10 O Lord, You are aware of all my entreaties; my groaning is not hidden from You.

content: 11 My mind reels; my strength fails me; my eyes too have lost their luster.
content_old: 11 My mind reels; my strength fails me; my eyes too have lost their luster.

content: 12 My friends and companions stand back from my affliction; my kinsmen stand far off.
content_old: 12 My friends and companions stand back from my affliction; my kinsmen stand far off.

content: 13 Those who seek my life lay traps; those who wish me harm speak malice; they utter deceit all the time.
content_old: 13 Those who seek my life lay traps; those who wish me harm speak malice; they utter deceit all the time.

content: 14 But I am like a deaf man, unhearing, like a dumb man who cannot speak up;
content_old: 14 But I am like a deaf man, unhearing, like a dumb man who cannot speak up;

content: 15 I am like one who does not hear, who has no retort on his lips.
content_old: 15 I am like one who does not hear, who has no retort on his lips.

content: 16 But I wait for You, O LORD; You will answer, O Lord, my God.
content_old: 16 But I wait for You, O LORD; You will answer, O Lord, my God.

content: 17 For I fear they will rejoice over me; when my foot gives way they will vaunt themselves against me.
content_old: 17 For I fear they will rejoice over me; when my foot gives way they will vaunt themselves against me.

content: 18 For I am on the verge of collapse; my pain is always with me.
content_old: 18 For I am on the verge of collapse; my pain is always with me.

content: 19 I acknowledge my iniquity; I am fearful over my sin;
content_old: 19 I acknowledge my iniquity; I am fearful over my sin;

content: 20 for my mortal enemies are numerous; my treacherous foes are many.
content_old: 20 for my mortal enemies are numerous; my treacherous foes are many.

content: 21 Those who repay evil for good harass me for pursuing good.
content_old: 21 Those who repay evil for good harass me for pursuing good.

content: 22 Do not abandon me, O LORD; my God, be not far from me;
content_old: 22 Do not abandon me, O LORD; my God, be not far from me;

content: 1 For the leader; for Jeduthun. A psalm of David.
content_old: 1 For the leader; for Jeduthun. A psalm of David.

content: 2 I resolved I would watch my step lest I offend by my speech; I would keep my mouth muzzled while the wicked man was in my presence.
content_old: 2 I resolved I would watch my step lest I offend by my speech; I would keep my mouth muzzled while the wicked man was in my presence.

content: 3 I was dumb, silent; I was very still while my pain was intense.
content_old: 3 I was dumb, silent; I was very still while my pain was intense.

content: 4 My mind was in a rage, my thoughts were all aflame; I spoke out:
content_old: 4 My mind was in a rage, my thoughts were all aflame; I spoke out:

content: 5 Tell me, O LORD, what my term is, what is the measure of my days; I would know how fleeting my life is.
content_old: 5 Tell me, O LORD, what my term is, what is the measure of my days; I would know how fleeting my life is.

content: 6 You have made my life just handbreadths long; its span is as nothing in Your sight; no man endures any longer than a breath. Selah.
content_old: 6 You have made my life just handbreadths long; its span is as nothing in Your sight; no man endures any longer than a breath. Selah.

content: 7 Man walks about as a mere shadow; mere futility is his hustle and bustle, amassing and not knowing who will gather in.
content_old: 7 Man walks about as a mere shadow; mere futility is his hustle and bustle, amassing and not knowing who will gather in.

content: 8 What, then, can I count on, O Lord? In You my hope lies.
content_old: 8 What, then, can I count on, O Lord? In You my hope lies.

content: 9 Deliver me from all my transgressions; make me not the butt of the benighted.
content_old: 9 Deliver me from all my transgressions; make me not the butt of the benighted.

content: 10 I am dumb, I do not speak up, for it is Your doing.
content_old: 10 I am dumb, I do not speak up, for it is Your doing.

content: 11 Take away Your plague from me; I perish from Your blows.
content_old: 11 Take away Your plague from me; I perish from Your blows.

content: 12 You chastise a man in punishment for his sin, consuming like a moth what he treasures. No man is more than a breath. Selah.
content_old: 12 You chastise a man in punishment for his sin, consuming like a moth what he treasures. No man is more than a breath. Selah.

content: 13 Hear my prayer, O LORD; give ear to my cry; do not disregard my tears; for like all my forebears I am an alien, resident with You.
content_old: 13 Hear my prayer, O LORD; give ear to my cry; do not disregard my tears; for like all my forebears I am an alien, resident with You.

content: 1 For the leader. A psalm of David.
content_old: 1 For the leader. A psalm of David.

content: 2 I put my hope in the LORD; He inclined toward me, and heeded my cry.
content_old: 2 I put my hope in the LORD; He inclined toward me, and heeded my cry.

content: 3 He lifted me out of the miry pit, the slimy clay, and set my feet on a rock, steadied my legs.
content_old: 3 He lifted me out of the miry pit, the slimy clay, and set my feet on a rock, steadied my legs.

content: 4 He put a new song into my mouth, a hymn to our God. May many see it and stand in awe, and trust in the LORD.
content_old: 4 He put a new song into my mouth, a hymn to our God. May many see it and stand in awe, and trust in the LORD.

content: 5 Happy is the man who makes the LORD his trust, who turns not to the arrogant or to followers of falsehood.
content_old: 5 Happy is the man who makes the LORD his trust, who turns not to the arrogant or to followers of falsehood.

content: 6 You, O LORD my God, have done many things; the wonders You have devised for us cannot be set out before You; I would rehearse the tale of them, but they are more than can be told.
content_old: 6 You, O LORD my God, have done many things; the wonders You have devised for us cannot be set out before You; I would rehearse the tale of them, but they are more than can be told.

content: 7 You gave me to understand that You do not desire sacrifice and meal offering; You do not ask for burnt offering and sin offering.
content_old: 7 You gave me to understand that You do not desire sacrifice and meal offering; You do not ask for burnt offering and sin offering.

content: 8 Then I said, “See, I will bring a scroll recounting what befell me.”
content_old: 8 Then I said, “See, I will bring a scroll recounting what befell me.”

content: 9 To do what pleases You, my God, is my desire; Your teaching is in my inmost parts.
content_old: 9 To do what pleases You, my God, is my desire; Your teaching is in my inmost parts.

content: 10 I proclaimed Your righteousness in a great congregation; see, I did not withhold my words; O LORD, You must know it.
content_old: 10 I proclaimed Your righteousness in a great congregation; see, I did not withhold my words; O LORD, You must know it.

content: 11 I did not keep Your beneficence to myself; I declared Your faithful deliverance; I did not fail to speak of Your steadfast love in a great congregation.
content_old: 11 I did not keep Your beneficence to myself; I declared Your faithful deliverance; I did not fail to speak of Your steadfast love in a great congregation.

content: 12 O LORD, You will not withhold from me Your compassion; Your steadfast love will protect me always.
content_old: 12 O LORD, You will not withhold from me Your compassion; Your steadfast love will protect me always.

content: 13 For misfortunes without number envelop me; my iniquities have caught up with me; I cannot see; they are more than the hairs of my head; I am at my wits’ end.
content_old: 13 For misfortunes without number envelop me; my iniquities have caught up with me; I cannot see; they are more than the hairs of my head; I am at my wits’ end.

content: 14 O favor me, LORD, and save me; O LORD, hasten to my aid.
content_old: 14 O favor me, LORD, and save me; O LORD, hasten to my aid.

content: 15 Let those who seek to destroy my life be frustrated and disgraced; let those who wish me harm fall back in shame.
content_old: 15 Let those who seek to destroy my life be frustrated and disgraced; let those who wish me harm fall back in shame.

content: 16 Let those who say “Aha! Aha!” over me be desolate because of their frustration.
content_old: 16 Let those who say “Aha! Aha!” over me be desolate because of their frustration.

content: 17 But let all who seek You be glad and rejoice in You; let those who are eager for Your deliverance always say, “Extolled be the LORD!”
content_old: 17 But let all who seek You be glad and rejoice in You; let those who are eager for Your deliverance always say, “Extolled be the LORD!”

content: 1 For the leader. A psalm of David.
content_old: 1 For the leader. A psalm of David.

content: 2 Happy is he who is thoughtful of the wretched; in bad times may the LORD keep him from harm.
content_old: 2 Happy is he who is thoughtful of the wretched; in bad times may the LORD keep him from harm.

content: 3 May the LORD guard him and preserve him; and may he be thought happy in the land. Do not subject him to the will of his enemies.
content_old: 3 May the LORD guard him and preserve him; and may he be thought happy in the land. Do not subject him to the will of his enemies.

content: 4 The LORD will sustain him on his sickbed; You shall wholly transform his bed of suffering.
content_old: 4 The LORD will sustain him on his sickbed; You shall wholly transform his bed of suffering.

content: 5 I said, “O LORD, have mercy on me, heal me, for I have sinned against You.”
content_old: 5 I said, “O LORD, have mercy on me, heal me, for I have sinned against You.”

content: 6 My enemies speak evilly of me, “When will he die and his name perish?”
content_old: 6 My enemies speak evilly of me, “When will he die and his name perish?”

content: 7 If one comes to visit, he speaks falsely; his mind stores up evil thoughts; once outside, he speaks them.
content_old: 7 If one comes to visit, he speaks falsely; his mind stores up evil thoughts; once outside, he speaks them.

content: 8 All my enemies whisper together against me, imagining the worst for me.
content_old: 8 All my enemies whisper together against me, imagining the worst for me.

content: 9 “Something baneful has settled in him; he’ll not rise from his bed again.”
content_old: 9 “Something baneful has settled in him; he’ll not rise from his bed again.”

content: 10 My ally in whom I trusted, even he who shares my bread, has been utterly false to me.
content_old: 10 My ally in whom I trusted, even he who shares my bread, has been utterly false to me.

content: 11 But You, O LORD, have mercy on me; let me rise again and repay them.
content_old: 11 But You, O LORD, have mercy on me; let me rise again and repay them.

content: 12 Then shall I know that You are pleased with me: when my enemy cannot shout in triumph over me.
content_old: 12 Then shall I know that You are pleased with me: when my enemy cannot shout in triumph over me.

content: 13 You will support me because of my integrity, and let me abide in Your presence forever.
content_old: 13 You will support me because of my integrity, and let me abide in Your presence forever.

content: 1 For the leader. A maskil of the Korahites.
content_old: 1 For the leader. A maskil of the Korahites.

content: 2 Like a hind crying for water, my soul cries for You, O God;
content_old: 2 Like a hind crying for water, my soul cries for You, O God;

content: 3 my soul thirsts for God, the living God; O when will I come to appear before God!
content_old: 3 my soul thirsts for God, the living God; O when will I come to appear before God!

content: 4 My tears have been my food day and night; I am ever taunted with, “Where is your God?”
content_old: 4 My tears have been my food day and night; I am ever taunted with, “Where is your God?”

content: 5 When I think of this, I pour out my soul: how I walked with the crowd, moved with them, the festive throng, to the House of God with joyous shouts of praise.
content_old: 5 When I think of this, I pour out my soul: how I walked with the crowd, moved with them, the festive throng, to the House of God with joyous shouts of praise.

content: 6 Why so downcast, my soul, why disquieted within me? Have hope in God; I will yet praise Him for His saving presence.
content_old: 6 Why so downcast, my soul, why disquieted within me? Have hope in God; I will yet praise Him for His saving presence.

content: 7 O my God, my soul is downcast; therefore I think of You in this land of Jordan and Hermon, in Mount Mizar,
content_old: 7 O my God, my soul is downcast; therefore I think of You in this land of Jordan and Hermon, in Mount Mizar,

content: 8 where deep calls to deep in the roar of Your cataracts; all Your breakers and billows have swept over me.
content_old: 8 where deep calls to deep in the roar of Your cataracts; all Your breakers and billows have swept over me.

content: 9 By day may the LORD vouchsafe His faithful care, so that at night a song to Him may be with me, a prayer to the God of my life.
content_old: 9 By day may the LORD vouchsafe His faithful care, so that at night a song to Him may be with me, a prayer to the God of my life.

content: 10 I say to God, my rock, “Why have You forgotten me, why must I walk in gloom, oppressed by my enemy?”
content_old: 10 I say to God, my rock, “Why have You forgotten me, why must I walk in gloom, oppressed by my enemy?”

content: 11 Crushing my bones, my foes revile me, taunting me always with, “Where is your God?”
content_old: 11 Crushing my bones, my foes revile me, taunting me always with, “Where is your God?”

content: 1 Vindicate me, O God, champion my cause against faithless people; rescue me from the treacherous, dishonest man.
content_old: 1 Vindicate me, O God, champion my cause against faithless people; rescue me from the treacherous, dishonest man.

content: 2 For You are my God, my stronghold; why have You rejected me? Why must I walk in gloom, oppressed by the enemy?
content_old: 2 For You are my God, my stronghold; why have You rejected me? Why must I walk in gloom, oppressed by the enemy?

content: 3 Send forth Your light and Your truth; they will lead me; they will bring me to Your holy mountain, to Your dwelling-place,
content_old: 3 Send forth Your light and Your truth; they will lead me; they will bring me to Your holy mountain, to Your dwelling-place,

content: 4 that I may come to the altar of God, God, my delight, my joy; that I may praise You with the lyre, O God, my God.
content_old: 4 that I may come to the altar of God, God, my delight, my joy; that I may praise You with the lyre, O God, my God.

content: 1 For the leader. Of the Korahites. A maskil.
content_old: 1 For the leader. Of the Korahites. A maskil.

content: 2 We have heard, O God, our fathers have told us the deeds You performed in their time, in days of old.
content_old: 2 We have heard, O God, our fathers have told us the deeds You performed in their time, in days of old.

content: 3 With Your hand You planted them, displacing nations; You brought misfortune on peoples, and drove them out.
content_old: 3 With Your hand You planted them, displacing nations; You brought misfortune on peoples, and drove them out.

content: 4 It was not by their sword that they took the land, their arm did not give them victory, but Your right hand, Your arm, and Your goodwill, for You favored them.
content_old: 4 It was not by their sword that they took the land, their arm did not give them victory, but Your right hand, Your arm, and Your goodwill, for You favored them.

content: 5 You are my king, O God; decree victories for Jacob!
content_old: 5 You are my king, O God; decree victories for Jacob!

content: 6 Through You we gore our foes; by Your name we trample our adversaries;
content_old: 6 Through You we gore our foes; by Your name we trample our adversaries;

content: 7 I do not trust in my bow; it is not my sword that gives me victory;
content_old: 7 I do not trust in my bow; it is not my sword that gives me victory;

content: 8 You give us victory over our foes; You thwart those who hate us.
content_old: 8 You give us victory over our foes; You thwart those who hate us.

content: 9 In God we glory at all times, and praise Your name unceasingly. Selah.
content_old: 9 In God we glory at all times, and praise Your name unceasingly. Selah.

content: 10 Yet You have rejected and disgraced us; You do not go with our armies.
content_old: 10 Yet You have rejected and disgraced us; You do not go with our armies.

content: 11 You make us retreat before our foe; our enemies plunder us at will.
content_old: 11 You make us retreat before our foe; our enemies plunder us at will.

content: 12 You let them devour us like sheep; You disperse us among the nations.
content_old: 12 You let them devour us like sheep; You disperse us among the nations.

content: 13 You sell Your people for no fortune, You set no high price on them.
content_old: 13 You sell Your people for no fortune, You set no high price on them.

content: 14 You make us the butt of our neighbors, the scorn and derision of those around us.
content_old: 14 You make us the butt of our neighbors, the scorn and derision of those around us.

content: 15 You make us a byword among the nations, a laughingstock among the peoples.
content_old: 15 You make us a byword among the nations, a laughingstock among the peoples.

content: 16 I am always aware of my disgrace; I am wholly covered with shame
content_old: 16 I am always aware of my disgrace; I am wholly covered with shame

content: 17 at the sound of taunting revilers, in the presence of the vengeful foe.
content_old: 17 at the sound of taunting revilers, in the presence of the vengeful foe.

content: 18 All this has come upon us, yet we have not forgotten You, or been false to Your covenant.
content_old: 18 All this has come upon us, yet we have not forgotten You, or been false to Your covenant.

content: 19 Our hearts have not gone astray, nor have our feet swerved from Your path,
content_old: 19 Our hearts have not gone astray, nor have our feet swerved from Your path,

content: 20 though You cast us, crushed, to where the sea monster is, and covered us over with deepest darkness.
content_old: 20 though You cast us, crushed, to where the sea monster is, and covered us over with deepest darkness.

content: 21 If we forgot the name of our God and spread forth our hands to a foreign god,
content_old: 21 If we forgot the name of our God and spread forth our hands to a foreign god,

content: 22 God would surely search it out, for He knows the secrets of the heart.
content_old: 22 God would surely search it out, for He knows the secrets of the heart.

content: 23 It is for Your sake that we are slain all day long, that we are regarded as sheep to be slaughtered.
content_old: 23 It is for Your sake that we are slain all day long, that we are regarded as sheep to be slaughtered.

content: 24 Rouse Yourself; why do You sleep, O Lord? Awaken, do not reject us forever!
content_old: 24 Rouse Yourself; why do You sleep, O Lord? Awaken, do not reject us forever!

content: 25 Why do You hide Your face, ignoring our affliction and distress?
content_old: 25 Why do You hide Your face, ignoring our affliction and distress?

content: 26 We lie prostrate in the dust; our body clings to the ground.
content_old: 26 We lie prostrate in the dust; our body clings to the ground.

content: 1 For the leader; on shoshannim. Of the Korahites. A maskil. A love song.
content_old: 1 For the leader; on shoshannim. Of the Korahites. A maskil. A love song.

content: 2 My heart is astir with gracious words; I speak my poem to a king; my tongue is the pen of an expert scribe.
content_old: 2 My heart is astir with gracious words; I speak my poem to a king; my tongue is the pen of an expert scribe.

content: 3 You are fairer than all men; your speech is endowed with grace; rightly has God given you an eternal blessing.
content_old: 3 You are fairer than all men; your speech is endowed with grace; rightly has God given you an eternal blessing.

content: 4 Gird your sword upon your thigh, O hero, in your splendor and glory;
content_old: 4 Gird your sword upon your thigh, O hero, in your splendor and glory;

content: 5 in your glory, win success; ride on in the cause of truth and meekness and right; and let your right hand lead you to awesome deeds.
content_old: 5 in your glory, win success; ride on in the cause of truth and meekness and right; and let your right hand lead you to awesome deeds.

content: 6 Your arrows, sharpened, piercethe breast of the king’s enemies; peoples fall at your feet.
content_old: 6 Your arrows, sharpened, piercethe breast of the king’s enemies; peoples fall at your feet.

content: 7 Your divine throne is everlasting; your royal scepter is a scepter of equity.
content_old: 7 Your divine throne is everlasting; your royal scepter is a scepter of equity.

content: 8 You love righteousness and hate wickedness; rightly has God, your God, chosen to anoint you with oil of gladness over all your peers.
content_old: 8 You love righteousness and hate wickedness; rightly has God, your God, chosen to anoint you with oil of gladness over all your peers.

content: 9 All your robes are fragrant with myrrh and aloes and cassia; from ivoried palaces lutes entertain you.
content_old: 9 All your robes are fragrant with myrrh and aloes and cassia; from ivoried palaces lutes entertain you.

content: 10 Royal princesses are your favorites; the consort stands at your right hand, decked in gold of Ophir.
content_old: 10 Royal princesses are your favorites; the consort stands at your right hand, decked in gold of Ophir.

content: 11 Take heed, lass, and note, incline your ear: forget your people and your father’s house,
content_old: 11 Take heed, lass, and note, incline your ear: forget your people and your father’s house,

content: 12 and let the king be aroused by your beauty; since he is your lord, bow to him.
content_old: 12 and let the king be aroused by your beauty; since he is your lord, bow to him.

content: 13 O Tyrian lass, the wealthiest people will court your favor with gifts,
content_old: 13 O Tyrian lass, the wealthiest people will court your favor with gifts,

content: 14 goods of all sorts. The royal princess, her dress embroidered with golden mountings,
content_old: 14 goods of all sorts. The royal princess, her dress embroidered with golden mountings,

content: 15 is led inside to the king; maidens in her train, her companions, are presented to you.
content_old: 15 is led inside to the king; maidens in her train, her companions, are presented to you.

content: 16 They are led in with joy and gladness; they enter the palace of the king.
content_old: 16 They are led in with joy and gladness; they enter the palace of the king.

content: 17 Your sons will succeed your ancestors; you will appoint them princes throughout the land.
content_old: 17 Your sons will succeed your ancestors; you will appoint them princes throughout the land.

content: 1 For the leader. Of the Korahites; on alamoth. A song.
content_old: 1 For the leader. Of the Korahites; on alamoth. A song.

content: 2 God is our refuge and stronghold, a help in trouble, very near.
content_old: 2 God is our refuge and stronghold, a help in trouble, very near.

content: 3 Therefore we are not afraid though the earth reels, though mountains topple into the sea—
content_old: 3 Therefore we are not afraid though the earth reels, though mountains topple into the sea—

content: 4 its waters rage and foam; in its swell mountains quake. Selah.
content_old: 4 its waters rage and foam; in its swell mountains quake. Selah.

content: 5 There is a river whose streams gladden God’s city, the holy dwelling-place of the Most High.
content_old: 5 There is a river whose streams gladden God’s city, the holy dwelling-place of the Most High.

content: 6 God is in its midst, it will not be toppled; by daybreak God will come to its aid.
content_old: 6 God is in its midst, it will not be toppled; by daybreak God will come to its aid.

content: 7 Nations rage, kingdoms topple; at the sound of His thunder the earth dissolves.
content_old: 7 Nations rage, kingdoms topple; at the sound of His thunder the earth dissolves.

content: 8 The LORD of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our haven. Selah.
content_old: 8 The LORD of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our haven. Selah.

content: 9 Come and see what the LORD has done, how He has wrought desolation on the earth.
content_old: 9 Come and see what the LORD has done, how He has wrought desolation on the earth.

content: 10 He puts a stop to wars throughout the earth, breaking the bow, snapping the spear, consigning wagons to the flames.
content_old: 10 He puts a stop to wars throughout the earth, breaking the bow, snapping the spear, consigning wagons to the flames.

content: 11 “Desist! Realize that I am God! I dominate the nations; I dominate the earth.”
content_old: 11 “Desist! Realize that I am God! I dominate the nations; I dominate the earth.”

content: 1 For the leader. Of the Korahites. A psalm.
content_old: 1 For the leader. Of the Korahites. A psalm.

content: 2 All you peoples, clap your hands, raise a joyous shout for God.
content_old: 2 All you peoples, clap your hands, raise a joyous shout for God.

content: 3 For the LORD Most High is awesome, great king over all the earth;
content_old: 3 For the LORD Most High is awesome, great king over all the earth;

content: 4 He subjects peoples to us, sets nations at our feet.
content_old: 4 He subjects peoples to us, sets nations at our feet.

content: 5 He chose our heritage for us, the pride of Jacob whom He loved. Selah.
content_old: 5 He chose our heritage for us, the pride of Jacob whom He loved. Selah.

content: 6 God ascends midst acclamation; the LORD, to the blasts of the horn.
content_old: 6 God ascends midst acclamation; the LORD, to the blasts of the horn.

content: 7 Sing, O sing to God; sing, O sing to our king;
content_old: 7 Sing, O sing to God; sing, O sing to our king;

content: 8 for God is king over all the earth; sing a hymn.
content_old: 8 for God is king over all the earth; sing a hymn.

content: 9 God reigns over the nations; God is seated on His holy throne.
content_old: 9 God reigns over the nations; God is seated on His holy throne.

content: 1 A song. A psalm of the Korahites.
content_old: 1 A song. A psalm of the Korahites.

content: 2 The LORD is great and much acclaimed in the city of our God, His holy mountain—
content_old: 2 The LORD is great and much acclaimed in the city of our God, His holy mountain—

content: 3 fair-crested, joy of all the earth, Mount Zion, summit of Zaphon, city of the great king.
content_old: 3 fair-crested, joy of all the earth, Mount Zion, summit of Zaphon, city of the great king.

content: 4 Through its citadels, God has made Himself known as a haven.
content_old: 4 Through its citadels, God has made Himself known as a haven.

content: 5 See, the kings joined forces; they advanced together.
content_old: 5 See, the kings joined forces; they advanced together.

content: 6 At the mere sight of it they were stunned, they were terrified, they panicked;
content_old: 6 At the mere sight of it they were stunned, they were terrified, they panicked;

content: 7 they were seized there with a trembling, like a woman in the throes of labor,
content_old: 7 they were seized there with a trembling, like a woman in the throes of labor,

content: 8 as the Tarshish fleet was wrecked in an easterly gale.
content_old: 8 as the Tarshish fleet was wrecked in an easterly gale.

content: 9 The likes of what we heard we have now witnessed in the city of the LORD of hosts, in the city of our God— may God preserve it forever! Selah.
content_old: 9 The likes of what we heard we have now witnessed in the city of the LORD of hosts, in the city of our God— may God preserve it forever! Selah.

content: 10 In Your temple, God, we meditate upon Your faithful care.
content_old: 10 In Your temple, God, we meditate upon Your faithful care.

content: 11 The praise of You, God, like Your name, reaches to the ends of the earth; Your right hand is filled with beneficence.
content_old: 11 The praise of You, God, like Your name, reaches to the ends of the earth; Your right hand is filled with beneficence.

content: 12 Let Mount Zion rejoice! Let the towns of Judah exult, because of Your judgments.
content_old: 12 Let Mount Zion rejoice! Let the towns of Judah exult, because of Your judgments.

content: 13 Walk around Zion, circle it; count its towers,
content_old: 13 Walk around Zion, circle it; count its towers,

content: 14 take note of its ramparts; go through its citadels, that you may recount it to a future age.
content_old: 14 take note of its ramparts; go through its citadels, that you may recount it to a future age.

content: 1 For the leader. Of the Korahites. A psalm.
content_old: 1 For the leader. Of the Korahites. A psalm.

content: 2 Hear this, all you peoples; give ear, all inhabitants of the world,
content_old: 2 Hear this, all you peoples; give ear, all inhabitants of the world,

content: 3 men of all estates, rich and poor alike.
content_old: 3 men of all estates, rich and poor alike.

content: 4 My mouth utters wisdom, my speech is full of insight.
content_old: 4 My mouth utters wisdom, my speech is full of insight.

content: 5 I will turn my attention to a theme, set forth my lesson to the music of a lyre.
content_old: 5 I will turn my attention to a theme, set forth my lesson to the music of a lyre.

content: 6 In time of trouble, why should I fear the encompassing evil of those who would supplant me—
content_old: 6 In time of trouble, why should I fear the encompassing evil of those who would supplant me—

content: 7 men who trust in their riches, who glory in their great wealth?
content_old: 7 men who trust in their riches, who glory in their great wealth?

content: 8 Ah, it cannot redeem a man, or pay his ransom to God;
content_old: 8 Ah, it cannot redeem a man, or pay his ransom to God;

content: 9 the price of life is too high; and so one ceases to be, forever.
content_old: 9 the price of life is too high; and so one ceases to be, forever.

content: 10 Shall he live eternally, and never see the grave?
content_old: 10 Shall he live eternally, and never see the grave?

content: 11 For one sees that the wise die, that the foolish and ignorant both perish, leaving their wealth to others.
content_old: 11 For one sees that the wise die, that the foolish and ignorant both perish, leaving their wealth to others.

content: 12 Their grave is their eternal home, the dwelling-place for all generations of those once famous on earth.
content_old: 12 Their grave is their eternal home, the dwelling-place for all generations of those once famous on earth.

content: 13 Man does not abide in honor; he is like the beasts that perish.
content_old: 13 Man does not abide in honor; he is like the beasts that perish.

content: 14 Such is the fate of those who are self-confident, the end of those pleased with their own talk. Selah.
content_old: 14 Such is the fate of those who are self-confident, the end of those pleased with their own talk. Selah.

content: 15 Sheeplike they head for Sheol, with Death as their shepherd. The upright shall rule over them at daybreak, and their form shall waste away in Sheol till its nobility be gone.
content_old: 15 Sheeplike they head for Sheol, with Death as their shepherd. The upright shall rule over them at daybreak, and their form shall waste away in Sheol till its nobility be gone.

content: 16 But God will redeem my life from the clutches of Sheol, for He will take me. Selah.
content_old: 16 But God will redeem my life from the clutches of Sheol, for He will take me. Selah.

content: 17 Do not be afraid when a man becomes rich, when his household goods increase;
content_old: 17 Do not be afraid when a man becomes rich, when his household goods increase;

content: 18 for when he dies he can take none of it along; his goods cannot follow him down.
content_old: 18 for when he dies he can take none of it along; his goods cannot follow him down.

content: 19 Though he congratulates himself in his lifetime —“They must admit that you did well by yourself”—
content_old: 19 Though he congratulates himself in his lifetime —“They must admit that you did well by yourself”—

content: 20 yet he must join the company of his ancestors, who will never see daylight again.
content_old: 20 yet he must join the company of his ancestors, who will never see daylight again.

content: 1 A psalm of Asaph. God, the LORD God spoke and summoned the world from east to west.
content_old: 1 A psalm of Asaph. God, the LORD God spoke and summoned the world from east to west.

content: 2 From Zion, perfect in beauty, God appeared
content_old: 2 From Zion, perfect in beauty, God appeared

content: 3 —let our God come and not fail to act! Devouring fire preceded Him; it stormed around Him fiercely.
content_old: 3 —let our God come and not fail to act! Devouring fire preceded Him; it stormed around Him fiercely.

content: 4 He summoned the heavens above, and the earth, for the trial of His people.
content_old: 4 He summoned the heavens above, and the earth, for the trial of His people.

content: 5 “Bring in My devotees, who made a covenant with Me over sacrifice!”
content_old: 5 “Bring in My devotees, who made a covenant with Me over sacrifice!”

content: 6 Then the heavens proclaimed His righteousness, for He is a God who judges. Selah.
content_old: 6 Then the heavens proclaimed His righteousness, for He is a God who judges. Selah.

content: 7 “Pay heed, My people, and I will speak, O Israel, and I will arraign you. I am God, your God.
content_old: 7 “Pay heed, My people, and I will speak, O Israel, and I will arraign you. I am God, your God.

content: 8 I censure you not for your sacrifices, and your burnt offerings, made to Me daily;
content_old: 8 I censure you not for your sacrifices, and your burnt offerings, made to Me daily;

content: 9 I claim no bull from your estate, no he-goats from your pens.
content_old: 9 I claim no bull from your estate, no he-goats from your pens.

content: 10 For Mine is every animal of the forest, the beasts on a thousand mountains.
content_old: 10 For Mine is every animal of the forest, the beasts on a thousand mountains.

content: 11 I know every bird of the mountains, the creatures of the field are subject to Me.
content_old: 11 I know every bird of the mountains, the creatures of the field are subject to Me.

content: 12 Were I hungry, I would not tell you, for Mine is the world and all it holds.
content_old: 12 Were I hungry, I would not tell you, for Mine is the world and all it holds.

content: 13 Do I eat the flesh of bulls, or drink the blood of he-goats?
content_old: 13 Do I eat the flesh of bulls, or drink the blood of he-goats?

content: 14 Sacrifice a thank offering to God, and pay your vows to the Most High.
content_old: 14 Sacrifice a thank offering to God, and pay your vows to the Most High.

content: 15 Call upon Me in time of trouble; I will rescue you, and you shall honor Me.”
content_old: 15 Call upon Me in time of trouble; I will rescue you, and you shall honor Me.”

content: 16 And to the wicked, God said: “Who are you to recite My laws, and mouth the terms of My covenant,
content_old: 16 And to the wicked, God said: “Who are you to recite My laws, and mouth the terms of My covenant,

content: 17 seeing that you spurn My discipline, and brush My words aside?
content_old: 17 seeing that you spurn My discipline, and brush My words aside?

content: 18 When you see a thief, you fall in with him, and throw in your lot with adulterers;
content_old: 18 When you see a thief, you fall in with him, and throw in your lot with adulterers;

content: 19 you devote your mouth to evil, and yoke your tongue to deceit;
content_old: 19 you devote your mouth to evil, and yoke your tongue to deceit;

content: 20 you are busy maligning your brother, defaming the son of your mother.
content_old: 20 you are busy maligning your brother, defaming the son of your mother.

content: 21 If I failed to act when you did these things, you would fancy that I was like you; so I censure you and confront you with charges.
content_old: 21 If I failed to act when you did these things, you would fancy that I was like you; so I censure you and confront you with charges.

content: 22 Mark this, you who are unmindful of God, lest I tear you apart and no one save you.
content_old: 22 Mark this, you who are unmindful of God, lest I tear you apart and no one save you.

content: 1 For the leader. A psalm of David,
content_old: 1 For the leader. A psalm of David,

content: 2 when Nathan the prophet came to him after he had come to Bathsheba.
content_old: 2 when Nathan the prophet came to him after he had come to Bathsheba.

content: 3 Have mercy upon me, O God, as befits Your faithfulness; in keeping with Your abundant compassion, blot out my transgressions.
content_old: 3 Have mercy upon me, O God, as befits Your faithfulness; in keeping with Your abundant compassion, blot out my transgressions.

content: 4 Wash me thoroughly of my iniquity, and purify me of my sin;
content_old: 4 Wash me thoroughly of my iniquity, and purify me of my sin;

content: 5 for I recognize my transgressions, and am ever conscious of my sin.
content_old: 5 for I recognize my transgressions, and am ever conscious of my sin.

content: 6 Against You alone have I sinned, and done what is evil in Your sight; so You are just in Your sentence, and right in Your judgment.
content_old: 6 Against You alone have I sinned, and done what is evil in Your sight; so You are just in Your sentence, and right in Your judgment.

content: 7 Indeed I was born with iniquity; with sin my mother conceived me.
content_old: 7 Indeed I was born with iniquity; with sin my mother conceived me.

content: 8 Indeed You desire truth about that which is hidden; teach me wisdom about secret things.
content_old: 8 Indeed You desire truth about that which is hidden; teach me wisdom about secret things.

content: 9 Purge me with hyssop till I am pure; wash me till I am whiter than snow.
content_old: 9 Purge me with hyssop till I am pure; wash me till I am whiter than snow.

content: 10 Let me hear tidings of joy and gladness; let the bones You have crushed exult.
content_old: 10 Let me hear tidings of joy and gladness; let the bones You have crushed exult.

content: 11 Hide Your face from my sins; blot out all my iniquities.
content_old: 11 Hide Your face from my sins; blot out all my iniquities.

content: 12 Fashion a pure heart for me, O God; create in me a steadfast spirit.
content_old: 12 Fashion a pure heart for me, O God; create in me a steadfast spirit.

content: 13 Do not cast me out of Your presence, or take Your holy spirit away from me.
content_old: 13 Do not cast me out of Your presence, or take Your holy spirit away from me.

content: 14 Let me again rejoice in Your help; let a vigorous spirit sustain me.
content_old: 14 Let me again rejoice in Your help; let a vigorous spirit sustain me.

content: 15 I will teach transgressors Your ways, that sinners may return to You.
content_old: 15 I will teach transgressors Your ways, that sinners may return to You.

content: 16 Save me from bloodguilt, O God, God, my deliverer, that I may sing forth Your beneficence.
content_old: 16 Save me from bloodguilt, O God, God, my deliverer, that I may sing forth Your beneficence.

content: 17 O LORD, open my lips, and let my mouth declare Your praise.
content_old: 17 O LORD, open my lips, and let my mouth declare Your praise.

content: 18 You do not want me to bring sacrifices; You do not desire burnt offerings;
content_old: 18 You do not want me to bring sacrifices; You do not desire burnt offerings;

content: 19 True sacrifice to God is a contrite spirit; God, You will not despise a contrite and crushed heart.
content_old: 19 True sacrifice to God is a contrite spirit; God, You will not despise a contrite and crushed heart.

content: 20 May it please You to make Zion prosper; rebuild the walls of Jerusalem.
content_old: 20 May it please You to make Zion prosper; rebuild the walls of Jerusalem.

content: 1 For the leader. A maskil of David,
content_old: 1 For the leader. A maskil of David,

content: 2 when Doeg the Edomite came and informed Saul, telling him, “David came to Ahimelech’s house.”
content_old: 2 when Doeg the Edomite came and informed Saul, telling him, “David came to Ahimelech’s house.”

content: 3 Why do you boast of your evil, brave fellow? God’s faithfulness never ceases.
content_old: 3 Why do you boast of your evil, brave fellow? God’s faithfulness never ceases.

content: 4 Your tongue devises mischief, like a sharpened razor that works treacherously.
content_old: 4 Your tongue devises mischief, like a sharpened razor that works treacherously.

content: 5 You prefer evil to good, the lie, to speaking truthfully. Selah.
content_old: 5 You prefer evil to good, the lie, to speaking truthfully. Selah.

content: 6 You love all pernicious words, treacherous speech.
content_old: 6 You love all pernicious words, treacherous speech.

content: 7 So God will tear you down for good, will break you and pluck you from your tent, and root you out of the land of the living. Selah.
content_old: 7 So God will tear you down for good, will break you and pluck you from your tent, and root you out of the land of the living. Selah.

content: 8 The righteous, seeing it, will be awestruck; they will jibe at him, saying,
content_old: 8 The righteous, seeing it, will be awestruck; they will jibe at him, saying,

content: 9 “Here was a fellow who did not make God his refuge, but trusted in his great wealth, relied upon his mischief.”
content_old: 9 “Here was a fellow who did not make God his refuge, but trusted in his great wealth, relied upon his mischief.”

content: 10 But I am like a thriving olive tree in God’s house; I trust in the faithfulness of God forever and ever.
content_old: 10 But I am like a thriving olive tree in God’s house; I trust in the faithfulness of God forever and ever.

content: 1 For the leader; on mahalath. A maskil of David.
content_old: 1 For the leader; on mahalath. A maskil of David.

content: 2 The benighted man thinks, “God does not care.” Man’s wrongdoing is corrupt and loathsome; no one does good.
content_old: 2 The benighted man thinks, “God does not care.” Man’s wrongdoing is corrupt and loathsome; no one does good.

content: 3 God looks down from heaven on mankind to find a man of understanding, a man mindful of God.
content_old: 3 God looks down from heaven on mankind to find a man of understanding, a man mindful of God.

content: 4 Everyone is dross, altogether foul; there is none who does good, not even one.
content_old: 4 Everyone is dross, altogether foul; there is none who does good, not even one.

content: 5 Are they so witless, those evildoers, who devour my people as they devour food, and do not invoke God?
content_old: 5 Are they so witless, those evildoers, who devour my people as they devour food, and do not invoke God?

content: 6 There they will be seized with fright —never was there such a fright— for God has scattered the bones of your besiegers; you have put them to shame, for God has rejected them.
content_old: 6 There they will be seized with fright —never was there such a fright— for God has scattered the bones of your besiegers; you have put them to shame, for God has rejected them.

content: 1 For the leader; with instrumental music. A maskil of David,
content_old: 1 For the leader; with instrumental music. A maskil of David,

content: 2 when the Ziphites came and told Saul, “Know, David is in hiding among us.”
content_old: 2 when the Ziphites came and told Saul, “Know, David is in hiding among us.”

content: 3 O God, deliver me by Your name; by Your power vindicate me.
content_old: 3 O God, deliver me by Your name; by Your power vindicate me.

content: 4 O God, hear my prayer; give ear to the words of my mouth.
content_old: 4 O God, hear my prayer; give ear to the words of my mouth.

content: 5 For strangers have risen against me, and ruthless men seek my life; they are unmindful of God. Selah.
content_old: 5 For strangers have risen against me, and ruthless men seek my life; they are unmindful of God. Selah.

content: 6 See, God is my helper; the LORD is my support.
content_old: 6 See, God is my helper; the LORD is my support.

content: 7 He will repay the evil of my watchful foes; by Your faithfulness, destroy them!
content_old: 7 He will repay the evil of my watchful foes; by Your faithfulness, destroy them!

content: 8 Then I will offer You a freewill sacrifice; I will praise Your name, LORD, for it is good,
content_old: 8 Then I will offer You a freewill sacrifice; I will praise Your name, LORD, for it is good,

content: 1 For the leader; with instrumental music. A maskil of David.
content_old: 1 For the leader; with instrumental music. A maskil of David.

content: 2 Give ear, O God, to my prayer; do not ignore my plea;
content_old: 2 Give ear, O God, to my prayer; do not ignore my plea;

content: 3 pay heed to me and answer me. I am tossed about, complaining and moaning
content_old: 3 pay heed to me and answer me. I am tossed about, complaining and moaning

content: 4 at the clamor of the enemy, because of the oppression of the wicked; for they bring evil upon me and furiously harass me.
content_old: 4 at the clamor of the enemy, because of the oppression of the wicked; for they bring evil upon me and furiously harass me.

content: 5 My heart is convulsed within me; terrors of death assail me.
content_old: 5 My heart is convulsed within me; terrors of death assail me.

content: 6 Fear and trembling invade me; I am clothed with horror.
content_old: 6 Fear and trembling invade me; I am clothed with horror.

content: 7 I said, “O that I had the wings of a dove! I would fly away and find rest;
content_old: 7 I said, “O that I had the wings of a dove! I would fly away and find rest;

content: 8 surely, I would flee far off; I would lodge in the wilderness; Selah.
content_old: 8 surely, I would flee far off; I would lodge in the wilderness; Selah.

content: 9 I would soon find me a refuge from the sweeping wind, from the tempest.”
content_old: 9 I would soon find me a refuge from the sweeping wind, from the tempest.”

content: 10 O LORD, confound their speech, confuse it! For I see lawlessness and strife in the city;
content_old: 10 O LORD, confound their speech, confuse it! For I see lawlessness and strife in the city;

content: 11 day and night they make their rounds on its walls; evil and mischief are inside it.
content_old: 11 day and night they make their rounds on its walls; evil and mischief are inside it.

content: 12 Malice is within it; fraud and deceit never leave its square.
content_old: 12 Malice is within it; fraud and deceit never leave its square.

content: 13 It is not an enemy who reviles me —I could bear that; it is not my foe who vaunts himself against me —I could hide from him;
content_old: 13 It is not an enemy who reviles me —I could bear that; it is not my foe who vaunts himself against me —I could hide from him;

content: 14 but it is you, my equal, my companion, my friend;
content_old: 14 but it is you, my equal, my companion, my friend;

content: 15 sweet was our fellowship; we walked together in God’s house.
content_old: 15 sweet was our fellowship; we walked together in God’s house.

content: 16 Let Him incite death against them; may they go down alive into Sheol! For where they dwell, there evil is.
content_old: 16 Let Him incite death against them; may they go down alive into Sheol! For where they dwell, there evil is.

content: 17 As for me, I call to God; the LORD will deliver me.
content_old: 17 As for me, I call to God; the LORD will deliver me.

content: 18 Evening, morning, and noon, I complain and moan, and He hears my voice.
content_old: 18 Evening, morning, and noon, I complain and moan, and He hears my voice.

content: 19 He redeems me unharmed from the battle against me; it is as though many are on my side.
content_old: 19 He redeems me unharmed from the battle against me; it is as though many are on my side.

content: 20 God who has reigned from the first, who will have no successor, hears and humbles those who have no fear of God. Selah.
content_old: 20 God who has reigned from the first, who will have no successor, hears and humbles those who have no fear of God. Selah.

content: 21 He harmed his ally, he broke his pact;
content_old: 21 He harmed his ally, he broke his pact;

content: 22 his talk was smoother than butter, yet his mind was on war; his words were more soothing than oil, yet they were drawn swords.
content_old: 22 his talk was smoother than butter, yet his mind was on war; his words were more soothing than oil, yet they were drawn swords.

content: 23 Cast your burden on the LORD and He will sustain you; He will never let the righteous man collapse.
content_old: 23 Cast your burden on the LORD and He will sustain you; He will never let the righteous man collapse.

content: 1 For the leader; on jonath elem rehokim. Of David. A michtam; when the Philistines seized him in Gath.
content_old: 1 For the leader; on jonath elem rehokim. Of David. A michtam; when the Philistines seized him in Gath.

content: 2 Have mercy on me, O God, for men persecute me; all day long my adversary oppresses me.
content_old: 2 Have mercy on me, O God, for men persecute me; all day long my adversary oppresses me.

content: 3 My watchful foes persecute me all day long; many are my adversaries, O Exalted One.
content_old: 3 My watchful foes persecute me all day long; many are my adversaries, O Exalted One.

content: 4 When I am afraid, I trust in You,
content_old: 4 When I am afraid, I trust in You,

content: 5 in God, whose word I praise, in God I trust; I am not afraid; what can mortals do to me?
content_old: 5 in God, whose word I praise, in God I trust; I am not afraid; what can mortals do to me?

content: 6 All day long they cause me grief in my affairs, they plan only evil against me.
content_old: 6 All day long they cause me grief in my affairs, they plan only evil against me.

content: 7 They plot, they lie in ambush; they watch my every move, hoping for my death.
content_old: 7 They plot, they lie in ambush; they watch my every move, hoping for my death.

content: 8 Cast them out for their evil; subdue peoples in Your anger, O God.
content_old: 8 Cast them out for their evil; subdue peoples in Your anger, O God.

content: 9 You keep count of my wanderings; put my tears into Your flask, into Your record.
content_old: 9 You keep count of my wanderings; put my tears into Your flask, into Your record.

content: 10 Then my enemies will retreat when I call on You; this I know, that God is for me.
content_old: 10 Then my enemies will retreat when I call on You; this I know, that God is for me.

content: 11 In God, whose word I praise, in the LORD, whose word I praise,
content_old: 11 In God, whose word I praise, in the LORD, whose word I praise,

content: 12 in God I trust; I am not afraid; what can man do to me?
content_old: 12 in God I trust; I am not afraid; what can man do to me?

content: 13 I must pay my vows to You, O God; I will render thank offerings to You.
content_old: 13 I must pay my vows to You, O God; I will render thank offerings to You.

content: 1 For the leader; al tashheth. Of David. A michtam; when he fled from Saul into a cave.
content_old: 1 For the leader; al tashheth. Of David. A michtam; when he fled from Saul into a cave.

content: 2 Have mercy on me, O God, have mercy on me, for I seek refuge in You, I seek refuge in the shadow of Your wings, until danger passes.
content_old: 2 Have mercy on me, O God, have mercy on me, for I seek refuge in You, I seek refuge in the shadow of Your wings, until danger passes.

content: 3 I call to God Most High, to God who is good to me.
content_old: 3 I call to God Most High, to God who is good to me.

content: 4 He will reach down from heaven and deliver me: God will send down His steadfast love; my persecutor reviles. Selah.
content_old: 4 He will reach down from heaven and deliver me: God will send down His steadfast love; my persecutor reviles. Selah.

content: 5 As for me, I lie down among man-eating lions whose teeth are spears and arrows, whose tongue is a sharp sword.
content_old: 5 As for me, I lie down among man-eating lions whose teeth are spears and arrows, whose tongue is a sharp sword.

content: 6 Exalt Yourself over the heavens, O God, let Your glory be over all the earth!
content_old: 6 Exalt Yourself over the heavens, O God, let Your glory be over all the earth!

content: 7 They prepared a net for my feet to ensnare me; they dug a pit for me, but they fell into it. Selah.
content_old: 7 They prepared a net for my feet to ensnare me; they dug a pit for me, but they fell into it. Selah.

content: 8 My heart is firm, O God; my heart is firm; I will sing, I will chant a hymn.
content_old: 8 My heart is firm, O God; my heart is firm; I will sing, I will chant a hymn.

content: 9 Awake, O my soul! Awake, O harp and lyre! I will wake the dawn.
