content_old: 9 Awake, O my soul! Awake, O harp and lyre! I will wake the dawn.

content: 10 I will praise You among the peoples, O LORD; I will sing a hymn to You among the nations;
content_old: 10 I will praise You among the peoples, O LORD; I will sing a hymn to You among the nations;

content: 11 for Your faithfulness is as high as heaven; Your steadfastness reaches to the sky.
content_old: 11 for Your faithfulness is as high as heaven; Your steadfastness reaches to the sky.

content: 1 For the leader; al tashheth. Of David. A michtam.
content_old: 1 For the leader; al tashheth. Of David. A michtam.

content: 2 O mighty ones, do you really decree what is just? Do you judge mankind with equity?
content_old: 2 O mighty ones, do you really decree what is just? Do you judge mankind with equity?

content: 3 In your minds you devise wrongdoing in the land; with your hands you deal out lawlessness.
content_old: 3 In your minds you devise wrongdoing in the land; with your hands you deal out lawlessness.

content: 4 The wicked are defiant from birth; the liars go astray from the womb.
content_old: 4 The wicked are defiant from birth; the liars go astray from the womb.

content: 5 Their venom is like that of a snake, a deaf viper that stops its ears
content_old: 5 Their venom is like that of a snake, a deaf viper that stops its ears

content: 6 so as not to hear the voice of charmers or the expert mutterer of spells.
content_old: 6 so as not to hear the voice of charmers or the expert mutterer of spells.

content: 7 O God, smash their teeth in their mouth; shatter the fangs of lions, O LORD;
content_old: 7 O God, smash their teeth in their mouth; shatter the fangs of lions, O LORD;

content: 8 let them melt, let them vanish like water; let Him aim His arrows that they be cut down;
content_old: 8 let them melt, let them vanish like water; let Him aim His arrows that they be cut down;

content: 9 like a snail that melts away as it moves; like a woman’s stillbirth, may they never see the sun!
content_old: 9 like a snail that melts away as it moves; like a woman’s stillbirth, may they never see the sun!

content: 10 Before the thorns grow into a bramble, may He whirl them away alive in fury.
content_old: 10 Before the thorns grow into a bramble, may He whirl them away alive in fury.

content: 11 The righteous man will rejoice when he sees revenge; he will bathe his feet in the blood of the wicked.
content_old: 11 The righteous man will rejoice when he sees revenge; he will bathe his feet in the blood of the wicked.

content: 1 For the leader; al tashheth. Of David. A michtam; when Saul sent men to watch his house in order to put him to death.
content_old: 1 For the leader; al tashheth. Of David. A michtam; when Saul sent men to watch his house in order to put him to death.

content: 2 Save me from my enemies, O my God; secure me against my assailants.
content_old: 2 Save me from my enemies, O my God; secure me against my assailants.

content: 3 Save me from evildoers; deliver me from murderers.
content_old: 3 Save me from evildoers; deliver me from murderers.

content: 4 For see, they lie in wait for me; fierce men plot against me for no offense of mine, for no transgression, O LORD;
content_old: 4 For see, they lie in wait for me; fierce men plot against me for no offense of mine, for no transgression, O LORD;

content: 5 for no guilt of mine do they rush to array themselves against me. Look, rouse Yourself on my behalf!
content_old: 5 for no guilt of mine do they rush to array themselves against me. Look, rouse Yourself on my behalf!

content: 6 You, O LORD God of hosts, God of Israel, bestir Yourself to bring all nations to account; have no mercy on any treacherous villain. Selah.
content_old: 6 You, O LORD God of hosts, God of Israel, bestir Yourself to bring all nations to account; have no mercy on any treacherous villain. Selah.

content: 7 They come each evening growling like dogs, roaming the city.
content_old: 7 They come each evening growling like dogs, roaming the city.

content: 8 They rave with their mouths, sharp words are on their lips; they think,“Who hears?”
content_old: 8 They rave with their mouths, sharp words are on their lips; they think,“Who hears?”

content: 9 But You, O LORD, laugh at them; You mock all the nations.
content_old: 9 But You, O LORD, laugh at them; You mock all the nations.

content: 10 O my strength, I wait for You; for God is my haven.
content_old: 10 O my strength, I wait for You; for God is my haven.

content: 11 My faithful God will come to aid me; God will let me gloat over my watchful foes.
content_old: 11 My faithful God will come to aid me; God will let me gloat over my watchful foes.

content: 12 Do not kill them lest my people be unmindful; with Your power make wanderers of them; bring them low, O our shield, the Lord,
content_old: 12 Do not kill them lest my people be unmindful; with Your power make wanderers of them; bring them low, O our shield, the Lord,

content: 13 because of their sinful mouths, the words on their lips. Let them be trapped by their pride, and by the imprecations and lies they utter.
content_old: 13 because of their sinful mouths, the words on their lips. Let them be trapped by their pride, and by the imprecations and lies they utter.

content: 14 In Your fury put an end to them; put an end to them that they be no more; that it may be known to the ends of the earth that God does rule over Jacob. Selah.
content_old: 14 In Your fury put an end to them; put an end to them that they be no more; that it may be known to the ends of the earth that God does rule over Jacob. Selah.

content: 15 They come each evening growling like dogs, roaming the city.
content_old: 15 They come each evening growling like dogs, roaming the city.

content: 16 They wander in search of food; and whine if they are not satisfied.
content_old: 16 They wander in search of food; and whine if they are not satisfied.

content: 17 But I will sing of Your strength, extol each morning Your faithfulness; for You have been my haven, a refuge in time of trouble.
content_old: 17 But I will sing of Your strength, extol each morning Your faithfulness; for You have been my haven, a refuge in time of trouble.

content: 1 For the leader; on shushan eduth. A michtam of David to be taught,
content_old: 1 For the leader; on shushan eduth. A michtam of David to be taught,

content: 2 when he fought with Aram-Naharaim and Aram-Zobah, and Joab returned and defeated Edom—of twelve thousand men—in the Valley of Salt.
content_old: 2 when he fought with Aram-Naharaim and Aram-Zobah, and Joab returned and defeated Edom—of twelve thousand men—in the Valley of Salt.

content: 3 O God, You have rejected us, You have made a breach in us; You have been angry; restore us!
content_old: 3 O God, You have rejected us, You have made a breach in us; You have been angry; restore us!

content: 4 You have made the land quake; You have torn it open. Mend its fissures, for it is collapsing.
content_old: 4 You have made the land quake; You have torn it open. Mend its fissures, for it is collapsing.

content: 5 You have made Your people suffer hardship; You have given us wine that makes us reel.
content_old: 5 You have made Your people suffer hardship; You have given us wine that makes us reel.

content: 6 Give those who fear You because of Your truth a banner for rallying. Selah.
content_old: 6 Give those who fear You because of Your truth a banner for rallying. Selah.

content: 7 That those whom You love might be rescued, deliver with Your right hand and answer me.
content_old: 7 That those whom You love might be rescued, deliver with Your right hand and answer me.

content: 8 God promised in His sanctuary that I would exultingly divide up Shechem, and measure the Valley of Sukkoth;
content_old: 8 God promised in His sanctuary that I would exultingly divide up Shechem, and measure the Valley of Sukkoth;

content: 9 Gilead and Manasseh would be mine, Ephraim my chief stronghold, Judah my scepter;
content_old: 9 Gilead and Manasseh would be mine, Ephraim my chief stronghold, Judah my scepter;

content: 10 Moab would be my washbasin; on Edom I would cast my shoe; acclaim me, O Philistia!
content_old: 10 Moab would be my washbasin; on Edom I would cast my shoe; acclaim me, O Philistia!

content: 11 Would that I were brought to the bastion! Would that I were led to Edom!
content_old: 11 Would that I were brought to the bastion! Would that I were led to Edom!

content: 12 But You have rejected us, O God; God, You do not march with our armies.
content_old: 12 But You have rejected us, O God; God, You do not march with our armies.

content: 13 Grant us Your aid against the foe, for the help of man is worthless.
content_old: 13 Grant us Your aid against the foe, for the help of man is worthless.

content: 1 For the leader; with instrumental music. Of David.
content_old: 1 For the leader; with instrumental music. Of David.

content: 2 Hear my cry, O God, heed my prayer.
content_old: 2 Hear my cry, O God, heed my prayer.

content: 3 From the end of the earth I call to You; when my heart is faint, You lead me to a rock that is high above me.
content_old: 3 From the end of the earth I call to You; when my heart is faint, You lead me to a rock that is high above me.

content: 4 For You have been my refuge, a tower of strength against the enemy.
content_old: 4 For You have been my refuge, a tower of strength against the enemy.

content: 5 O that I might dwell in Your tent forever, take refuge under Your protecting wings. Selah.
content_old: 5 O that I might dwell in Your tent forever, take refuge under Your protecting wings. Selah.

content: 6 O God, You have heard my vows; grant the request of those who fear Your name.
content_old: 6 O God, You have heard my vows; grant the request of those who fear Your name.

content: 7 Add days to the days of the king; may his years extend through generations;
content_old: 7 Add days to the days of the king; may his years extend through generations;

content: 8 may he dwell in God’s presence forever; appoint steadfast love to guard him.
content_old: 8 may he dwell in God’s presence forever; appoint steadfast love to guard him.

content: 1 For the leader; on Jeduthun. A psalm of David.
content_old: 1 For the leader; on Jeduthun. A psalm of David.

content: 2 Truly my soul waits quietly for God; my deliverance comes from Him.
content_old: 2 Truly my soul waits quietly for God; my deliverance comes from Him.

content: 3 Truly He is my rock and deliverance, my haven; I shall never be shaken.
content_old: 3 Truly He is my rock and deliverance, my haven; I shall never be shaken.

content: 4 How long will all of you attack a man, to crush him, as though he were a leaning wall, a tottering fence?
content_old: 4 How long will all of you attack a man, to crush him, as though he were a leaning wall, a tottering fence?

content: 5 They lay plans to topple him from his rank; they delight in falsehood; they bless with their mouths, while inwardly they curse. Selah.
content_old: 5 They lay plans to topple him from his rank; they delight in falsehood; they bless with their mouths, while inwardly they curse. Selah.

content: 6 Truly, wait quietly for God, O my soul, for my hope comes from Him.
content_old: 6 Truly, wait quietly for God, O my soul, for my hope comes from Him.

content: 7 He is my rock and deliverance, my haven; I shall not be shaken.
content_old: 7 He is my rock and deliverance, my haven; I shall not be shaken.

content: 8 I rely on God, my deliverance and glory, my rock of strength; in God is my refuge.
content_old: 8 I rely on God, my deliverance and glory, my rock of strength; in God is my refuge.

content: 9 Trust in Him at all times, O people; pour out your hearts before Him; God is our refuge. Selah.
content_old: 9 Trust in Him at all times, O people; pour out your hearts before Him; God is our refuge. Selah.

content: 10 Men are mere breath; mortals, illusion; placed on a scale all together, they weigh even less than a breath.
content_old: 10 Men are mere breath; mortals, illusion; placed on a scale all together, they weigh even less than a breath.

content: 11 Do not trust in violence, or put false hopes in robbery; if force bears fruit pay it no mind.
content_old: 11 Do not trust in violence, or put false hopes in robbery; if force bears fruit pay it no mind.

content: 12 One thing God has spoken; two things have I heard: that might belongs to God,
content_old: 12 One thing God has spoken; two things have I heard: that might belongs to God,

content: 1 A psalm of David, when he was in the Wilderness of Judah.
content_old: 1 A psalm of David, when he was in the Wilderness of Judah.

content: 2 God, You are my God; I search for You, my soul thirsts for You, my body yearns for You, as a parched and thirsty land that has no water.
content_old: 2 God, You are my God; I search for You, my soul thirsts for You, my body yearns for You, as a parched and thirsty land that has no water.

content: 3 I shall behold You in the sanctuary, and see Your might and glory,
content_old: 3 I shall behold You in the sanctuary, and see Your might and glory,

content: 4 Truly Your faithfulness is better than life; my lips declare Your praise.
content_old: 4 Truly Your faithfulness is better than life; my lips declare Your praise.

content: 5 I bless You all my life; I lift up my hands, invoking Your name.
content_old: 5 I bless You all my life; I lift up my hands, invoking Your name.

content: 6 I am sated as with a rich feast, I sing praises with joyful lips
content_old: 6 I am sated as with a rich feast, I sing praises with joyful lips

content: 7 when I call You to mind upon my bed, when I think of You in the watches of the night;
content_old: 7 when I call You to mind upon my bed, when I think of You in the watches of the night;

content: 8 for You are my help, and in the shadow of Your wings I shout for joy.
content_old: 8 for You are my help, and in the shadow of Your wings I shout for joy.

content: 9 My soul is attached to You; Your right hand supports me.
content_old: 9 My soul is attached to You; Your right hand supports me.

content: 10 May those who seek to destroy my life enter the depths of the earth.
content_old: 10 May those who seek to destroy my life enter the depths of the earth.

content: 11 May they be gutted by the sword; may they be prey to jackals.
content_old: 11 May they be gutted by the sword; may they be prey to jackals.

content: 1 For the leader. A psalm of David.
content_old: 1 For the leader. A psalm of David.

content: 2 Hear my voice, O God, when I plead; guard my life from the enemy’s terror.
content_old: 2 Hear my voice, O God, when I plead; guard my life from the enemy’s terror.

content: 3 Hide me from a band of evil men, from a crowd of evildoers,
content_old: 3 Hide me from a band of evil men, from a crowd of evildoers,

content: 4 who whet their tongues like swords; they aim their arrows—cruel words—
content_old: 4 who whet their tongues like swords; they aim their arrows—cruel words—

content: 5 to shoot from hiding at the blameless man; they shoot him suddenly and without fear.
content_old: 5 to shoot from hiding at the blameless man; they shoot him suddenly and without fear.

content: 6 They arm themselves with an evil word; when they speak, it is to conceal traps; they think, “Who will see them?”
content_old: 6 They arm themselves with an evil word; when they speak, it is to conceal traps; they think, “Who will see them?”

content: 7 Let the wrongdoings they have concealed, each one inside him, his secret thoughts, be wholly exposed.
content_old: 7 Let the wrongdoings they have concealed, each one inside him, his secret thoughts, be wholly exposed.

content: 8 God shall shoot them with arrows; they shall be struck down suddenly.
content_old: 8 God shall shoot them with arrows; they shall be struck down suddenly.

content: 9 Their tongue shall be their downfall; all who see them shall recoil in horror;
content_old: 9 Their tongue shall be their downfall; all who see them shall recoil in horror;

content: 10 all men shall stand in awe; they shall proclaim the work of God and His deed which they perceived.
content_old: 10 all men shall stand in awe; they shall proclaim the work of God and His deed which they perceived.

content: 1 For the leader. A psalm of David. A song.
content_old: 1 For the leader. A psalm of David. A song.

content: 2 Praise befits You in Zion, O God; vows are paid to You;
content_old: 2 Praise befits You in Zion, O God; vows are paid to You;

content: 3 all mankind comes to You, You who hear prayer.
content_old: 3 all mankind comes to You, You who hear prayer.

content: 4 When all manner of sins overwhelm me, it is You who forgive our iniquities.
content_old: 4 When all manner of sins overwhelm me, it is You who forgive our iniquities.

content: 5 Happy is the man You choose and bring near to dwell in Your courts; may we be sated with the blessings of Your house, Your holy temple.
content_old: 5 Happy is the man You choose and bring near to dwell in Your courts; may we be sated with the blessings of Your house, Your holy temple.

content: 6 Answer us with victory through awesome deeds, O God, our deliverer, in whom all the ends of the earth and the distant seas put their trust;
content_old: 6 Answer us with victory through awesome deeds, O God, our deliverer, in whom all the ends of the earth and the distant seas put their trust;

content: 7 who by His power fixed the mountains firmly, who is girded with might,
content_old: 7 who by His power fixed the mountains firmly, who is girded with might,

content: 8 who stills the raging seas, the raging waves, and tumultuous peoples.
content_old: 8 who stills the raging seas, the raging waves, and tumultuous peoples.

content: 9 Those who live at the ends of the earth are awed by Your signs; You make the lands of sunrise and sunset shout for joy.
content_old: 9 Those who live at the ends of the earth are awed by Your signs; You make the lands of sunrise and sunset shout for joy.

content: 10 You take care of the earth and irrigate it; You enrich it greatly, with the channel of God full of water; You provide grain for men; for so do You prepare it.
content_old: 10 You take care of the earth and irrigate it; You enrich it greatly, with the channel of God full of water; You provide grain for men; for so do You prepare it.

content: 11 Saturating its furrows, leveling its ridges, You soften it with showers, You bless its growth.
content_old: 11 Saturating its furrows, leveling its ridges, You soften it with showers, You bless its growth.

content: 12 You crown the year with Your bounty; fatness is distilled in Your paths;
content_old: 12 You crown the year with Your bounty; fatness is distilled in Your paths;

content: 13 the pasturelands distill it; the hills are girded with joy.
content_old: 13 the pasturelands distill it; the hills are girded with joy.

content: 1 For the leader. A song. A psalm.
content_old: 1 For the leader. A song. A psalm.

content: 2 Raise a shout for God, all the earth; sing the glory of His name, make glorious His praise.
content_old: 2 Raise a shout for God, all the earth; sing the glory of His name, make glorious His praise.

content: 3 Say to God, “How awesome are Your deeds, Your enemies cower before Your great strength;
content_old: 3 Say to God, “How awesome are Your deeds, Your enemies cower before Your great strength;

content: 4 all the earth bows to You, and sings hymns to You; all sing hymns to Your name.” Selah.
content_old: 4 all the earth bows to You, and sings hymns to You; all sing hymns to Your name.” Selah.

content: 5 Come and see the works of God, who is held in awe by men for His acts.
content_old: 5 Come and see the works of God, who is held in awe by men for His acts.

content: 6 He turned the sea into dry land; they crossed the river on foot; we therefore rejoice in Him.
content_old: 6 He turned the sea into dry land; they crossed the river on foot; we therefore rejoice in Him.

content: 7 He rules forever in His might; His eyes scan the nations; let the rebellious not assert themselves. Selah.
content_old: 7 He rules forever in His might; His eyes scan the nations; let the rebellious not assert themselves. Selah.

content: 8 O peoples, bless our God, celebrate His praises;
content_old: 8 O peoples, bless our God, celebrate His praises;

content: 9 who has granted us life, and has not let our feet slip.
content_old: 9 who has granted us life, and has not let our feet slip.

content: 10 You have tried us, O God, refining us, as one refines silver.
content_old: 10 You have tried us, O God, refining us, as one refines silver.

content: 11 You have caught us in a net, caught us in trammels.
content_old: 11 You have caught us in a net, caught us in trammels.

content: 12 You have let men ride over us; we have endured fire and water, and You have brought us through to prosperity.
content_old: 12 You have let men ride over us; we have endured fire and water, and You have brought us through to prosperity.

content: 13 I enter Your house with burnt offerings, I pay my vows to You,
content_old: 13 I enter Your house with burnt offerings, I pay my vows to You,

content: 14 that my lips pronounced, that my mouth uttered in my distress.
content_old: 14 that my lips pronounced, that my mouth uttered in my distress.

content: 15 I offer up fatlings to You, with the odor of burning rams; I sacrifice bulls and he-goats. Selah.
content_old: 15 I offer up fatlings to You, with the odor of burning rams; I sacrifice bulls and he-goats. Selah.

content: 16 Come and hear, all God-fearing men, as I tell what He did for me.
content_old: 16 Come and hear, all God-fearing men, as I tell what He did for me.

content: 17 I called aloud to Him, glorification on my tongue.
content_old: 17 I called aloud to Him, glorification on my tongue.

content: 18 Had I an evil thought in my mind, the LORD would not have listened.
content_old: 18 Had I an evil thought in my mind, the LORD would not have listened.

content: 19 But God did listen; He paid heed to my prayer.
content_old: 19 But God did listen; He paid heed to my prayer.

content: 1 For the leader; with instrumental music. A psalm. A song.
content_old: 1 For the leader; with instrumental music. A psalm. A song.

content: 2 May God be gracious to us and bless us; may He show us favor, Selah.
content_old: 2 May God be gracious to us and bless us; may He show us favor, Selah.

content: 3 that Your way be known on earth, Your deliverance among all nations.
content_old: 3 that Your way be known on earth, Your deliverance among all nations.

content: 4 Peoples will praise You, O God; all peoples will praise You.
content_old: 4 Peoples will praise You, O God; all peoples will praise You.

content: 5 Nations will exult and shout for joy, for You rule the peoples with equity, You guide the nations of the earth. Selah.
content_old: 5 Nations will exult and shout for joy, for You rule the peoples with equity, You guide the nations of the earth. Selah.

content: 6 The peoples will praise You, O God; all peoples will praise You.
content_old: 6 The peoples will praise You, O God; all peoples will praise You.

content: 7 May the earth yield its produce; may God, our God, bless us.
content_old: 7 May the earth yield its produce; may God, our God, bless us.

content: 1 For the leader. Of David. A psalm. A song.
content_old: 1 For the leader. Of David. A psalm. A song.

content: 2 God will arise, His enemies shall be scattered, His foes shall flee before Him.
content_old: 2 God will arise, His enemies shall be scattered, His foes shall flee before Him.

content: 3 Disperse them as smoke is dispersed; as wax melts at fire, so the wicked shall perish before God.
content_old: 3 Disperse them as smoke is dispersed; as wax melts at fire, so the wicked shall perish before God.

content: 4 But the righteous shall rejoice; they shall exult in the presence of God; they shall be exceedingly joyful.
content_old: 4 But the righteous shall rejoice; they shall exult in the presence of God; they shall be exceedingly joyful.

content: 5 Sing to God, chant hymns to His name; extol Him who rides the clouds; the LORD is His name. Exult in His presence—
content_old: 5 Sing to God, chant hymns to His name; extol Him who rides the clouds; the LORD is His name. Exult in His presence—

content: 6 the father of orphans, the champion of widows, God, in His holy habitation.
content_old: 6 the father of orphans, the champion of widows, God, in His holy habitation.

content: 7 God restores the lonely to their homes, sets free the imprisoned, safe and sound, while the rebellious must live in a parched land.
content_old: 7 God restores the lonely to their homes, sets free the imprisoned, safe and sound, while the rebellious must live in a parched land.

content: 8 O God, when You went at the head of Your army, when You marched through the desert, Selah.
content_old: 8 O God, when You went at the head of Your army, when You marched through the desert, Selah.

content: 9 the earth trembled, the sky rained because of God, yon Sinai, because of God, the God of Israel.
content_old: 9 the earth trembled, the sky rained because of God, yon Sinai, because of God, the God of Israel.

content: 10 You released a bountiful rain, O God; when Your own land languished, You sustained it.
content_old: 10 You released a bountiful rain, O God; when Your own land languished, You sustained it.

content: 11 Your tribe dwells there; O God, in Your goodness You provide for the needy.
content_old: 11 Your tribe dwells there; O God, in Your goodness You provide for the needy.

content: 12 The LORD gives a command; the women who bring the news are a great host:
content_old: 12 The LORD gives a command; the women who bring the news are a great host:

content: 13 “The kings and their armies are in headlong flight; housewives are sharing in the spoils;
content_old: 13 “The kings and their armies are in headlong flight; housewives are sharing in the spoils;

content: 14 even for those of you who lie among the sheepfolds there are wings of a dove sheathed in silver, its pinions in fine gold.”
content_old: 14 even for those of you who lie among the sheepfolds there are wings of a dove sheathed in silver, its pinions in fine gold.”

content: 15 When Shaddai scattered the kings, it seemed like a snowstorm in Zalmon.
content_old: 15 When Shaddai scattered the kings, it seemed like a snowstorm in Zalmon.

content: 16 O majestic mountain, Mount Bashan; O jagged mountain, Mount Bashan;
content_old: 16 O majestic mountain, Mount Bashan; O jagged mountain, Mount Bashan;

content: 17 why so hostile, O jagged mountains, toward the mountain God desired as His dwelling? The LORD shall abide there forever.
content_old: 17 why so hostile, O jagged mountains, toward the mountain God desired as His dwelling? The LORD shall abide there forever.

content: 18 God’s chariots are myriads upon myriads, thousands upon thousands; the Lord is among them as in Sinai in holiness.
content_old: 18 God’s chariots are myriads upon myriads, thousands upon thousands; the Lord is among them as in Sinai in holiness.

content: 19 You went up to the heights, having taken captives, having received tribute of men, even of those who rebel against the LORD God’s abiding there.
content_old: 19 You went up to the heights, having taken captives, having received tribute of men, even of those who rebel against the LORD God’s abiding there.

content: 20 Blessed is the LORD. Day by day He supports us, God, our deliverance. Selah.
content_old: 20 Blessed is the LORD. Day by day He supports us, God, our deliverance. Selah.

content: 21 God is for us a God of deliverance; GOD the Lord provides an escape from death.
content_old: 21 God is for us a God of deliverance; GOD the Lord provides an escape from death.

content: 22 God will smash the heads of His enemies, the hairy crown of him who walks about in his guilt.
content_old: 22 God will smash the heads of His enemies, the hairy crown of him who walks about in his guilt.

content: 23 The LORD said, “I will retrieve from Bashan, I will retrieve from the depths of the sea;
content_old: 23 The LORD said, “I will retrieve from Bashan, I will retrieve from the depths of the sea;

content: 24 that your feet may wade through blood; that the tongue of your dogs may have its portion of your enemies.”
content_old: 24 that your feet may wade through blood; that the tongue of your dogs may have its portion of your enemies.”

content: 25 Men see Your processions, O God, the processions of my God, my king, into the sanctuary.
content_old: 25 Men see Your processions, O God, the processions of my God, my king, into the sanctuary.

content: 26 First come singers, then musicians, amidst maidens playing timbrels.
content_old: 26 First come singers, then musicians, amidst maidens playing timbrels.

content: 27 In assemblies bless God, the LORD, O you who are from the fountain of Israel.
content_old: 27 In assemblies bless God, the LORD, O you who are from the fountain of Israel.

content: 28 There is little Benjamin who rules them, the princes of Judah who command them, the princes of Zebulun and Naphtali.
content_old: 28 There is little Benjamin who rules them, the princes of Judah who command them, the princes of Zebulun and Naphtali.

content: 29 Your God has ordained strength for you, the strength, O God, which You displayed for us
content_old: 29 Your God has ordained strength for you, the strength, O God, which You displayed for us

content: 30 from Your temple above Jerusalem. The kings bring You tribute.
content_old: 30 from Your temple above Jerusalem. The kings bring You tribute.

content: 31 Blast the beast of the marsh, the herd of bulls among the peoples, the calves, till they come cringing with pieces of silver. Scatter the peoples who delight in wars!
content_old: 31 Blast the beast of the marsh, the herd of bulls among the peoples, the calves, till they come cringing with pieces of silver. Scatter the peoples who delight in wars!

content: 32 Tribute-bearers shall come from Egypt; Cush shall hasten its gifts to God.
content_old: 32 Tribute-bearers shall come from Egypt; Cush shall hasten its gifts to God.

content: 33 O kingdoms of the earth, sing to God; chant hymns to the Lord, Selah.
content_old: 33 O kingdoms of the earth, sing to God; chant hymns to the Lord, Selah.

content: 34 to Him who rides the ancient highest heavens, who thunders forth with His mighty voice.
content_old: 34 to Him who rides the ancient highest heavens, who thunders forth with His mighty voice.

content: 35 Ascribe might to God, whose majesty is over Israel, whose might is in the skies.
content_old: 35 Ascribe might to God, whose majesty is over Israel, whose might is in the skies.

content: 1 For the leader. On shoshannim. Of David.
content_old: 1 For the leader. On shoshannim. Of David.

content: 2 Deliver me, O God, for the waters have reached my neck;
content_old: 2 Deliver me, O God, for the waters have reached my neck;

content: 3 I am sinking into the slimy deep and find no foothold; I have come into the watery depths; the flood sweeps me away.
content_old: 3 I am sinking into the slimy deep and find no foothold; I have come into the watery depths; the flood sweeps me away.

content: 4 I am weary with calling; my throat is dry; my eyes fail while I wait for God.
content_old: 4 I am weary with calling; my throat is dry; my eyes fail while I wait for God.

content: 5 More numerous than the hairs of my head are those who hate me without reason; many are those who would destroy me, my treacherous enemies. Must I restore what I have not stolen?
content_old: 5 More numerous than the hairs of my head are those who hate me without reason; many are those who would destroy me, my treacherous enemies. Must I restore what I have not stolen?

content: 6 God, You know my folly; my guilty deeds are not hidden from You.
content_old: 6 God, You know my folly; my guilty deeds are not hidden from You.

content: 7 Let those who look to You, O LORD, God of hosts, not be disappointed on my account; let those who seek You, O God of Israel, not be shamed because of me.
content_old: 7 Let those who look to You, O LORD, God of hosts, not be disappointed on my account; let those who seek You, O God of Israel, not be shamed because of me.

content: 8 It is for Your sake that I have been reviled, that shame covers my face;
content_old: 8 It is for Your sake that I have been reviled, that shame covers my face;

content: 9 I am a stranger to my brothers, an alien to my kin.
content_old: 9 I am a stranger to my brothers, an alien to my kin.

content: 10 My zeal for Your house has been my undoing; the reproaches of those who revile You have fallen upon me.
content_old: 10 My zeal for Your house has been my undoing; the reproaches of those who revile You have fallen upon me.

content: 11 When I wept and fasted, I was reviled for it.
content_old: 11 When I wept and fasted, I was reviled for it.

content: 12 I made sackcloth my garment; I became a byword among them.
content_old: 12 I made sackcloth my garment; I became a byword among them.

content: 13 Those who sit in the gate talk about me; I am the taunt of drunkards.
content_old: 13 Those who sit in the gate talk about me; I am the taunt of drunkards.

content: 14 As for me, may my prayer come to You, O LORD, at a favorable moment; O God, in Your abundant faithfulness, answer me with Your sure deliverance.
content_old: 14 As for me, may my prayer come to You, O LORD, at a favorable moment; O God, in Your abundant faithfulness, answer me with Your sure deliverance.

content: 15 Rescue me from the mire; let me not sink; let me be rescued from my enemies, and from the watery depths.
content_old: 15 Rescue me from the mire; let me not sink; let me be rescued from my enemies, and from the watery depths.

content: 16 Let the floodwaters not sweep me away; let the deep not swallow me; let the mouth of the Pit not close over me.
content_old: 16 Let the floodwaters not sweep me away; let the deep not swallow me; let the mouth of the Pit not close over me.

content: 17 Answer me, O LORD, according to Your great steadfastness; in accordance with Your abundant mercy turn to me;
content_old: 17 Answer me, O LORD, according to Your great steadfastness; in accordance with Your abundant mercy turn to me;

content: 18 do not hide Your face from Your servant, for I am in distress; answer me quickly.
content_old: 18 do not hide Your face from Your servant, for I am in distress; answer me quickly.

content: 19 Come near to me and redeem me; free me from my enemies.
content_old: 19 Come near to me and redeem me; free me from my enemies.

content: 20 You know my reproach, my shame, my disgrace; You are aware of all my foes.
content_old: 20 You know my reproach, my shame, my disgrace; You are aware of all my foes.

content: 21 Reproach breaks my heart, I am in despair; I hope for consolation, but there is none, for comforters, but find none.
content_old: 21 Reproach breaks my heart, I am in despair; I hope for consolation, but there is none, for comforters, but find none.

content: 22 They give me gall for food, vinegar to quench my thirst.
content_old: 22 They give me gall for food, vinegar to quench my thirst.

content: 23 May their table be a trap for them, a snare for their allies.
content_old: 23 May their table be a trap for them, a snare for their allies.

content: 24 May their eyes grow dim so that they cannot see; may their loins collapse continually.
content_old: 24 May their eyes grow dim so that they cannot see; may their loins collapse continually.

content: 25 Pour out Your wrath on them; may Your blazing anger overtake them;
content_old: 25 Pour out Your wrath on them; may Your blazing anger overtake them;

content: 26 may their encampments be desolate; may their tents stand empty.
content_old: 26 may their encampments be desolate; may their tents stand empty.

content: 27 For they persecute those You have struck; they talk about the pain of those You have felled.
content_old: 27 For they persecute those You have struck; they talk about the pain of those You have felled.

content: 28 Add that to their guilt; let them have no share of Your beneficence;
content_old: 28 Add that to their guilt; let them have no share of Your beneficence;

content: 29 may they be erased from the book of life, and not be inscribed with the righteous.
content_old: 29 may they be erased from the book of life, and not be inscribed with the righteous.

content: 30 But I am lowly and in pain; Your help, O God, keeps me safe.
content_old: 30 But I am lowly and in pain; Your help, O God, keeps me safe.

content: 31 I will extol God’s name with song, and exalt Him with praise.
content_old: 31 I will extol God’s name with song, and exalt Him with praise.

content: 32 That will please the LORD more than oxen, than bulls with horns and hooves.
content_old: 32 That will please the LORD more than oxen, than bulls with horns and hooves.

content: 33 The lowly will see and rejoice; you who are mindful of God, take heart!
content_old: 33 The lowly will see and rejoice; you who are mindful of God, take heart!

content: 34 For the LORD listens to the needy, and does not spurn His captives.
content_old: 34 For the LORD listens to the needy, and does not spurn His captives.

content: 35 Heaven and earth shall extol Him, the seas, and all that moves in them.
content_old: 35 Heaven and earth shall extol Him, the seas, and all that moves in them.

content: 36 For God will deliver Zion and rebuild the cities of Judah; they shall live there and inherit it;
content_old: 36 For God will deliver Zion and rebuild the cities of Judah; they shall live there and inherit it;

content: 1 For the leader. Of David. Lehazkir.
content_old: 1 For the leader. Of David. Lehazkir.

content: 2 Hasten, O God, to save me; O LORD, to aid me!
content_old: 2 Hasten, O God, to save me; O LORD, to aid me!

content: 3 Let those who seek my life be frustrated and disgraced; let those who wish me harm, fall back in shame.
content_old: 3 Let those who seek my life be frustrated and disgraced; let those who wish me harm, fall back in shame.

content: 4 Let those who say, “Aha! Aha!” turn back because of their frustration.
content_old: 4 Let those who say, “Aha! Aha!” turn back because of their frustration.

content: 5 But let all who seek You be glad and rejoice in You; let those who are eager for Your deliverance always say, “Extolled be God!”
content_old: 5 But let all who seek You be glad and rejoice in You; let those who are eager for Your deliverance always say, “Extolled be God!”

content: 1 I seek refuge in You, O LORD; may I never be disappointed.
content_old: 1 I seek refuge in You, O LORD; may I never be disappointed.

content: 2 As You are beneficent, save me and rescue me; incline Your ear to me and deliver me.
content_old: 2 As You are beneficent, save me and rescue me; incline Your ear to me and deliver me.

content: 3 Be a sheltering rock for me to which I may always repair; decree my deliverance, for You are my rock and my fortress.
content_old: 3 Be a sheltering rock for me to which I may always repair; decree my deliverance, for You are my rock and my fortress.

content: 4 My God, rescue me from the hand of the wicked, from the grasp of the unjust and the lawless.
content_old: 4 My God, rescue me from the hand of the wicked, from the grasp of the unjust and the lawless.

content: 5 For You are my hope, O Lord GOD, my trust from my youth.
content_old: 5 For You are my hope, O Lord GOD, my trust from my youth.

content: 6 While yet unborn, I depended on You; in the womb of my mother, You were my support; I sing Your praises always.
content_old: 6 While yet unborn, I depended on You; in the womb of my mother, You were my support; I sing Your praises always.

content: 7 I have become an example for many, since You are my mighty refuge.
content_old: 7 I have become an example for many, since You are my mighty refuge.

content: 8 My mouth is full of praise to You, glorifying You all day long.
content_old: 8 My mouth is full of praise to You, glorifying You all day long.

content: 9 Do not cast me off in old age; when my strength fails, do not forsake me!
content_old: 9 Do not cast me off in old age; when my strength fails, do not forsake me!

content: 10 For my enemies talk against me; those who wait for me are of one mind,
content_old: 10 For my enemies talk against me; those who wait for me are of one mind,

content: 11 saying, “God has forsaken him; chase him and catch him, for no one will save him!”
content_old: 11 saying, “God has forsaken him; chase him and catch him, for no one will save him!”

content: 12 O God, be not far from me; my God, hasten to my aid!
content_old: 12 O God, be not far from me; my God, hasten to my aid!

content: 13 Let my accusers perish in frustration; let those who seek my ruin be clothed in reproach and disgrace!
content_old: 13 Let my accusers perish in frustration; let those who seek my ruin be clothed in reproach and disgrace!

content: 14 As for me, I will hope always, and add to the many praises of You.
content_old: 14 As for me, I will hope always, and add to the many praises of You.

content: 15 My mouth tells of Your beneficence, of Your deliverance all day long, though I know not how to tell it.
content_old: 15 My mouth tells of Your beneficence, of Your deliverance all day long, though I know not how to tell it.

content: 16 I come with praise of Your mighty acts, O Lord GOD; I celebrate Your beneficence, Yours alone.
content_old: 16 I come with praise of Your mighty acts, O Lord GOD; I celebrate Your beneficence, Yours alone.

content: 17 You have let me experience it, God, from my youth; until now I have proclaimed Your wondrous deeds,
content_old: 17 You have let me experience it, God, from my youth; until now I have proclaimed Your wondrous deeds,

content: 18 and even in hoary old age do not forsake me, God, until I proclaim Your strength to the next generation,
content_old: 18 and even in hoary old age do not forsake me, God, until I proclaim Your strength to the next generation,

content: 19 Your mighty acts, to all who are to come, Your beneficence, high as the heavens, O God, You who have done great things; O God, who is Your peer!
content_old: 19 Your mighty acts, to all who are to come, Your beneficence, high as the heavens, O God, You who have done great things; O God, who is Your peer!

content: 20 You who have made me undergo many troubles and misfortunes will revive me again, and raise me up from the depths of the earth.
content_old: 20 You who have made me undergo many troubles and misfortunes will revive me again, and raise me up from the depths of the earth.

content: 21 You will grant me much greatness, You will turn and comfort me.
content_old: 21 You will grant me much greatness, You will turn and comfort me.

content: 22 Then I will acclaim You to the music of the lyre for Your faithfulness, O my God; I will sing a hymn to You with a harp, O Holy One of Israel.
content_old: 22 Then I will acclaim You to the music of the lyre for Your faithfulness, O my God; I will sing a hymn to You with a harp, O Holy One of Israel.

content: 23 My lips shall be jubilant, as I sing a hymn to You, my whole being, which You have redeemed.
content_old: 23 My lips shall be jubilant, as I sing a hymn to You, my whole being, which You have redeemed.

content: 1 Of Solomon. O God, endow the king with Your judgments, the king’s son with Your righteousness;
content_old: 1 Of Solomon. O God, endow the king with Your judgments, the king’s son with Your righteousness;

content: 2 that he may judge Your people rightly, Your lowly ones, justly.
content_old: 2 that he may judge Your people rightly, Your lowly ones, justly.

content: 3 Let the mountains produce well-being for the people, the hills, the reward of justice.
content_old: 3 Let the mountains produce well-being for the people, the hills, the reward of justice.

content: 4 Let him champion the lowly among the people, deliver the needy folk, and crush those who wrong them.
content_old: 4 Let him champion the lowly among the people, deliver the needy folk, and crush those who wrong them.

content: 5 Let them fear You as long as the sun shines, while the moon lasts, generations on end.
content_old: 5 Let them fear You as long as the sun shines, while the moon lasts, generations on end.

content: 6 Let him be like rain that falls on a mown field, like a downpour of rain on the ground,
content_old: 6 Let him be like rain that falls on a mown field, like a downpour of rain on the ground,

content: 7 that the righteous may flourish in his time, and well-being abound, till the moon is no more.
content_old: 7 that the righteous may flourish in his time, and well-being abound, till the moon is no more.

content: 8 Let him rule from sea to sea, from the river to the ends of the earth.
content_old: 8 Let him rule from sea to sea, from the river to the ends of the earth.

content: 9 Let desert-dwellers kneel before him, and his enemies lick the dust.
content_old: 9 Let desert-dwellers kneel before him, and his enemies lick the dust.

content: 10 Let kings of Tarshish and the islands pay tribute, kings of Sheba and Seba offer gifts.
content_old: 10 Let kings of Tarshish and the islands pay tribute, kings of Sheba and Seba offer gifts.

content: 11 Let all kings bow to him, and all nations serve him.
content_old: 11 Let all kings bow to him, and all nations serve him.

content: 12 For he saves the needy who cry out, the lowly who have no helper.
content_old: 12 For he saves the needy who cry out, the lowly who have no helper.

content: 13 He cares about the poor and the needy; He brings the needy deliverance.
content_old: 13 He cares about the poor and the needy; He brings the needy deliverance.

content: 14 He redeems them from fraud and lawlessness; the shedding of their blood weighs heavily upon him.
content_old: 14 He redeems them from fraud and lawlessness; the shedding of their blood weighs heavily upon him.

content: 15 So let him live, and receive gold of Sheba; let prayers for him be said always, blessings on him invoked at all times.
content_old: 15 So let him live, and receive gold of Sheba; let prayers for him be said always, blessings on him invoked at all times.

content: 16 Let abundant grain be in the land, to the tops of the mountains; let his crops thrive like the forest of Lebanon; and let men sprout up in towns like country grass.
content_old: 16 Let abundant grain be in the land, to the tops of the mountains; let his crops thrive like the forest of Lebanon; and let men sprout up in towns like country grass.

content: 17 May his name be eternal; while the sun lasts, may his name endure; let men invoke his blessedness upon themselves; let all nations count him happy.
content_old: 17 May his name be eternal; while the sun lasts, may his name endure; let men invoke his blessedness upon themselves; let all nations count him happy.

content: 18 Blessed is the LORD God, God of Israel, who alone does wondrous things;
content_old: 18 Blessed is the LORD God, God of Israel, who alone does wondrous things;

content: 19 Blessed is His glorious name forever; His glory fills the whole world. Amen and Amen.
content_old: 19 Blessed is His glorious name forever; His glory fills the whole world. Amen and Amen.

content: 1 A psalm of Asaph. God is truly good to Israel, to those whose heart is pure.
content_old: 1 A psalm of Asaph. God is truly good to Israel, to those whose heart is pure.

content: 2 As for me, my feet had almost strayed, my steps were nearly led off course,
content_old: 2 As for me, my feet had almost strayed, my steps were nearly led off course,

content: 3 for I envied the wanton; I saw the wicked at ease.
content_old: 3 for I envied the wanton; I saw the wicked at ease.

content: 4 Death has no pangs for them; their body is healthy.
content_old: 4 Death has no pangs for them; their body is healthy.

content: 5 They have no part in the travail of men; they are not afflicted like the rest of mankind.
content_old: 5 They have no part in the travail of men; they are not afflicted like the rest of mankind.

content: 6 So pride adorns their necks, lawlessness enwraps them as a mantle.
content_old: 6 So pride adorns their necks, lawlessness enwraps them as a mantle.

content: 7 Fat shuts out their eyes; their fancies are extravagant.
content_old: 7 Fat shuts out their eyes; their fancies are extravagant.

content: 8 They scoff and plan evil; from their eminence they plan wrongdoing.
content_old: 8 They scoff and plan evil; from their eminence they plan wrongdoing.

content: 9 They set their mouths against heaven, and their tongues range over the earth.
content_old: 9 They set their mouths against heaven, and their tongues range over the earth.

content: 10 So they pound His people again and again, until they are drained of their very last tear.
content_old: 10 So they pound His people again and again, until they are drained of their very last tear.

content: 11 Then they say, “How could God know? Is there knowledge with the Most High?”
content_old: 11 Then they say, “How could God know? Is there knowledge with the Most High?”

content: 12 Such are the wicked; ever tranquil, they amass wealth.
content_old: 12 Such are the wicked; ever tranquil, they amass wealth.

content: 13 It was for nothing that I kept my heart pure and washed my hands in innocence,
content_old: 13 It was for nothing that I kept my heart pure and washed my hands in innocence,

content: 14 seeing that I have been constantly afflicted, that each morning brings new punishments.
content_old: 14 seeing that I have been constantly afflicted, that each morning brings new punishments.

content: 15 Had I decided to say these things, I should have been false to the circle of Your disciples.
content_old: 15 Had I decided to say these things, I should have been false to the circle of Your disciples.

content: 16 So I applied myself to understand this, but it seemed a hopeless task
content_old: 16 So I applied myself to understand this, but it seemed a hopeless task

content: 17 till I entered God’s sanctuary and reflected on their fate.
content_old: 17 till I entered God’s sanctuary and reflected on their fate.

content: 18 You surround them with flattery; You make them fall through blandishments.
content_old: 18 You surround them with flattery; You make them fall through blandishments.

content: 19 How suddenly are they ruined, wholly swept away by terrors.
content_old: 19 How suddenly are they ruined, wholly swept away by terrors.

content: 20 When You are aroused You despise their image, as one does a dream after waking, O LORD.
content_old: 20 When You are aroused You despise their image, as one does a dream after waking, O LORD.

content: 21 My mind was stripped of its reason, my feelings were numbed.
content_old: 21 My mind was stripped of its reason, my feelings were numbed.

content: 22 I was a dolt, without knowledge; I was brutish toward You.
content_old: 22 I was a dolt, without knowledge; I was brutish toward You.

content: 23 Yet I was always with You, You held my right hand;
content_old: 23 Yet I was always with You, You held my right hand;

content: 24 You guided me by Your counsel and led me toward honor.
content_old: 24 You guided me by Your counsel and led me toward honor.

content: 25 Whom else have I in heaven? And having You, I want no one on earth.
content_old: 25 Whom else have I in heaven? And having You, I want no one on earth.

content: 26 My body and mind fail; but God is the stay of my mind, my portion forever.
content_old: 26 My body and mind fail; but God is the stay of my mind, my portion forever.

content: 27 Those who keep far from You perish; You annihilate all who are untrue to You.
content_old: 27 Those who keep far from You perish; You annihilate all who are untrue to You.

content: 1 A maskil of Asaph. Why, O God, do You forever reject us, do You fume in anger at the flock that You tend?
content_old: 1 A maskil of Asaph. Why, O God, do You forever reject us, do You fume in anger at the flock that You tend?

content: 2 Remember the community You made Yours long ago, Your very own tribe that You redeemed, Mount Zion, where You dwell.
content_old: 2 Remember the community You made Yours long ago, Your very own tribe that You redeemed, Mount Zion, where You dwell.

content: 3 Bestir Yourself because of the perpetual tumult, all the outrages of the enemy in the sanctuary.
content_old: 3 Bestir Yourself because of the perpetual tumult, all the outrages of the enemy in the sanctuary.

content: 4 Your foes roar inside Your meeting-place; they take their signs for true signs.
content_old: 4 Your foes roar inside Your meeting-place; they take their signs for true signs.

content: 5 It is like men wielding axes against a gnarled tree;
content_old: 5 It is like men wielding axes against a gnarled tree;

content: 6 with hatchet and pike they hacked away at its carved work.
content_old: 6 with hatchet and pike they hacked away at its carved work.

content: 7 They made Your sanctuary go up in flames; they brought low in dishonor the dwelling-place of Your presence.
content_old: 7 They made Your sanctuary go up in flames; they brought low in dishonor the dwelling-place of Your presence.

content: 8 They resolved, “Let us destroy them altogether!” They burned all God’s tabernacles in the land.
content_old: 8 They resolved, “Let us destroy them altogether!” They burned all God’s tabernacles in the land.

content: 9 No signs appear for us; there is no longer any prophet; no one among us knows for how long.
content_old: 9 No signs appear for us; there is no longer any prophet; no one among us knows for how long.

content: 10 Till when, O God, will the foe blaspheme, will the enemy forever revile Your name?
content_old: 10 Till when, O God, will the foe blaspheme, will the enemy forever revile Your name?

content: 11 Why do You hold back Your hand, Your right hand? Draw it out of Your bosom!
content_old: 11 Why do You hold back Your hand, Your right hand? Draw it out of Your bosom!

content: 12 O God, my king from of old, who brings deliverance throughout the land;
content_old: 12 O God, my king from of old, who brings deliverance throughout the land;

content: 13 it was You who drove back the sea with Your might, who smashed the heads of the monsters in the waters;
content_old: 13 it was You who drove back the sea with Your might, who smashed the heads of the monsters in the waters;

content: 14 it was You who crushed the heads of Leviathan, who left him as food for the denizens of the desert;
content_old: 14 it was You who crushed the heads of Leviathan, who left him as food for the denizens of the desert;

content: 15 it was You who released springs and torrents, who made mighty rivers run dry;
content_old: 15 it was You who released springs and torrents, who made mighty rivers run dry;

content: 16 the day is Yours, the night also; it was You who set in place the orb of the sun;
content_old: 16 the day is Yours, the night also; it was You who set in place the orb of the sun;

content: 17 You fixed all the boundaries of the earth; summer and winter—You made them.
content_old: 17 You fixed all the boundaries of the earth; summer and winter—You made them.

content: 18 Be mindful of how the enemy blasphemes the LORD, how base people revile Your name.
content_old: 18 Be mindful of how the enemy blasphemes the LORD, how base people revile Your name.

content: 19 Do not deliver Your dove to the wild beast; do not ignore forever the band of Your lowly ones.
content_old: 19 Do not deliver Your dove to the wild beast; do not ignore forever the band of Your lowly ones.

content: 20 Look to the covenant! For the dark places of the land are full of the haunts of lawlessness.
content_old: 20 Look to the covenant! For the dark places of the land are full of the haunts of lawlessness.

content: 21 Let not the downtrodden turn away disappointed; let the poor and needy praise Your name.
content_old: 21 Let not the downtrodden turn away disappointed; let the poor and needy praise Your name.

content: 22 Rise, O God, champion Your cause; be mindful that You are blasphemed by base men all day long.
content_old: 22 Rise, O God, champion Your cause; be mindful that You are blasphemed by base men all day long.

content: 1 For the leader; al tashheth. A psalm of Asaph, a song.
content_old: 1 For the leader; al tashheth. A psalm of Asaph, a song.

content: 2 We praise You, O God; we praise You; Your presence is near; men tell of Your wondrous deeds.
content_old: 2 We praise You, O God; we praise You; Your presence is near; men tell of Your wondrous deeds.

content: 3 “At the time I choose, I will give judgment equitably.
content_old: 3 “At the time I choose, I will give judgment equitably.

content: 4 Earth and all its inhabitants dissolve; it is I who keep its pillars firm. Selah.
content_old: 4 Earth and all its inhabitants dissolve; it is I who keep its pillars firm. Selah.

content: 5 To wanton men I say, ‘Do not be wanton!’ to the wicked, ‘Do not lift up your horns!’ ”
content_old: 5 To wanton men I say, ‘Do not be wanton!’ to the wicked, ‘Do not lift up your horns!’ ”

content: 6 Do not lift your horns up high in vainglorious bluster.
content_old: 6 Do not lift your horns up high in vainglorious bluster.

content: 7 For what lifts a man comes not from the east or the west or the wilderness;
content_old: 7 For what lifts a man comes not from the east or the west or the wilderness;

content: 8 for God it is who gives judgment; He brings down one man, He lifts up another.
content_old: 8 for God it is who gives judgment; He brings down one man, He lifts up another.

content: 9 There is a cup in the LORD’s hand with foaming wine fully mixed; from this He pours; all the wicked of the earth drink, draining it to the very dregs.
content_old: 9 There is a cup in the LORD’s hand with foaming wine fully mixed; from this He pours; all the wicked of the earth drink, draining it to the very dregs.

content: 10 As for me, I will declare forever, I will sing a hymn to the God of Jacob.
content_old: 10 As for me, I will declare forever, I will sing a hymn to the God of Jacob.

content: 1 For the leader; with instrumental music. A psalm of Asaph, a song.
content_old: 1 For the leader; with instrumental music. A psalm of Asaph, a song.

content: 2 God has made Himself known in Judah, His name is great in Israel;
content_old: 2 God has made Himself known in Judah, His name is great in Israel;

content: 3 Salem became His abode; Zion, His den.
content_old: 3 Salem became His abode; Zion, His den.

content: 4 There He broke the fiery arrows of the bow, the shield and the sword of war. Selah.
content_old: 4 There He broke the fiery arrows of the bow, the shield and the sword of war. Selah.

content: 5 You were resplendent, glorious, on the mountains of prey.
content_old: 5 You were resplendent, glorious, on the mountains of prey.

content: 6 The stout-hearted were despoiled; they were in a stupor; the bravest of men could not lift a hand.
content_old: 6 The stout-hearted were despoiled; they were in a stupor; the bravest of men could not lift a hand.

content: 7 At Your blast, O God of Jacob, horse and chariot lay stunned.
content_old: 7 At Your blast, O God of Jacob, horse and chariot lay stunned.

content: 8 O You! You are awesome! Who can withstand You when You are enraged?
content_old: 8 O You! You are awesome! Who can withstand You when You are enraged?

content: 9 In heaven You pronounced sentence; the earth was numbed with fright
content_old: 9 In heaven You pronounced sentence; the earth was numbed with fright

content: 10 as God rose to execute judgment, to deliver all the lowly of the earth. Selah.
content_old: 10 as God rose to execute judgment, to deliver all the lowly of the earth. Selah.

content: 11 The fiercest of men shall acknowledge You, when You gird on the last bit of fury.
content_old: 11 The fiercest of men shall acknowledge You, when You gird on the last bit of fury.

content: 12 Make vows and pay them to the LORD your God; all who are around Him shall bring tribute to the Awesome One.
content_old: 12 Make vows and pay them to the LORD your God; all who are around Him shall bring tribute to the Awesome One.

content: 1 For the leader; on Jeduthun. Of Asaph. A psalm.
content_old: 1 For the leader; on Jeduthun. Of Asaph. A psalm.

content: 2 I cry aloud to God; I cry to God that He may give ear to me.
content_old: 2 I cry aloud to God; I cry to God that He may give ear to me.

content: 3 In my time of distress I turn to the Lord, with my handuplifted; flow all night without respite; I will not be comforted.
content_old: 3 In my time of distress I turn to the Lord, with my handuplifted; flow all night without respite; I will not be comforted.

content: 4 I call God to mind, I moan, I complain, my spirit fails. Selah.
content_old: 4 I call God to mind, I moan, I complain, my spirit fails. Selah.

content: 5 You have held my eyelids open; I am overwrought, I cannot speak.
content_old: 5 You have held my eyelids open; I am overwrought, I cannot speak.

content: 6 My thoughts turn to days of old, to years long past.
content_old: 6 My thoughts turn to days of old, to years long past.

content: 7 I recall at night their jibes at me; I commune with myself; my spirit inquires,
content_old: 7 I recall at night their jibes at me; I commune with myself; my spirit inquires,

content: 8 “Will the Lord reject forever and never again show favor?
content_old: 8 “Will the Lord reject forever and never again show favor?

content: 9 Has His faithfulness disappeared forever? Will His promise be unfulfilled for all time?
content_old: 9 Has His faithfulness disappeared forever? Will His promise be unfulfilled for all time?

content: 10 Has God forgotten how to pity? Has He in anger stifled His compassion?” Selah.
content_old: 10 Has God forgotten how to pity? Has He in anger stifled His compassion?” Selah.

content: 11 And I said, “It is my fault that the right hand of the Most High has changed.”
content_old: 11 And I said, “It is my fault that the right hand of the Most High has changed.”

content: 12 I recall the deeds of the LORD; yes, I recall Your wonders of old;
content_old: 12 I recall the deeds of the LORD; yes, I recall Your wonders of old;

content: 13 I recount all Your works; I speak of Your acts.
content_old: 13 I recount all Your works; I speak of Your acts.

content: 14 O God, Your ways are holiness; what god is as great as God?
content_old: 14 O God, Your ways are holiness; what god is as great as God?

content: 15 You are the God who works wonders; You have manifested Your strength among the peoples.
content_old: 15 You are the God who works wonders; You have manifested Your strength among the peoples.

content: 16 By Your arm You redeemed Your people, the children of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.
content_old: 16 By Your arm You redeemed Your people, the children of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.

content: 17 The waters saw You, O God, the waters saw You and were convulsed; the very deep quaked as well.
content_old: 17 The waters saw You, O God, the waters saw You and were convulsed; the very deep quaked as well.

content: 18 Clouds streamed water; the heavens rumbled; Your arrows flew about;
content_old: 18 Clouds streamed water; the heavens rumbled; Your arrows flew about;

content: 19 Your thunder rumbled like wheels; lightning lit up the world; the earth quaked and trembled.
content_old: 19 Your thunder rumbled like wheels; lightning lit up the world; the earth quaked and trembled.

content: 20 Your way was through the sea, Your path, through the mighty waters; Your tracks could not be seen.
content_old: 20 Your way was through the sea, Your path, through the mighty waters; Your tracks could not be seen.

content: 1 A maskil of Asaph. Give ear, my people, to my teaching, turn your ear to what I say.
content_old: 1 A maskil of Asaph. Give ear, my people, to my teaching, turn your ear to what I say.

content: 2 I will expound a theme, hold forth on the lessons of the past,
content_old: 2 I will expound a theme, hold forth on the lessons of the past,

content: 3 things we have heard and known, that our fathers have told us.
content_old: 3 things we have heard and known, that our fathers have told us.

content: 4 We will not withhold them from their children, telling the coming generation the praises of the LORD and His might, and the wonders He performed.
content_old: 4 We will not withhold them from their children, telling the coming generation the praises of the LORD and His might, and the wonders He performed.

content: 5 He established a decree in Jacob, ordained a teaching in Israel, charging our fathers to make them known to their children,
content_old: 5 He established a decree in Jacob, ordained a teaching in Israel, charging our fathers to make them known to their children,

content: 6 that a future generation might know —children yet to be born— and in turn tell their children
content_old: 6 that a future generation might know —children yet to be born— and in turn tell their children

content: 7 that they might put their confidence in God, and not forget God’s great deeds, but observe His commandments,
content_old: 7 that they might put their confidence in God, and not forget God’s great deeds, but observe His commandments,

content: 8 and not be like their fathers, a wayward and defiant generation, a generation whose heart was inconstant, whose spirit was not true to God.
content_old: 8 and not be like their fathers, a wayward and defiant generation, a generation whose heart was inconstant, whose spirit was not true to God.

content: 9 Like the Ephraimite bowmen who played false in the day of battle,
content_old: 9 Like the Ephraimite bowmen who played false in the day of battle,

content: 10 they did not keep God’s covenant, they refused to follow His instruction;
content_old: 10 they did not keep God’s covenant, they refused to follow His instruction;

content: 11 they forgot His deeds and the wonders that He showed them.
content_old: 11 they forgot His deeds and the wonders that He showed them.

content: 12 He performed marvels in the sight of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, the plain of Zoan.
content_old: 12 He performed marvels in the sight of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, the plain of Zoan.

content: 13 He split the sea and took them through it; He made the waters stand like a wall.
content_old: 13 He split the sea and took them through it; He made the waters stand like a wall.

content: 14 He led them with a cloud by day, and throughout the night by the light of fire.
content_old: 14 He led them with a cloud by day, and throughout the night by the light of fire.

content: 15 He split rocks in the wilderness and gave them drink as if from the great deep.
content_old: 15 He split rocks in the wilderness and gave them drink as if from the great deep.

content: 16 He brought forth streams from a rock and made them flow down like a river.
content_old: 16 He brought forth streams from a rock and made them flow down like a river.

content: 17 But they went on sinning against Him, defying the Most High in the parched land.
content_old: 17 But they went on sinning against Him, defying the Most High in the parched land.

content: 18 To test God was in their mind when they demanded food for themselves.
content_old: 18 To test God was in their mind when they demanded food for themselves.

content: 19 They spoke against God, saying, “Can God spread a feast in the wilderness?
content_old: 19 They spoke against God, saying, “Can God spread a feast in the wilderness?

content: 20 True, He struck the rock and waters flowed, streams gushed forth; but can He provide bread? Can He supply His people with meat?”
content_old: 20 True, He struck the rock and waters flowed, streams gushed forth; but can He provide bread? Can He supply His people with meat?”

content: 21 The LORD heard and He raged; fire broke out against Jacob, anger flared up at Israel,
content_old: 21 The LORD heard and He raged; fire broke out against Jacob, anger flared up at Israel,

content: 22 because they did not put their trust in God, did not rely on His deliverance.
content_old: 22 because they did not put their trust in God, did not rely on His deliverance.

content: 23 So He commanded the skies above, He opened the doors of heaven
content_old: 23 So He commanded the skies above, He opened the doors of heaven

content: 24 and rained manna upon them for food, giving them heavenly grain.
content_old: 24 and rained manna upon them for food, giving them heavenly grain.

content: 25 Each man ate a hero’s meal; He sent them provision in plenty.
content_old: 25 Each man ate a hero’s meal; He sent them provision in plenty.

content: 26 He set the east wind moving in heaven, and drove the south wind by His might.
content_old: 26 He set the east wind moving in heaven, and drove the south wind by His might.

content: 27 He rained meat on them like dust, winged birds like the sands of the sea,
content_old: 27 He rained meat on them like dust, winged birds like the sands of the sea,

content: 28 making them come down inside His camp, around His dwelling-place.
content_old: 28 making them come down inside His camp, around His dwelling-place.

content: 29 They ate till they were sated; He gave them what they craved.
content_old: 29 They ate till they were sated; He gave them what they craved.

content: 30 They had not yet wearied of what they craved, the food was still in their mouths
content_old: 30 They had not yet wearied of what they craved, the food was still in their mouths

content: 31 when God’s anger flared up at them. He slew their sturdiest, struck down the youth of Israel.
content_old: 31 when God’s anger flared up at them. He slew their sturdiest, struck down the youth of Israel.

content: 32 Nonetheless, they went on sinning and had no faith in His wonders.
content_old: 32 Nonetheless, they went on sinning and had no faith in His wonders.

content: 33 He made their days end in futility, their years in sudden death.
content_old: 33 He made their days end in futility, their years in sudden death.

content: 34 When He struck them, they turned to Him and sought God once again.
content_old: 34 When He struck them, they turned to Him and sought God once again.

content: 35 They remembered that God was their rock, God Most High, their Redeemer.
content_old: 35 They remembered that God was their rock, God Most High, their Redeemer.

content: 36 Yet they deceived Him with their speech, lied to Him with their words;
content_old: 36 Yet they deceived Him with their speech, lied to Him with their words;

content: 37 their hearts were inconstant toward Him; they were untrue to His covenant.
content_old: 37 their hearts were inconstant toward Him; they were untrue to His covenant.

content: 38 But He, being merciful, forgave iniquity and would not destroy; He restrained His wrath time and again and did not give full vent to His fury;
content_old: 38 But He, being merciful, forgave iniquity and would not destroy; He restrained His wrath time and again and did not give full vent to His fury;

content: 39 for He remembered that they were but flesh, a passing breath that does not return.
content_old: 39 for He remembered that they were but flesh, a passing breath that does not return.

content: 40 How often did they defy Him in the wilderness, did they grieve Him in the wasteland!
content_old: 40 How often did they defy Him in the wilderness, did they grieve Him in the wasteland!

content: 41 Again and again they tested God, vexed the Holy One of Israel.
content_old: 41 Again and again they tested God, vexed the Holy One of Israel.

content: 42 They did not remember His strength, or the day He redeemed them from the foe;
content_old: 42 They did not remember His strength, or the day He redeemed them from the foe;

content: 43 how He displayed His signs in Egypt, His wonders in the plain of Zoan.
content_old: 43 how He displayed His signs in Egypt, His wonders in the plain of Zoan.

content: 44 He turned their rivers into blood; He made their waters undrinkable.
content_old: 44 He turned their rivers into blood; He made their waters undrinkable.

content: 45 He inflicted upon them swarms of insects to devour them, frogs to destroy them.
content_old: 45 He inflicted upon them swarms of insects to devour them, frogs to destroy them.

content: 46 He gave their crops over to grubs, their produce to locusts.
content_old: 46 He gave their crops over to grubs, their produce to locusts.

content: 47 He killed their vines with hail, their sycamores with frost.
content_old: 47 He killed their vines with hail, their sycamores with frost.

content: 48 He gave their beasts over to hail, their cattle to lightning bolts.
content_old: 48 He gave their beasts over to hail, their cattle to lightning bolts.

content: 49 He inflicted His burning anger upon them, wrath, indignation, trouble, a band of deadly messengers.
content_old: 49 He inflicted His burning anger upon them, wrath, indignation, trouble, a band of deadly messengers.

content: 50 He cleared a path for His anger; He did not stop short of slaying them, but gave them over to pestilence.
content_old: 50 He cleared a path for His anger; He did not stop short of slaying them, but gave them over to pestilence.

content: 51 He struck every first-born in Egypt, the first fruits of their vigor in the tents of Ham.
content_old: 51 He struck every first-born in Egypt, the first fruits of their vigor in the tents of Ham.

content: 52 He set His people moving like sheep, drove them like a flock in the wilderness.
content_old: 52 He set His people moving like sheep, drove them like a flock in the wilderness.

content: 53 He led them in safety; they were unafraid; as for their enemies, the sea covered them.
content_old: 53 He led them in safety; they were unafraid; as for their enemies, the sea covered them.

content: 54 He brought them to His holy realm, the mountain His right hand had acquired.
content_old: 54 He brought them to His holy realm, the mountain His right hand had acquired.

content: 55 He expelled nations before them, settled the tribes of Israel in their tents, allotting them their portion by the line.
content_old: 55 He expelled nations before them, settled the tribes of Israel in their tents, allotting them their portion by the line.

content: 56 Yet they defiantly tested God Most High, and did not observe His decrees.
content_old: 56 Yet they defiantly tested God Most High, and did not observe His decrees.

content: 57 They fell away, disloyal like their fathers; they played false like a treacherous bow.
content_old: 57 They fell away, disloyal like their fathers; they played false like a treacherous bow.

content: 58 They vexed Him with their high places; they incensed Him with their idols.
content_old: 58 They vexed Him with their high places; they incensed Him with their idols.

content: 59 God heard it and was enraged; He utterly rejected Israel.
content_old: 59 God heard it and was enraged; He utterly rejected Israel.

content: 60 He forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent He had set among men.
content_old: 60 He forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent He had set among men.

content: 61 He let His might go into captivity, His glory into the hands of the foe.
content_old: 61 He let His might go into captivity, His glory into the hands of the foe.

content: 62 He gave His people over to the sword; He was enraged at His very own.
content_old: 62 He gave His people over to the sword; He was enraged at His very own.

content: 63 Fire consumed their young men, and their maidens remained unwed.
content_old: 63 Fire consumed their young men, and their maidens remained unwed.

content: 64 Their priests fell by the sword, and their widows could not weep.
content_old: 64 Their priests fell by the sword, and their widows could not weep.

content: 65 The Lord awoke as from sleep, like a warrior shaking off wine.
content_old: 65 The Lord awoke as from sleep, like a warrior shaking off wine.

content: 66 He beat back His foes, dealing them lasting disgrace.
content_old: 66 He beat back His foes, dealing them lasting disgrace.

content: 67 He rejected the clan of Joseph; He did not choose the tribe of Ephraim.
content_old: 67 He rejected the clan of Joseph; He did not choose the tribe of Ephraim.

content: 68 He did choose the tribe of Judah, Mount Zion, which He loved.
content_old: 68 He did choose the tribe of Judah, Mount Zion, which He loved.

content: 69 He built His Sanctuary like the heavens, like the earth that He established forever.
content_old: 69 He built His Sanctuary like the heavens, like the earth that He established forever.

content: 70 He chose David, His servant, and took him from the sheepfolds.
content_old: 70 He chose David, His servant, and took him from the sheepfolds.

content: 71 He brought him from minding the nursing ewes to tend His people Jacob, Israel, His very own.
content_old: 71 He brought him from minding the nursing ewes to tend His people Jacob, Israel, His very own.

content: 1 A psalm of Asaph. O God, heathens have entered Your domain, defiled Your holy temple, and turned Jerusalem into ruins.
content_old: 1 A psalm of Asaph. O God, heathens have entered Your domain, defiled Your holy temple, and turned Jerusalem into ruins.

content: 2 They have left Your servants’ corpses as food for the fowl of heaven, and the flesh of Your faithful for the wild beasts.
content_old: 2 They have left Your servants’ corpses as food for the fowl of heaven, and the flesh of Your faithful for the wild beasts.

content: 3 Their blood was shed like water around Jerusalem, with none to bury them.
content_old: 3 Their blood was shed like water around Jerusalem, with none to bury them.

content: 4 We have become the butt of our neighbors, the scorn and derision of those around us.
content_old: 4 We have become the butt of our neighbors, the scorn and derision of those around us.

content: 5 How long, O LORD, will You be angry forever, will Your indignation blaze like fire?
content_old: 5 How long, O LORD, will You be angry forever, will Your indignation blaze like fire?

content: 6 Pour out Your fury on the nations that do not know You, upon the kingdoms that do not invoke Your name,
content_old: 6 Pour out Your fury on the nations that do not know You, upon the kingdoms that do not invoke Your name,

content: 7 for they have devoured Jacob and desolated his home.
content_old: 7 for they have devoured Jacob and desolated his home.

content: 8 Do not hold our former iniquities against us; let Your compassion come swiftly toward us, for we have sunk very low.
content_old: 8 Do not hold our former iniquities against us; let Your compassion come swiftly toward us, for we have sunk very low.

content: 9 Help us, O God, our deliverer, for the sake of the glory of Your name. Save us and forgive our sin, for the sake of Your name.
content_old: 9 Help us, O God, our deliverer, for the sake of the glory of Your name. Save us and forgive our sin, for the sake of Your name.

content: 10 Let the nations not say, “Where is their God?” Before our eyes let it be known among the nations that You avenge the spilled blood of Your servants.
content_old: 10 Let the nations not say, “Where is their God?” Before our eyes let it be known among the nations that You avenge the spilled blood of Your servants.
