content: 11 Let the groans of the prisoners reach You; reprieve those condemned to death, as befits Your great strength.
content_old: 11 Let the groans of the prisoners reach You; reprieve those condemned to death, as befits Your great strength.

content: 12 Pay back our neighbors sevenfold for the abuse they have flung at You, O LORD.
content_old: 12 Pay back our neighbors sevenfold for the abuse they have flung at You, O LORD.

content: 1 For the leader; on shoshannim, eduth. Of Asaph. A psalm.
content_old: 1 For the leader; on shoshannim, eduth. Of Asaph. A psalm.

content: 2 Give ear, O shepherd of Israel who leads Joseph like a flock! Appear, You who are enthroned on the cherubim,
content_old: 2 Give ear, O shepherd of Israel who leads Joseph like a flock! Appear, You who are enthroned on the cherubim,

content: 3 at the head of Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh! Rouse Your might and come to our help!
content_old: 3 at the head of Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh! Rouse Your might and come to our help!

content: 4 Restore us, O God; show Your favor that we may be delivered.
content_old: 4 Restore us, O God; show Your favor that we may be delivered.

content: 5 O LORD, God of hosts, how long will You be wrathful toward the prayers of Your people?
content_old: 5 O LORD, God of hosts, how long will You be wrathful toward the prayers of Your people?

content: 6 You have fed them tears as their daily bread, made them drink great measures of tears.
content_old: 6 You have fed them tears as their daily bread, made them drink great measures of tears.

content: 7 You set us at strife with our neighbors; our enemies mock us at will.
content_old: 7 You set us at strife with our neighbors; our enemies mock us at will.

content: 8 O God of hosts, restore us; show Your favor that we may be delivered.
content_old: 8 O God of hosts, restore us; show Your favor that we may be delivered.

content: 9 You plucked up a vine from Egypt; You expelled nations and planted it.
content_old: 9 You plucked up a vine from Egypt; You expelled nations and planted it.

content: 10 You cleared a place for it; it took deep root and filled the land.
content_old: 10 You cleared a place for it; it took deep root and filled the land.

content: 11 The mountains were covered by its shade, mighty cedars by its boughs.
content_old: 11 The mountains were covered by its shade, mighty cedars by its boughs.

content: 12 Its branches reached the sea, its shoots, the river.
content_old: 12 Its branches reached the sea, its shoots, the river.

content: 13 Why did You breach its wall so that every passerby plucks its fruit,
content_old: 13 Why did You breach its wall so that every passerby plucks its fruit,

content: 14 wild boars gnaw at it, and creatures of the field feed on it?
content_old: 14 wild boars gnaw at it, and creatures of the field feed on it?

content: 15 O God of hosts, turn again, look down from heaven and see; take note of that vine,
content_old: 15 O God of hosts, turn again, look down from heaven and see; take note of that vine,

content: 16 the stock planted by Your right hand, the stem you have taken as Your own.
content_old: 16 the stock planted by Your right hand, the stem you have taken as Your own.

content: 17 For it is burned by fire and cut down, perishing before Your angry blast.
content_old: 17 For it is burned by fire and cut down, perishing before Your angry blast.

content: 18 Grant Your help to the man at Your right hand, the one You have taken as Your own.
content_old: 18 Grant Your help to the man at Your right hand, the one You have taken as Your own.

content: 19 We will not turn away from You; preserve our life that we may invoke Your name.
content_old: 19 We will not turn away from You; preserve our life that we may invoke Your name.

content: 1 For the leader; on the gittith. Of Asaph.
content_old: 1 For the leader; on the gittith. Of Asaph.

content: 2 Sing joyously to God, our strength; raise a shout for the God of Jacob.
content_old: 2 Sing joyously to God, our strength; raise a shout for the God of Jacob.

content: 3 Take up the song, sound the timbrel, the melodious lyre and harp.
content_old: 3 Take up the song, sound the timbrel, the melodious lyre and harp.

content: 4 Blow the horn on the new moon, on the full moon for our feast day.
content_old: 4 Blow the horn on the new moon, on the full moon for our feast day.

content: 5 For it is a law for Israel, a ruling of the God of Jacob;
content_old: 5 For it is a law for Israel, a ruling of the God of Jacob;

content: 6 He imposed it as a decree upon Joseph when he went forth from the land of Egypt; I heard a language that I knew not.
content_old: 6 He imposed it as a decree upon Joseph when he went forth from the land of Egypt; I heard a language that I knew not.

content: 7 I relieved his shoulder of the burden, his hands were freed from the basket.
content_old: 7 I relieved his shoulder of the burden, his hands were freed from the basket.

content: 8 In distress you called and I rescued you; I answered you from the secret place of thunder I tested you at the waters of Meribah. Selah.
content_old: 8 In distress you called and I rescued you; I answered you from the secret place of thunder I tested you at the waters of Meribah. Selah.

content: 9 Hear, My people, and I will admonish you; Israel, if you would but listen to Me!
content_old: 9 Hear, My people, and I will admonish you; Israel, if you would but listen to Me!

content: 10 You shall have no foreign god, you shall not bow to an alien god.
content_old: 10 You shall have no foreign god, you shall not bow to an alien god.

content: 11 I the LORD am your God who brought you out of the land of Egypt; open your mouth wide and I will fill it.
content_old: 11 I the LORD am your God who brought you out of the land of Egypt; open your mouth wide and I will fill it.

content: 12 But My people would not listen to Me, Israel would not obey Me.
content_old: 12 But My people would not listen to Me, Israel would not obey Me.

content: 13 So I let them go after their willful heart that they might follow their own devices.
content_old: 13 So I let them go after their willful heart that they might follow their own devices.

content: 14 If only My people would listen to Me, if Israel would follow My paths,
content_old: 14 If only My people would listen to Me, if Israel would follow My paths,

content: 15 then would I subdue their enemies at once, strike their foes again and again.
content_old: 15 then would I subdue their enemies at once, strike their foes again and again.

content: 16 Those who hate the LORD shall cower before Him; their doom shall be eternal.
content_old: 16 Those who hate the LORD shall cower before Him; their doom shall be eternal.

content: 1 A psalm of Asaph. God stands in the divine assembly; among the divine beings He pronounces judgment.
content_old: 1 A psalm of Asaph. God stands in the divine assembly; among the divine beings He pronounces judgment.

content: 2 How long will you judge perversely, showing favor to the wicked? Selah.
content_old: 2 How long will you judge perversely, showing favor to the wicked? Selah.

content: 3 Judge the wretched and the orphan, vindicate the lowly and the poor,
content_old: 3 Judge the wretched and the orphan, vindicate the lowly and the poor,

content: 4 rescue the wretched and the needy; save them from the hand of the wicked.
content_old: 4 rescue the wretched and the needy; save them from the hand of the wicked.

content: 5 They neither know nor understand, they go about in darkness; all the foundations of the earth totter.
content_old: 5 They neither know nor understand, they go about in darkness; all the foundations of the earth totter.

content: 6 I had taken you for divine beings, sons of the Most High, all of you;
content_old: 6 I had taken you for divine beings, sons of the Most High, all of you;

content: 7 but you shall die as men do, fall like any prince.
content_old: 7 but you shall die as men do, fall like any prince.

content: 1 A song, a psalm of Asaph.
content_old: 1 A song, a psalm of Asaph.

content: 2 O God, do not be silent; do not hold aloof; do not be quiet, O God!
content_old: 2 O God, do not be silent; do not hold aloof; do not be quiet, O God!

content: 3 For Your enemies rage, Your foes assert themselves.
content_old: 3 For Your enemies rage, Your foes assert themselves.

content: 4 They plot craftily against Your people, take counsel against Your treasured ones.
content_old: 4 They plot craftily against Your people, take counsel against Your treasured ones.

content: 5 They say, “Let us wipe them out as a nation; Israel’s name will be mentioned no more.”
content_old: 5 They say, “Let us wipe them out as a nation; Israel’s name will be mentioned no more.”

content: 6 Unanimous in their counsel they have made an alliance against You—
content_old: 6 Unanimous in their counsel they have made an alliance against You—

content: 7 the clans of Edom and the Ishmaelites, Moab and the Hagrites,
content_old: 7 the clans of Edom and the Ishmaelites, Moab and the Hagrites,

content: 8 Gebal, Ammon, and Amalek, Philistia with the inhabitants of Tyre;
content_old: 8 Gebal, Ammon, and Amalek, Philistia with the inhabitants of Tyre;

content: 9 Assyria too joins forces with them; they give support to the sons of Lot. Selah.
content_old: 9 Assyria too joins forces with them; they give support to the sons of Lot. Selah.

content: 10 Deal with them as You did with Midian, with Sisera, with Jabin, at the brook Kishon—
content_old: 10 Deal with them as You did with Midian, with Sisera, with Jabin, at the brook Kishon—

content: 11 who were destroyed at En-dor, who became dung for the field.
content_old: 11 who were destroyed at En-dor, who became dung for the field.

content: 12 Treat their great men like Oreb and Zeeb, all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna,
content_old: 12 Treat their great men like Oreb and Zeeb, all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna,

content: 13 who said, “Let us take the meadows of God as our possession.”
content_old: 13 who said, “Let us take the meadows of God as our possession.”

content: 14 O my God, make them like thistledown, like stubble driven by the wind.
content_old: 14 O my God, make them like thistledown, like stubble driven by the wind.

content: 15 As a fire burns a forest, as flames scorch the hills,
content_old: 15 As a fire burns a forest, as flames scorch the hills,

content: 16 pursue them with Your tempest, terrify them with Your storm.
content_old: 16 pursue them with Your tempest, terrify them with Your storm.

content: 17 Cover their faces with shame so that they seek Your name, O LORD.
content_old: 17 Cover their faces with shame so that they seek Your name, O LORD.

content: 18 May they be frustrated and terrified, disgraced and doomed forever.
content_old: 18 May they be frustrated and terrified, disgraced and doomed forever.

content: 1 For the leader; on the gittith. Of the Korahites. A psalm.
content_old: 1 For the leader; on the gittith. Of the Korahites. A psalm.

content: 2 How lovely is Your dwelling-place, O LORD of hosts.
content_old: 2 How lovely is Your dwelling-place, O LORD of hosts.

content: 3 I long, I yearn for the courts of the LORD; my body and soul shout for joy to the living God.
content_old: 3 I long, I yearn for the courts of the LORD; my body and soul shout for joy to the living God.

content: 4 Even the sparrow has found a home, and the swallow a nest for herself in which to set her young, near Your altar, O LORD of hosts, my king and my God.
content_old: 4 Even the sparrow has found a home, and the swallow a nest for herself in which to set her young, near Your altar, O LORD of hosts, my king and my God.

content: 5 Happy are those who dwell in Your house; they forever praise You. Selah.
content_old: 5 Happy are those who dwell in Your house; they forever praise You. Selah.

content: 6 Happy is the man who finds refuge in You, whose mind is on thepilgrim highways.
content_old: 6 Happy is the man who finds refuge in You, whose mind is on thepilgrim highways.

content: 7 They pass through the Valley of Baca, regarding it as a place of springs, as if the early rain had covered it with blessing.
content_old: 7 They pass through the Valley of Baca, regarding it as a place of springs, as if the early rain had covered it with blessing.

content: 8 They go from rampart to rampart, appearing before God in Zion.
content_old: 8 They go from rampart to rampart, appearing before God in Zion.

content: 9 O LORD, God of hosts, hear my prayer; give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah.
content_old: 9 O LORD, God of hosts, hear my prayer; give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah.

content: 10 O God, behold our shield, look upon the face of Your anointed.
content_old: 10 O God, behold our shield, look upon the face of Your anointed.

content: 11 Better one day in Your courts than a thousand anywhere else; I would rather stand at the threshold of God’s house than dwell in the tents of the wicked.
content_old: 11 Better one day in Your courts than a thousand anywhere else; I would rather stand at the threshold of God’s house than dwell in the tents of the wicked.

content: 12 For the LORD God is sun and shield; the LORD bestows grace and glory; He does not withhold His bounty from those who live without blame.
content_old: 12 For the LORD God is sun and shield; the LORD bestows grace and glory; He does not withhold His bounty from those who live without blame.

content: 1 For the leader. Of the Korahites. A psalm.
content_old: 1 For the leader. Of the Korahites. A psalm.

content: 2 O LORD, You will favor Your land, restore Jacob’s fortune;
content_old: 2 O LORD, You will favor Your land, restore Jacob’s fortune;

content: 3 You will forgive Your people’s iniquity, pardon all their sins; Selah.
content_old: 3 You will forgive Your people’s iniquity, pardon all their sins; Selah.

content: 4 You will withdraw all Your anger, turn away from Your rage.
content_old: 4 You will withdraw all Your anger, turn away from Your rage.

content: 5 Turn again, O God, our helper, revoke Your displeasure with us.
content_old: 5 Turn again, O God, our helper, revoke Your displeasure with us.

content: 6 Will You be angry with us forever, prolong Your wrath for all generations?
content_old: 6 Will You be angry with us forever, prolong Your wrath for all generations?

content: 7 Surely You will revive us again, so that Your people may rejoice in You.
content_old: 7 Surely You will revive us again, so that Your people may rejoice in You.

content: 8 Show us, O LORD, Your faithfulness; grant us Your deliverance.
content_old: 8 Show us, O LORD, Your faithfulness; grant us Your deliverance.

content: 9 Let me hear what God, the LORD, will speak; He will promise well-being to His people, His faithful ones; may they not turn to folly.
content_old: 9 Let me hear what God, the LORD, will speak; He will promise well-being to His people, His faithful ones; may they not turn to folly.

content: 10 His help is very near those who fear Him, to make His glory dwell in our land.
content_old: 10 His help is very near those who fear Him, to make His glory dwell in our land.

content: 11 Faithfulness and truth meet; justice and well-being kiss.
content_old: 11 Faithfulness and truth meet; justice and well-being kiss.

content: 12 Truth springs up from the earth; justice looks down from heaven.
content_old: 12 Truth springs up from the earth; justice looks down from heaven.

content: 13 The LORD also bestows His bounty; our land yields its produce.
content_old: 13 The LORD also bestows His bounty; our land yields its produce.

content: 1 A prayer of David. Incline Your ear, O LORD, answer me, for I am poor and needy.
content_old: 1 A prayer of David. Incline Your ear, O LORD, answer me, for I am poor and needy.

content: 2 Preserve my life, for I am steadfast; O You, my God, deliver Your servant who trusts in You.
content_old: 2 Preserve my life, for I am steadfast; O You, my God, deliver Your servant who trusts in You.

content: 3 Have mercy on me, O LORD, for I call to You all day long;
content_old: 3 Have mercy on me, O LORD, for I call to You all day long;

content: 4 bring joy to Your servant’s life, for on You, LORD, I set my hope.
content_old: 4 bring joy to Your servant’s life, for on You, LORD, I set my hope.

content: 5 For You, LORD, are good and forgiving, abounding in steadfast love to all who call on You.
content_old: 5 For You, LORD, are good and forgiving, abounding in steadfast love to all who call on You.

content: 6 Give ear, O LORD, to my prayer; heed my plea for mercy.
content_old: 6 Give ear, O LORD, to my prayer; heed my plea for mercy.

content: 7 In my time of trouble I call You, for You will answer me.
content_old: 7 In my time of trouble I call You, for You will answer me.

content: 8 There is none like You among the gods, O LORD, and there are no deeds like Yours.
content_old: 8 There is none like You among the gods, O LORD, and there are no deeds like Yours.

content: 9 All the nations You have made will come to bow down before You, O LORD, and they will pay honor to Your name.
content_old: 9 All the nations You have made will come to bow down before You, O LORD, and they will pay honor to Your name.

content: 10 For You are great and perform wonders; You alone are God.
content_old: 10 For You are great and perform wonders; You alone are God.

content: 11 Teach me Your way, O LORD; I will walk in Your truth; let my heart be undivided in reverence for Your name.
content_old: 11 Teach me Your way, O LORD; I will walk in Your truth; let my heart be undivided in reverence for Your name.

content: 12 I will praise You, O LORD, my God, with all my heart and pay honor to Your name forever.
content_old: 12 I will praise You, O LORD, my God, with all my heart and pay honor to Your name forever.

content: 13 For Your steadfast love toward me is great; You have saved me from the depths of Sheol.
content_old: 13 For Your steadfast love toward me is great; You have saved me from the depths of Sheol.

content: 14 O God, arrogant men have risen against me; a band of ruthless men seek my life; they are not mindful of You.
content_old: 14 O God, arrogant men have risen against me; a band of ruthless men seek my life; they are not mindful of You.

content: 15 But You, O LORD, are a God compassionate and merciful, slow to anger, abounding in steadfast love and faithfulness.
content_old: 15 But You, O LORD, are a God compassionate and merciful, slow to anger, abounding in steadfast love and faithfulness.

content: 16 Turn to me and have mercy on me; grant Your strength to Your servant and deliver the son of Your maidservant.
content_old: 16 Turn to me and have mercy on me; grant Your strength to Your servant and deliver the son of Your maidservant.

content: 1 Of the Korahites. A psalm. A song. The LORD loves the gates of Zion, His foundation on the holy mountains, more than all the dwellings of Jacob.
content_old: 1 Of the Korahites. A psalm. A song. The LORD loves the gates of Zion, His foundation on the holy mountains, more than all the dwellings of Jacob.

content: 3 Glorious things are spoken of you, O city of God. Selah.
content_old: 3 Glorious things are spoken of you, O city of God. Selah.

content: 4 I mention Rahab and Babylon among those who acknowledge Me; Philistia, and Tyre, and Cush—each was born there.
content_old: 4 I mention Rahab and Babylon among those who acknowledge Me; Philistia, and Tyre, and Cush—each was born there.

content: 5 Indeed, it shall be said of Zion, “Every man was born there.” He, the Most High, will preserve it.
content_old: 5 Indeed, it shall be said of Zion, “Every man was born there.” He, the Most High, will preserve it.

content: 6 The LORD will inscribe in the register of peoples that each was born there. Selah.
content_old: 6 The LORD will inscribe in the register of peoples that each was born there. Selah.

content: 1 A song. A psalm of the Korahites. For the leader; on mahalath leannoth. A maskil of Heman the Ezrahite.
content_old: 1 A song. A psalm of the Korahites. For the leader; on mahalath leannoth. A maskil of Heman the Ezrahite.

content: 2 O LORD, God of my deliverance, when I cry out in the night before You,
content_old: 2 O LORD, God of my deliverance, when I cry out in the night before You,

content: 3 let my prayer reach You; incline Your ear to my cry.
content_old: 3 let my prayer reach You; incline Your ear to my cry.

content: 4 For I am sated with misfortune; I am at the brink of Sheol.
content_old: 4 For I am sated with misfortune; I am at the brink of Sheol.

content: 5 I am numbered with those who go down to the Pit; I am a helpless man
content_old: 5 I am numbered with those who go down to the Pit; I am a helpless man

content: 6 abandoned among the dead, like bodies lying in the grave of whom You are mindful no more, and who are cut off from Your care.
content_old: 6 abandoned among the dead, like bodies lying in the grave of whom You are mindful no more, and who are cut off from Your care.

content: 7 You have put me at the bottom of the Pit, in the darkest places, in the depths.
content_old: 7 You have put me at the bottom of the Pit, in the darkest places, in the depths.

content: 8 Your fury lies heavy upon me; You afflict me with all Your breakers. Selah.
content_old: 8 Your fury lies heavy upon me; You afflict me with all Your breakers. Selah.

content: 9 You make my companions shun me; You make me abhorrent to them; I am shut in and do not go out.
content_old: 9 You make my companions shun me; You make me abhorrent to them; I am shut in and do not go out.

content: 10 My eyes pine away from affliction; I call to You, O LORD, each day; I stretch out my hands to You.
content_old: 10 My eyes pine away from affliction; I call to You, O LORD, each day; I stretch out my hands to You.

content: 11 Do You work wonders for the dead? Do the shades rise to praise You? Selah.
content_old: 11 Do You work wonders for the dead? Do the shades rise to praise You? Selah.

content: 12 Is Your faithful care recounted in the grave, Your constancy in the place of perdition?
content_old: 12 Is Your faithful care recounted in the grave, Your constancy in the place of perdition?

content: 13 Are Your wonders made known in the netherworld, Your beneficent deeds in the land of oblivion?
content_old: 13 Are Your wonders made known in the netherworld, Your beneficent deeds in the land of oblivion?

content: 14 As for me, I cry out to You, O LORD; each morning my prayer greets You.
content_old: 14 As for me, I cry out to You, O LORD; each morning my prayer greets You.

content: 15 Why, O LORD, do You reject me, do You hide Your face from me?
content_old: 15 Why, O LORD, do You reject me, do You hide Your face from me?

content: 16 From my youth I have been afflicted and near death; I suffer Your terrors wherever I turn.
content_old: 16 From my youth I have been afflicted and near death; I suffer Your terrors wherever I turn.

content: 17 Your fury overwhelms me; Your terrors destroy me.
content_old: 17 Your fury overwhelms me; Your terrors destroy me.

content: 18 They swirl about me like water all day long; they encircle me on every side.
content_old: 18 They swirl about me like water all day long; they encircle me on every side.

content: 1 A maskil of Ethan the Ezrahite.
content_old: 1 A maskil of Ethan the Ezrahite.

content: 2 I will sing of the LORD’s steadfast love forever; to all generations I will proclaim Your faithfulness with my mouth.
content_old: 2 I will sing of the LORD’s steadfast love forever; to all generations I will proclaim Your faithfulness with my mouth.

content: 3 I declare, “Your steadfast love is confirmed forever; there in the heavens You establish Your faithfulness.”
content_old: 3 I declare, “Your steadfast love is confirmed forever; there in the heavens You establish Your faithfulness.”

content: 4 “I have made a covenant with My chosen one; I have sworn to My servant David:
content_old: 4 “I have made a covenant with My chosen one; I have sworn to My servant David:

content: 5 I will establish your offspring forever, I will confirm your throne for all generations.” Selah.
content_old: 5 I will establish your offspring forever, I will confirm your throne for all generations.” Selah.

content: 6 Your wonders, O LORD, are praised by the heavens, Your faithfulness, too, in the assembly of holy beings.
content_old: 6 Your wonders, O LORD, are praised by the heavens, Your faithfulness, too, in the assembly of holy beings.

content: 7 For who in the skies can equal the LORD, can compare with the LORD among the divine beings,
content_old: 7 For who in the skies can equal the LORD, can compare with the LORD among the divine beings,

content: 8 a God greatly dreaded in the council of holy beings, held in awe by all around Him?
content_old: 8 a God greatly dreaded in the council of holy beings, held in awe by all around Him?

content: 9 O LORD, God of hosts, who is mighty like You, O LORD? Your faithfulness surrounds You;
content_old: 9 O LORD, God of hosts, who is mighty like You, O LORD? Your faithfulness surrounds You;

content: 10 You rule the swelling of the sea; when its waves surge, You still them.
content_old: 10 You rule the swelling of the sea; when its waves surge, You still them.

content: 11 You crushed Rahab; he was like a corpse; with Your powerful arm You scattered Your enemies.
content_old: 11 You crushed Rahab; he was like a corpse; with Your powerful arm You scattered Your enemies.

content: 12 The heaven is Yours, the earth too; the world and all it holds— You established them.
content_old: 12 The heaven is Yours, the earth too; the world and all it holds— You established them.

content: 13 North and south— You created them; Tabor and Hermon sing forth Your name.
content_old: 13 North and south— You created them; Tabor and Hermon sing forth Your name.

content: 14 Yours is an arm endowed with might; Your hand is strong; Your right hand, exalted.
content_old: 14 Yours is an arm endowed with might; Your hand is strong; Your right hand, exalted.

content: 15 Righteousness and justice are the base of Your throne; steadfast love and faithfulness stand before You.
content_old: 15 Righteousness and justice are the base of Your throne; steadfast love and faithfulness stand before You.

content: 16 Happy is the people who know the joyful shout; O LORD, they walk in the light of Your presence.
content_old: 16 Happy is the people who know the joyful shout; O LORD, they walk in the light of Your presence.

content: 17 They rejoice in Your name all day long; they are exalted through Your righteousness.
content_old: 17 They rejoice in Your name all day long; they are exalted through Your righteousness.

content: 18 For You are their strength in which they glory; our horn is exalted through Your favor.
content_old: 18 For You are their strength in which they glory; our horn is exalted through Your favor.

content: 19 Truly our shield is of the LORD, our king, of the Holy One of Israel.
content_old: 19 Truly our shield is of the LORD, our king, of the Holy One of Israel.

content: 20 Then You spoke to Your faithful ones in a vision and said, “I have conferred power upon a warrior; I have exalted one chosen out of the people.
content_old: 20 Then You spoke to Your faithful ones in a vision and said, “I have conferred power upon a warrior; I have exalted one chosen out of the people.

content: 21 I have found David, My servant; anointed him with My sacred oil.
content_old: 21 I have found David, My servant; anointed him with My sacred oil.

content: 22 My hand shall be constantly with him, and My arm shall strengthen him.
content_old: 22 My hand shall be constantly with him, and My arm shall strengthen him.

content: 23 No enemy shall oppress him, no vile man afflict him.
content_old: 23 No enemy shall oppress him, no vile man afflict him.

content: 24 I will crush his adversaries before him; I will strike down those who hate him.
content_old: 24 I will crush his adversaries before him; I will strike down those who hate him.

content: 25 My faithfulness and steadfast love shall be with him; his horn shall be exalted through My name.
content_old: 25 My faithfulness and steadfast love shall be with him; his horn shall be exalted through My name.

content: 26 I will set his hand upon the sea, his right hand upon the rivers.
content_old: 26 I will set his hand upon the sea, his right hand upon the rivers.

content: 27 He shall say to Me, ‘You are my father, my God, the rock of my deliverance.’
content_old: 27 He shall say to Me, ‘You are my father, my God, the rock of my deliverance.’

content: 28 I will appoint him first-born, highest of the kings of the earth.
content_old: 28 I will appoint him first-born, highest of the kings of the earth.

content: 29 I will maintain My steadfast love for him always; My covenant with him shall endure.
content_old: 29 I will maintain My steadfast love for him always; My covenant with him shall endure.

content: 30 I will establish his line forever, his throne, as long as the heavens last.
content_old: 30 I will establish his line forever, his throne, as long as the heavens last.

content: 31 If his sons forsake My Teaching and do not live by My rules;
content_old: 31 If his sons forsake My Teaching and do not live by My rules;

content: 32 if they violate My laws, and do not observe My commands,
content_old: 32 if they violate My laws, and do not observe My commands,

content: 33 I will punish their transgression with the rod, their iniquity with plagues.
content_old: 33 I will punish their transgression with the rod, their iniquity with plagues.

content: 34 But I will not take away My steadfast love from him; I will not betray My faithfulness.
content_old: 34 But I will not take away My steadfast love from him; I will not betray My faithfulness.

content: 35 I will not violate My covenant, or change what I have uttered.
content_old: 35 I will not violate My covenant, or change what I have uttered.

content: 36 I have sworn by My holiness, once and for all; I will not be false to David.
content_old: 36 I have sworn by My holiness, once and for all; I will not be false to David.

content: 37 His line shall continue forever, his throne, as the sun before Me,
content_old: 37 His line shall continue forever, his throne, as the sun before Me,

content: 38 as the moon, established forever, an enduring witness in the sky.” Selah.
content_old: 38 as the moon, established forever, an enduring witness in the sky.” Selah.

content: 39 Yet You have rejected, spurned, and become enraged at Your anointed.
content_old: 39 Yet You have rejected, spurned, and become enraged at Your anointed.

content: 40 You have repudiated the covenant with Your servant; You have dragged his dignity in the dust.
content_old: 40 You have repudiated the covenant with Your servant; You have dragged his dignity in the dust.

content: 41 You have breached all his defenses, shattered his strongholds.
content_old: 41 You have breached all his defenses, shattered his strongholds.

content: 42 All who pass by plunder him; he has become the butt of his neighbors.
content_old: 42 All who pass by plunder him; he has become the butt of his neighbors.

content: 43 You have exalted the right hand of his adversaries, and made all his enemies rejoice.
content_old: 43 You have exalted the right hand of his adversaries, and made all his enemies rejoice.

content: 44 You have turned back the blade of his sword, and have not sustained him in battle.
content_old: 44 You have turned back the blade of his sword, and have not sustained him in battle.

content: 45 You have brought his splendor to an end and have hurled his throne to the ground.
content_old: 45 You have brought his splendor to an end and have hurled his throne to the ground.

content: 46 You have cut short the days of his youth; You have covered him with shame. Selah.
content_old: 46 You have cut short the days of his youth; You have covered him with shame. Selah.

content: 47 How long, O LORD; will You forever hide Your face, will Your fury blaze like fire?
content_old: 47 How long, O LORD; will You forever hide Your face, will Your fury blaze like fire?

content: 48 O remember how short my life is; why should You have created every man in vain?
content_old: 48 O remember how short my life is; why should You have created every man in vain?

content: 49 What man can live and not see death, can save himself from the clutches of Sheol? Selah.
content_old: 49 What man can live and not see death, can save himself from the clutches of Sheol? Selah.

content: 50 O LORD, where is Your steadfast love of old which You swore to David in Your faithfulness?
content_old: 50 O LORD, where is Your steadfast love of old which You swore to David in Your faithfulness?

content: 51 Remember, O LORD, the abuse flung at Your servants that I have borne in my bosomfrom many peoples,
content_old: 51 Remember, O LORD, the abuse flung at Your servants that I have borne in my bosomfrom many peoples,

content: 52 how Your enemies, O LORD, have flung abuse, abuse at Your anointed at every step.
content_old: 52 how Your enemies, O LORD, have flung abuse, abuse at Your anointed at every step.

content: 1 A prayer of Moses, the man of God. O Lord, You have been our refuge in every generation.
content_old: 1 A prayer of Moses, the man of God. O Lord, You have been our refuge in every generation.

content: 2 Before the mountains came into being, before You brought forth the earth and the world, from eternity to eternity You are God.
content_old: 2 Before the mountains came into being, before You brought forth the earth and the world, from eternity to eternity You are God.

content: 3 You return man to dust; You decreed, “Return you mortals!”
content_old: 3 You return man to dust; You decreed, “Return you mortals!”

content: 4 For in Your sight a thousand years are like yesterday that has past, like a watch of the night.
content_old: 4 For in Your sight a thousand years are like yesterday that has past, like a watch of the night.

content: 5 You engulf men in sleep; at daybreak they are like grass that renews itself;
content_old: 5 You engulf men in sleep; at daybreak they are like grass that renews itself;

content: 6 at daybreak it flourishes anew; by dusk it withers and dries up.
content_old: 6 at daybreak it flourishes anew; by dusk it withers and dries up.

content: 7 So we are consumed by Your anger, terror-struck by Your fury.
content_old: 7 So we are consumed by Your anger, terror-struck by Your fury.

content: 8 You have set our iniquities before You, our hidden sins in the light of Your face.
content_old: 8 You have set our iniquities before You, our hidden sins in the light of Your face.

content: 9 All our days pass away in Your wrath; we spend our years like a sigh.
content_old: 9 All our days pass away in Your wrath; we spend our years like a sigh.

content: 10 The span of our life is seventy years, or, given the strength, eighty years; but the best of them are trouble and sorrow. They pass by speedily, and we are in darkness.
content_old: 10 The span of our life is seventy years, or, given the strength, eighty years; but the best of them are trouble and sorrow. They pass by speedily, and we are in darkness.

content: 11 Who can know Your furious anger? Your wrath matches the fear of You.
content_old: 11 Who can know Your furious anger? Your wrath matches the fear of You.

content: 12 Teach us to count our days rightly, that we may obtain a wise heart.
content_old: 12 Teach us to count our days rightly, that we may obtain a wise heart.

content: 13 Turn, O LORD! How long? Show mercy to Your servants.
content_old: 13 Turn, O LORD! How long? Show mercy to Your servants.

content: 14 Satisfy us at daybreak with Your steadfast love that we may sing for joy all our days.
content_old: 14 Satisfy us at daybreak with Your steadfast love that we may sing for joy all our days.

content: 15 Give us joy for as long as You have afflicted us, for the years we have suffered misfortune.
content_old: 15 Give us joy for as long as You have afflicted us, for the years we have suffered misfortune.

content: 16 Let Your deeds be seen by Your servants, Your glory by their children.
content_old: 16 Let Your deeds be seen by Your servants, Your glory by their children.

content: 1 O you who dwell in the shelter of the Most High and abide in the protection of Shaddai—
content_old: 1 O you who dwell in the shelter of the Most High and abide in the protection of Shaddai—

content: 2 I say of the LORD, my refuge and stronghold, my God in whom I trust,
content_old: 2 I say of the LORD, my refuge and stronghold, my God in whom I trust,

content: 3 that He will save you from the fowler’s trap, from the destructive plague.
content_old: 3 that He will save you from the fowler’s trap, from the destructive plague.

content: 4 He will cover you with His pinions; you will find refuge under His wings; His fidelity is an encircling shield.
content_old: 4 He will cover you with His pinions; you will find refuge under His wings; His fidelity is an encircling shield.

content: 5 You need not fear the terror by night, or the arrow that flies by day,
content_old: 5 You need not fear the terror by night, or the arrow that flies by day,

content: 6 the plague that stalks in the darkness, or the scourge that ravages at noon.
content_old: 6 the plague that stalks in the darkness, or the scourge that ravages at noon.

content: 7 A thousand may fall at your left side, ten thousand at your right, but it shall not reach you.
content_old: 7 A thousand may fall at your left side, ten thousand at your right, but it shall not reach you.

content: 8 You will see it with your eyes, you will witness the punishment of the wicked.
content_old: 8 You will see it with your eyes, you will witness the punishment of the wicked.

content: 9 Because you took the LORD—my refuge, the Most High—as your haven,
content_old: 9 Because you took the LORD—my refuge, the Most High—as your haven,

content: 10 no harm will befall you, no disease touch your tent.
content_old: 10 no harm will befall you, no disease touch your tent.

content: 11 For He will order His angels to guard you wherever you go.
content_old: 11 For He will order His angels to guard you wherever you go.

content: 12 They will carry you in their hands lest you hurt your foot on a stone.
content_old: 12 They will carry you in their hands lest you hurt your foot on a stone.

content: 13 You will tread on cubs and vipers; you will trample lions and asps.
content_old: 13 You will tread on cubs and vipers; you will trample lions and asps.

content: 14 “Because he is devoted to Me I will deliver him; I will keep him safe, for he knows My name.
content_old: 14 “Because he is devoted to Me I will deliver him; I will keep him safe, for he knows My name.

content: 15 When he calls on Me, I will answer him; I will be with him in distress; I will rescue him and make him honored;
content_old: 15 When he calls on Me, I will answer him; I will be with him in distress; I will rescue him and make him honored;

content: 1 A psalm. A song; for the sabbath day.
content_old: 1 A psalm. A song; for the sabbath day.

content: 2 It is good to praise the LORD, to sing hymns to Your name, O Most High,
content_old: 2 It is good to praise the LORD, to sing hymns to Your name, O Most High,

content: 3 To proclaim Your steadfast love at daybreak, Your faithfulness each night
content_old: 3 To proclaim Your steadfast love at daybreak, Your faithfulness each night

content: 4 With a ten-stringed harp, with voice and lyre together.
content_old: 4 With a ten-stringed harp, with voice and lyre together.

content: 5 You have gladdened me by Your deeds, O LORD; I shout for joy at Your handiwork.
content_old: 5 You have gladdened me by Your deeds, O LORD; I shout for joy at Your handiwork.

content: 6 How great are Your works, O LORD, how very subtle Your designs!
content_old: 6 How great are Your works, O LORD, how very subtle Your designs!

content: 7 A brutish man cannot know, a fool cannot understand this:
content_old: 7 A brutish man cannot know, a fool cannot understand this:

content: 8 though the wicked sprout like grass, though all evildoers blossom, it is only that they may be destroyed forever.
content_old: 8 though the wicked sprout like grass, though all evildoers blossom, it is only that they may be destroyed forever.

content: 9 But You are exalted, O LORD, for all time.
content_old: 9 But You are exalted, O LORD, for all time.

content: 10 Surely, Your enemies, O LORD, surely, Your enemies perish; all evildoers are scattered.
content_old: 10 Surely, Your enemies, O LORD, surely, Your enemies perish; all evildoers are scattered.

content: 11 You raise my horn high like that of a wild ox; I am soaked in freshening oil.
content_old: 11 You raise my horn high like that of a wild ox; I am soaked in freshening oil.

content: 12 I shall see the defeat of my watchful foes, hear of the downfall of the wicked who beset me.
content_old: 12 I shall see the defeat of my watchful foes, hear of the downfall of the wicked who beset me.

content: 13 The righteous bloom like a date-palm; they thrive like a cedar in Lebanon;
content_old: 13 The righteous bloom like a date-palm; they thrive like a cedar in Lebanon;

content: 14 planted in the house of the LORD, they flourish in the courts of our God.
content_old: 14 planted in the house of the LORD, they flourish in the courts of our God.

content: 15 In old age they still produce fruit; they are full of sap and freshness,
content_old: 15 In old age they still produce fruit; they are full of sap and freshness,

content: 1 The LORD is king, He is robed in grandeur; the LORD is robed, He is girded with strength. The world stands firm; it cannot be shaken.
content_old: 1 The LORD is king, He is robed in grandeur; the LORD is robed, He is girded with strength. The world stands firm; it cannot be shaken.

content: 2 Your throne stands firm from of old; from eternity You have existed.
content_old: 2 Your throne stands firm from of old; from eternity You have existed.

content: 3 The ocean sounds, O LORD, the ocean sounds its thunder, the ocean sounds its pounding.
content_old: 3 The ocean sounds, O LORD, the ocean sounds its thunder, the ocean sounds its pounding.

content: 4 Above the thunder of the mighty waters, more majestic than the breakers of the sea is the LORD, majestic on high.
content_old: 4 Above the thunder of the mighty waters, more majestic than the breakers of the sea is the LORD, majestic on high.

content: 1 God of retribution, LORD, God of retribution, appear!
content_old: 1 God of retribution, LORD, God of retribution, appear!

content: 2 Rise up, judge of the earth, give the arrogant their deserts!
content_old: 2 Rise up, judge of the earth, give the arrogant their deserts!

content: 3 How long shall the wicked, O LORD, how long shall the wicked exult,
content_old: 3 How long shall the wicked, O LORD, how long shall the wicked exult,

content: 4 shall they utter insolent speech, shall all evildoers vaunt themselves?
content_old: 4 shall they utter insolent speech, shall all evildoers vaunt themselves?

content: 5 They crush Your people, O LORD, they afflict Your very own;
content_old: 5 They crush Your people, O LORD, they afflict Your very own;

content: 6 they kill the widow and the stranger; they murder the fatherless,
content_old: 6 they kill the widow and the stranger; they murder the fatherless,

content: 7 thinking, “The LORD does not see it, the God of Jacob does not pay heed.”
content_old: 7 thinking, “The LORD does not see it, the God of Jacob does not pay heed.”

content: 8 Take heed, you most brutish people; fools, when will you get wisdom?
content_old: 8 Take heed, you most brutish people; fools, when will you get wisdom?

content: 9 Shall He who implants the ear not hear, He who forms the eye not see?
content_old: 9 Shall He who implants the ear not hear, He who forms the eye not see?

content: 10 Shall He who disciplines nations not punish, He who instructs men in knowledge?
content_old: 10 Shall He who disciplines nations not punish, He who instructs men in knowledge?

content: 11 The LORD knows the designs of men to be futile.
content_old: 11 The LORD knows the designs of men to be futile.

content: 12 Happy is the man whom You discipline, O LORD, the man You instruct in Your teaching,
content_old: 12 Happy is the man whom You discipline, O LORD, the man You instruct in Your teaching,

content: 13 to give him tranquillity in times of misfortune, until a pit be dug for the wicked.
content_old: 13 to give him tranquillity in times of misfortune, until a pit be dug for the wicked.

content: 14 For the LORD will not forsake His people; He will not abandon His very own.
content_old: 14 For the LORD will not forsake His people; He will not abandon His very own.

content: 15 Judgment shall again accord with justice and all the upright shall rally to it.
content_old: 15 Judgment shall again accord with justice and all the upright shall rally to it.

content: 16 Who will take my part against evil men? Who will stand up for me against wrongdoers?
content_old: 16 Who will take my part against evil men? Who will stand up for me against wrongdoers?

content: 17 Were not the LORD my help, I should soon dwell in silence.
content_old: 17 Were not the LORD my help, I should soon dwell in silence.

content: 18 When I think my foot has given way, Your faithfulness, O LORD, supports me.
content_old: 18 When I think my foot has given way, Your faithfulness, O LORD, supports me.

content: 19 When I am filled with cares, Your assurance soothes my soul.
content_old: 19 When I am filled with cares, Your assurance soothes my soul.

content: 20 Shall the seat of injustice be Your partner, that frames mischief by statute?
content_old: 20 Shall the seat of injustice be Your partner, that frames mischief by statute?

content: 21 They band together to do away with the righteous; they condemn the innocent to death.
content_old: 21 They band together to do away with the righteous; they condemn the innocent to death.

content: 22 But the LORD is my haven; my God is my sheltering rock.
content_old: 22 But the LORD is my haven; my God is my sheltering rock.

content: 1 Come, let us sing joyously to the LORD, raise a shout for our rock and deliverer;
content_old: 1 Come, let us sing joyously to the LORD, raise a shout for our rock and deliverer;

content: 2 let us come into His presence with praise; let us raise a shout for Him in song!
content_old: 2 let us come into His presence with praise; let us raise a shout for Him in song!

content: 3 For the LORD is a great God, the great king of all divine beings.
content_old: 3 For the LORD is a great God, the great king of all divine beings.

content: 4 In His hand are the depths of the earth; the peaks of the mountains are His.
content_old: 4 In His hand are the depths of the earth; the peaks of the mountains are His.

content: 5 His is the sea, He made it; and the land, which His hands fashioned.
content_old: 5 His is the sea, He made it; and the land, which His hands fashioned.

content: 6 Come, let us bow down and kneel, bend the knee before the LORD our maker,
content_old: 6 Come, let us bow down and kneel, bend the knee before the LORD our maker,

content: 7 for He is our God, and we are the people He tends, the flock in His care. O, if you would but heed His charge this day:
content_old: 7 for He is our God, and we are the people He tends, the flock in His care. O, if you would but heed His charge this day:

content: 8 Do not be stubborn as at Meribah, as on the day of Massah, in the wilderness,
content_old: 8 Do not be stubborn as at Meribah, as on the day of Massah, in the wilderness,

content: 9 when your fathers put Me to the test, tried Me, though they had seen My deeds.
content_old: 9 when your fathers put Me to the test, tried Me, though they had seen My deeds.

content: 10 Forty years I was provoked by that generation; I thought, “They are a senseless people; they would not know My ways.”
content_old: 10 Forty years I was provoked by that generation; I thought, “They are a senseless people; they would not know My ways.”

content: 1 Sing to the LORD a new song, sing to the LORD, all the earth.
content_old: 1 Sing to the LORD a new song, sing to the LORD, all the earth.

content: 2 Sing to the LORD, bless His name, proclaim His victory day after day.
content_old: 2 Sing to the LORD, bless His name, proclaim His victory day after day.

content: 3 Tell of His glory among the nations, His wondrous deeds, among all peoples.
content_old: 3 Tell of His glory among the nations, His wondrous deeds, among all peoples.

content: 4 For the LORD is great and much acclaimed, He is held in awe by all divine beings.
content_old: 4 For the LORD is great and much acclaimed, He is held in awe by all divine beings.

content: 5 All the gods of the peoples are mere idols, but the LORD made the heavens.
content_old: 5 All the gods of the peoples are mere idols, but the LORD made the heavens.

content: 6 Glory and majesty are before Him; strength and splendor are in His temple.
content_old: 6 Glory and majesty are before Him; strength and splendor are in His temple.

content: 7 Ascribe to the LORD, O families of the peoples, ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.
content_old: 7 Ascribe to the LORD, O families of the peoples, ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.

content: 8 Ascribe to the LORD the glory of His name, bring tribute and enter His courts.
content_old: 8 Ascribe to the LORD the glory of His name, bring tribute and enter His courts.

content: 9 Bow down to the LORD majestic in holiness; tremble in His presence, all the earth!
content_old: 9 Bow down to the LORD majestic in holiness; tremble in His presence, all the earth!

content: 10 Declare among the nations, “The LORD is king!” the world stands firm; it cannot be shaken; He judges the peoples with equity.
content_old: 10 Declare among the nations, “The LORD is king!” the world stands firm; it cannot be shaken; He judges the peoples with equity.

content: 11 Let the heavens rejoice and the earth exult; let the sea and all within it thunder,
content_old: 11 Let the heavens rejoice and the earth exult; let the sea and all within it thunder,

content: 12 the fields and everything in them exult; then shall all the trees of the forest shout for joy
content_old: 12 the fields and everything in them exult; then shall all the trees of the forest shout for joy

content: 1 The LORD is king! Let the earth exult, the many islands rejoice!
content_old: 1 The LORD is king! Let the earth exult, the many islands rejoice!

content: 2 Dense clouds are around Him, righteousness and justice are the base of His throne.
content_old: 2 Dense clouds are around Him, righteousness and justice are the base of His throne.

content: 3 Fire is His vanguard, burning His foes on every side.
content_old: 3 Fire is His vanguard, burning His foes on every side.

content: 4 His lightnings light up the world; the earth is convulsed at the sight;
content_old: 4 His lightnings light up the world; the earth is convulsed at the sight;

content: 5 mountains melt like wax at the LORD’s presence, at the presence of the Lord of all the earth.
content_old: 5 mountains melt like wax at the LORD’s presence, at the presence of the Lord of all the earth.

content: 6 The heavens proclaim His righteousness and all peoples see His glory.
content_old: 6 The heavens proclaim His righteousness and all peoples see His glory.

content: 7 All who worship images, who vaunt their idols, are dismayed; all divine beings bow down to Him.
content_old: 7 All who worship images, who vaunt their idols, are dismayed; all divine beings bow down to Him.

content: 8 Zion, hearing it, rejoices, the towns of Judah exult, because of Your judgments, O LORD.
content_old: 8 Zion, hearing it, rejoices, the towns of Judah exult, because of Your judgments, O LORD.

content: 9 For You, LORD, are supreme over all the earth; You are exalted high above all divine beings.
content_old: 9 For You, LORD, are supreme over all the earth; You are exalted high above all divine beings.

content: 10 O you who love the LORD, hate evil! He guards the lives of His loyal ones, saving them from the hand of the wicked.
content_old: 10 O you who love the LORD, hate evil! He guards the lives of His loyal ones, saving them from the hand of the wicked.

content: 11 Light is sown for the righteous, radiance for the upright.
content_old: 11 Light is sown for the righteous, radiance for the upright.

content: 1 A psalm. Sing to the LORD a new song, for He has worked wonders; His right hand, His holy arm, has won Him victory.
content_old: 1 A psalm. Sing to the LORD a new song, for He has worked wonders; His right hand, His holy arm, has won Him victory.

content: 2 The LORD has manifested His victory, has displayed His triumph in the sight of the nations.
content_old: 2 The LORD has manifested His victory, has displayed His triumph in the sight of the nations.

content: 3 He was mindful of His steadfast love and faithfulness toward the house of Israel; all the ends of the earth beheld the victory of our God.
content_old: 3 He was mindful of His steadfast love and faithfulness toward the house of Israel; all the ends of the earth beheld the victory of our God.

content: 4 Raise a shout to the LORD, all the earth, break into joyous songs of praise!
content_old: 4 Raise a shout to the LORD, all the earth, break into joyous songs of praise!

content: 5 Sing praise to the LORD with the lyre, with the lyre and melodious song.
content_old: 5 Sing praise to the LORD with the lyre, with the lyre and melodious song.

content: 6 With trumpets and the blast of the horn raise a shout before the LORD, the king.
content_old: 6 With trumpets and the blast of the horn raise a shout before the LORD, the king.

content: 7 Let the sea and all within it thunder, the world and its inhabitants;
content_old: 7 Let the sea and all within it thunder, the world and its inhabitants;

content: 8 let the rivers clap their hands, the mountains sing joyously together
content_old: 8 let the rivers clap their hands, the mountains sing joyously together

content: 1 The LORD, enthroned on cherubim, is king, peoples tremble, the earth quakes.
content_old: 1 The LORD, enthroned on cherubim, is king, peoples tremble, the earth quakes.

content: 2 The LORD is great in Zion, and exalted above all peoples.
content_old: 2 The LORD is great in Zion, and exalted above all peoples.

content: 3 They praise Your name as great and awesome; He is holy!
content_old: 3 They praise Your name as great and awesome; He is holy!

content: 4 Mighty king who loves justice, it was You who established equity, You who worked righteous judgment in Jacob.
content_old: 4 Mighty king who loves justice, it was You who established equity, You who worked righteous judgment in Jacob.

content: 5 Exalt the LORD our God and bow down to His footstool; He is holy!
content_old: 5 Exalt the LORD our God and bow down to His footstool; He is holy!

content: 6 Moses and Aaron among His priests, Samuel, among those who call on His name— when they called to the LORD, He answered them.
content_old: 6 Moses and Aaron among His priests, Samuel, among those who call on His name— when they called to the LORD, He answered them.

content: 7 He spoke to them in a pillar of cloud; they obeyed His decrees, the law He gave them.
content_old: 7 He spoke to them in a pillar of cloud; they obeyed His decrees, the law He gave them.

content: 8 O LORD our God, You answered them; You were a forgiving God for them, but You exacted retribution for their misdeeds.
content_old: 8 O LORD our God, You answered them; You were a forgiving God for them, but You exacted retribution for their misdeeds.

content: 1 A psalm for praise. Raise a shout for the LORD, all the earth;
content_old: 1 A psalm for praise. Raise a shout for the LORD, all the earth;

content: 2 worship the LORD in gladness; come into His presence with shouts of joy.
content_old: 2 worship the LORD in gladness; come into His presence with shouts of joy.

content: 3 Acknowledge that the LORD is God; He made us and we are His, His people, the flock He tends.
content_old: 3 Acknowledge that the LORD is God; He made us and we are His, His people, the flock He tends.

content: 4 Enter His gates with praise, His courts with acclamation. Praise Him! Bless His name!
content_old: 4 Enter His gates with praise, His courts with acclamation. Praise Him! Bless His name!

content: 1 Of David. A psalm. I will sing of faithfulness and justice; I will chant a hymn to You, O LORD.
content_old: 1 Of David. A psalm. I will sing of faithfulness and justice; I will chant a hymn to You, O LORD.

content: 2 I will study the way of the blameless; when shall I attain it? I will live without blame within my house.
content_old: 2 I will study the way of the blameless; when shall I attain it? I will live without blame within my house.

content: 3 I will not set before my eyes anything base; I hate crooked dealing; I will have none of it.
content_old: 3 I will not set before my eyes anything base; I hate crooked dealing; I will have none of it.

content: 4 Perverse thoughts will be far from me; I will know nothing of evil.
content_old: 4 Perverse thoughts will be far from me; I will know nothing of evil.

content: 5 He who slanders his friend in secret I will destroy; I cannot endure the haughty and proud man.
content_old: 5 He who slanders his friend in secret I will destroy; I cannot endure the haughty and proud man.

content: 6 My eyes are on the trusty men of the land, to have them at my side. He who follows the way of the blameless shall be in my service.
content_old: 6 My eyes are on the trusty men of the land, to have them at my side. He who follows the way of the blameless shall be in my service.

content: 7 He who deals deceitfully shall not live in my house; he who speaks untruth shall not stand before my eyes.
content_old: 7 He who deals deceitfully shall not live in my house; he who speaks untruth shall not stand before my eyes.

content: 1 A prayer of the lowly man when he is faint and pours forth his plea before the LORD.
content_old: 1 A prayer of the lowly man when he is faint and pours forth his plea before the LORD.

content: 2 O LORD, hear my prayer; let my cry come before You.
content_old: 2 O LORD, hear my prayer; let my cry come before You.

content: 3 Do not hide Your face from me in my time of trouble; turn Your ear to me; when I cry, answer me speedily.
content_old: 3 Do not hide Your face from me in my time of trouble; turn Your ear to me; when I cry, answer me speedily.

content: 4 For my days have vanished like smoke and my bones are charred like a hearth.
content_old: 4 For my days have vanished like smoke and my bones are charred like a hearth.

content: 5 My body is stricken and withered like grass; too wasted to eat my food;
content_old: 5 My body is stricken and withered like grass; too wasted to eat my food;

content: 6 on account of my vehement groaning my bones show through my skin.
content_old: 6 on account of my vehement groaning my bones show through my skin.

content: 7 I am like a great owl in the wilderness, an owl among the ruins.
content_old: 7 I am like a great owl in the wilderness, an owl among the ruins.

content: 8 I lie awake; I am like a lone bird upon a roof.
content_old: 8 I lie awake; I am like a lone bird upon a roof.

content: 9 All day long my enemies revile me; my deriders use my name to curse.
content_old: 9 All day long my enemies revile me; my deriders use my name to curse.

content: 10 For I have eaten ashes like bread and mixed my drink with tears,
content_old: 10 For I have eaten ashes like bread and mixed my drink with tears,

content: 11 because of Your wrath and Your fury; for You have cast me far away.
content_old: 11 because of Your wrath and Your fury; for You have cast me far away.

content: 12 My days are like a lengthening shadow; I wither like grass.
content_old: 12 My days are like a lengthening shadow; I wither like grass.

content: 13 But You, O LORD, are enthroned forever; Your fame endures throughout the ages.
content_old: 13 But You, O LORD, are enthroned forever; Your fame endures throughout the ages.

content: 14 You will surely arise and take pity on Zion, for it is time to be gracious to her; the appointed time has come.
content_old: 14 You will surely arise and take pity on Zion, for it is time to be gracious to her; the appointed time has come.

content: 15 Your servants take delight in its stones, and cherish its dust.
content_old: 15 Your servants take delight in its stones, and cherish its dust.

content: 16 The nations will fear the name of the LORD, all the kings of the earth, Your glory.
content_old: 16 The nations will fear the name of the LORD, all the kings of the earth, Your glory.

content: 17 For the LORD has built Zion; He has appeared in all His glory.
content_old: 17 For the LORD has built Zion; He has appeared in all His glory.

content: 18 He has turned to the prayer of the destitute and has not spurned their prayer.
content_old: 18 He has turned to the prayer of the destitute and has not spurned their prayer.

content: 19 May this be written down for a coming generation, that people yet to be created may praise the LORD.
content_old: 19 May this be written down for a coming generation, that people yet to be created may praise the LORD.

content: 20 For He looks down from His holy height; the LORD beholds the earth from heaven
content_old: 20 For He looks down from His holy height; the LORD beholds the earth from heaven

content: 21 to hear the groans of the prisoner, to release those condemned to death;
content_old: 21 to hear the groans of the prisoner, to release those condemned to death;

content: 22 that the fame of the LORD may be recounted in Zion, His praises in Jerusalem,
content_old: 22 that the fame of the LORD may be recounted in Zion, His praises in Jerusalem,

content: 23 when the nations gather together, the kingdoms, to serve the LORD.
content_old: 23 when the nations gather together, the kingdoms, to serve the LORD.

content: 24 He drained my strength in mid-course, He shortened my days.
content_old: 24 He drained my strength in mid-course, He shortened my days.

content: 25 I say, “O my God, do not take me away in the midst of my days, You whose years go on for generations on end.
content_old: 25 I say, “O my God, do not take me away in the midst of my days, You whose years go on for generations on end.

content: 26 Of old You established the earth; the heavens are the work of Your hands.
content_old: 26 Of old You established the earth; the heavens are the work of Your hands.

content: 27 They shall perish, but You shall endure; they shall all wear out like a garment; You change them like clothing and they pass away.
content_old: 27 They shall perish, but You shall endure; they shall all wear out like a garment; You change them like clothing and they pass away.

content: 28 But You are the same, and Your years never end.
content_old: 28 But You are the same, and Your years never end.

content: 1 Of David. Bless the LORD, O my soul, all my being, His holy name.
content_old: 1 Of David. Bless the LORD, O my soul, all my being, His holy name.

content: 2 Bless the LORD, O my soul and do not forget all His bounties.
content_old: 2 Bless the LORD, O my soul and do not forget all His bounties.

content: 3 He forgives all your sins, heals all your diseases.
content_old: 3 He forgives all your sins, heals all your diseases.

content: 4 He redeems your life from the Pit, surrounds you with steadfast love and mercy.
content_old: 4 He redeems your life from the Pit, surrounds you with steadfast love and mercy.

content: 5 He satisfies you with good things in the prime of life, so that your youth is renewed like the eagle’s.
content_old: 5 He satisfies you with good things in the prime of life, so that your youth is renewed like the eagle’s.

content: 6 The LORD executes righteous acts and judgments for all who are wronged.
content_old: 6 The LORD executes righteous acts and judgments for all who are wronged.

content: 7 He made known His ways to Moses, His deeds to the children of Israel.
content_old: 7 He made known His ways to Moses, His deeds to the children of Israel.

content: 8 The LORD is compassionate and gracious, slow to anger, abounding in steadfast love.
content_old: 8 The LORD is compassionate and gracious, slow to anger, abounding in steadfast love.

content: 9 He will not contend forever, or nurse His anger for all time.
content_old: 9 He will not contend forever, or nurse His anger for all time.

content: 10 He has not dealt with us according to our sins, nor has He requited us according to our iniquities.
content_old: 10 He has not dealt with us according to our sins, nor has He requited us according to our iniquities.

content: 11 For as the heavens are high above the earth, so great is His steadfast love toward those who fear Him.
content_old: 11 For as the heavens are high above the earth, so great is His steadfast love toward those who fear Him.

content: 12 As east is far from west, so far has He removed our sins from us.
content_old: 12 As east is far from west, so far has He removed our sins from us.

content: 13 As a father has compassion for his children, so the LORD has compassion for those who fear Him.
content_old: 13 As a father has compassion for his children, so the LORD has compassion for those who fear Him.

content: 14 For He knows how we are formed; He is mindful that we are dust.
content_old: 14 For He knows how we are formed; He is mindful that we are dust.

content: 15 Man, his days are like those of grass; he blooms like a flower of the field;
content_old: 15 Man, his days are like those of grass; he blooms like a flower of the field;

content: 16 a wind passes by and it is no more, its own place no longer knows it.
content_old: 16 a wind passes by and it is no more, its own place no longer knows it.

content: 17 But the LORD’s steadfast love is for all eternity toward those who fear Him, and His beneficence is for the children’s children
content_old: 17 But the LORD’s steadfast love is for all eternity toward those who fear Him, and His beneficence is for the children’s children

content: 18 of those who keep His covenant and remember to observe His precepts.
content_old: 18 of those who keep His covenant and remember to observe His precepts.

content: 19 The LORD has established His throne in heaven, and His sovereign rule is over all.
content_old: 19 The LORD has established His throne in heaven, and His sovereign rule is over all.

content: 20 Bless the LORD, O His angels, mighty creatures who do His bidding, ever obedient to His bidding;
content_old: 20 Bless the LORD, O His angels, mighty creatures who do His bidding, ever obedient to His bidding;

content: 21 bless the LORD, all His hosts, His servants who do His will;
content_old: 21 bless the LORD, all His hosts, His servants who do His will;

content: 1 Bless the LORD, O my soul; O LORD, my God, You are very great; You are clothed in glory and majesty,
content_old: 1 Bless the LORD, O my soul; O LORD, my God, You are very great; You are clothed in glory and majesty,

content: 2 wrapped in a robe of light; You spread the heavens like a tent cloth.
content_old: 2 wrapped in a robe of light; You spread the heavens like a tent cloth.

content: 3 He sets the rafters of His lofts in the waters, makes the clouds His chariot, moves on the wings of the wind.
content_old: 3 He sets the rafters of His lofts in the waters, makes the clouds His chariot, moves on the wings of the wind.

content: 4 He makes the winds His messengers, fiery flames His servants.
content_old: 4 He makes the winds His messengers, fiery flames His servants.

content: 5 He established the earth on its foundations, so that it shall never totter.
content_old: 5 He established the earth on its foundations, so that it shall never totter.

content: 6 You made the deep cover it as a garment; the waters stood above the mountains.
content_old: 6 You made the deep cover it as a garment; the waters stood above the mountains.

content: 7 They fled at Your blast, rushed away at the sound of Your thunder,
content_old: 7 They fled at Your blast, rushed away at the sound of Your thunder,

content: 8 —mountains rising, valleys sinking— to the place You established for them.
content_old: 8 —mountains rising, valleys sinking— to the place You established for them.

content: 9 You set bounds they must not pass so that they never again cover the earth.
content_old: 9 You set bounds they must not pass so that they never again cover the earth.

content: 10 You make springs gush forth in torrents; they make their way between the hills,
content_old: 10 You make springs gush forth in torrents; they make their way between the hills,

content: 11 giving drink to all the wild beasts; the wild asses slake their thirst.
content_old: 11 giving drink to all the wild beasts; the wild asses slake their thirst.

content: 12 The birds of the sky dwell beside them and sing among the foliage.
content_old: 12 The birds of the sky dwell beside them and sing among the foliage.

content: 13 You water the mountains from Your lofts; the earth is sated from the fruit of Your work.
content_old: 13 You water the mountains from Your lofts; the earth is sated from the fruit of Your work.

content: 14 You make the grass grow for the cattle, and herbage for man’s labor that he may get food out of the earth—
content_old: 14 You make the grass grow for the cattle, and herbage for man’s labor that he may get food out of the earth—

content: 15 wine that cheers the hearts of men oil that makes the face shine, and bread that sustains man’s life.
content_old: 15 wine that cheers the hearts of men oil that makes the face shine, and bread that sustains man’s life.

content: 16 The trees of the LORD drink their fill, the cedars of Lebanon, His own planting,
content_old: 16 The trees of the LORD drink their fill, the cedars of Lebanon, His own planting,

content: 17 where birds make their nests; the stork has her home in the junipers.
content_old: 17 where birds make their nests; the stork has her home in the junipers.

content: 18 The high mountains are for wild goats; the crags are a refuge for rock-badgers.
content_old: 18 The high mountains are for wild goats; the crags are a refuge for rock-badgers.

content: 19 He made the moon to mark the seasons; the sun knows when to set.
content_old: 19 He made the moon to mark the seasons; the sun knows when to set.

content: 20 You bring on darkness and it is night, when all the beasts of the forests stir.
content_old: 20 You bring on darkness and it is night, when all the beasts of the forests stir.

content: 21 The lions roar for prey, seeking their food from God.
content_old: 21 The lions roar for prey, seeking their food from God.

content: 22 When the sun rises, they come home and couch in their dens.
content_old: 22 When the sun rises, they come home and couch in their dens.

content: 23 Man then goes out to his work, to his labor until the evening.
content_old: 23 Man then goes out to his work, to his labor until the evening.

content: 24 How many are the things You have made, O LORD; You have made them all with wisdom; the earth is full of Your creations.
content_old: 24 How many are the things You have made, O LORD; You have made them all with wisdom; the earth is full of Your creations.

content: 25 There is the sea, vast and wide, with its creatures beyond number, living things, small and great.
content_old: 25 There is the sea, vast and wide, with its creatures beyond number, living things, small and great.

content: 26 There go the ships, and Leviathan that You formed to sport with.
content_old: 26 There go the ships, and Leviathan that You formed to sport with.

content: 27 All of them look to You to give them their food when it is due.
content_old: 27 All of them look to You to give them their food when it is due.

content: 28 Give it to them, they gather it up; open Your hand, they are well satisfied;
content_old: 28 Give it to them, they gather it up; open Your hand, they are well satisfied;

content: 29 hide Your face, they are terrified; take away their breath, they perish and turn again into dust;
content_old: 29 hide Your face, they are terrified; take away their breath, they perish and turn again into dust;

content: 30 send back Your breath, they are created, and You renew the face of the earth.
content_old: 30 send back Your breath, they are created, and You renew the face of the earth.

content: 31 May the glory of the LORD endure forever; may the LORD rejoice in His works!
content_old: 31 May the glory of the LORD endure forever; may the LORD rejoice in His works!

content: 32 He looks at the earth and it trembles; He touches the mountains and they smoke.
content_old: 32 He looks at the earth and it trembles; He touches the mountains and they smoke.

content: 33 I will sing to the LORD as long as I live; all my life I will chant hymns to my God.
content_old: 33 I will sing to the LORD as long as I live; all my life I will chant hymns to my God.

content: 34 May my prayer be pleasing to Him; I will rejoice in the LORD.
content_old: 34 May my prayer be pleasing to Him; I will rejoice in the LORD.

content: 1 Praise the LORD; call on His name; proclaim His deeds among the peoples.
content_old: 1 Praise the LORD; call on His name; proclaim His deeds among the peoples.

content: 2 Sing praises to Him; speak of all His wondrous acts.
content_old: 2 Sing praises to Him; speak of all His wondrous acts.

content: 3 Exult in His holy name; let all who seek the LORD rejoice.
content_old: 3 Exult in His holy name; let all who seek the LORD rejoice.

content: 4 Turn to the LORD, to His might; seek His presence constantly.
content_old: 4 Turn to the LORD, to His might; seek His presence constantly.

content: 5 Remember the wonders He has done, His portents and the judgments He has pronounced,
content_old: 5 Remember the wonders He has done, His portents and the judgments He has pronounced,

content: 6 O offspring of Abraham, His servant, O descendants of Jacob, His chosen ones.
content_old: 6 O offspring of Abraham, His servant, O descendants of Jacob, His chosen ones.

content: 7 He is the LORD our God; His judgments are throughout the earth.
content_old: 7 He is the LORD our God; His judgments are throughout the earth.

content: 8 He is ever mindful of His covenant, the promise He gave for a thousand generations,
content_old: 8 He is ever mindful of His covenant, the promise He gave for a thousand generations,

content: 9 that He made with Abraham, swore to Isaac,
content_old: 9 that He made with Abraham, swore to Isaac,

content: 10 and confirmed in a decree for Jacob, for Israel, as an eternal covenant,
content_old: 10 and confirmed in a decree for Jacob, for Israel, as an eternal covenant,

content: 11 saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan as your allotted heritage.”
content_old: 11 saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan as your allotted heritage.”

content: 12 They were then few in number, a mere handful, sojourning there,
content_old: 12 They were then few in number, a mere handful, sojourning there,

content: 13 wandering from nation to nation, from one kingdom to another.
content_old: 13 wandering from nation to nation, from one kingdom to another.

content: 14 He allowed no one to oppress them; He reproved kings on their account,
content_old: 14 He allowed no one to oppress them; He reproved kings on their account,

content: 15 “Do not touch My anointed ones; do not harm My prophets.”
content_old: 15 “Do not touch My anointed ones; do not harm My prophets.”

content: 16 He called down a famine on the land, destroyed every staff of bread.
content_old: 16 He called down a famine on the land, destroyed every staff of bread.

content: 17 He sent ahead of them a man, Joseph, sold into slavery.
content_old: 17 He sent ahead of them a man, Joseph, sold into slavery.

content: 18 His feet were subjected to fetters; an iron collar was put on his neck.
content_old: 18 His feet were subjected to fetters; an iron collar was put on his neck.

content: 19 Until his prediction came true the decree of the LORD purged him.
content_old: 19 Until his prediction came true the decree of the LORD purged him.

content: 20 The king sent to have him freed; the ruler of nations released him.
content_old: 20 The king sent to have him freed; the ruler of nations released him.

content: 21 He made him the lord of his household, empowered him over all his possessions,
content_old: 21 He made him the lord of his household, empowered him over all his possessions,

content: 22 to discipline his princes at will, to teach his elders wisdom.
content_old: 22 to discipline his princes at will, to teach his elders wisdom.

content: 23 Then Israel came to Egypt; Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.
content_old: 23 Then Israel came to Egypt; Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.

content: 24 He made His people very fruitful, more numerous than their foes.
content_old: 24 He made His people very fruitful, more numerous than their foes.

content: 25 He changed their heart to hate His people, to plot against His servants.
content_old: 25 He changed their heart to hate His people, to plot against His servants.

content: 26 He sent His servant Moses, and Aaron, whom He had chosen.
content_old: 26 He sent His servant Moses, and Aaron, whom He had chosen.

content: 27 They performed His signs among them, His wonders, against the land of Ham.
content_old: 27 They performed His signs among them, His wonders, against the land of Ham.

content: 28 He sent darkness; it was very dark; did they not defy His word?
content_old: 28 He sent darkness; it was very dark; did they not defy His word?

content: 29 He turned their waters into blood and killed their fish.
content_old: 29 He turned their waters into blood and killed their fish.

content: 30 Their land teemed with frogs, even the rooms of their king.
content_old: 30 Their land teemed with frogs, even the rooms of their king.

content: 31 Swarms of insects came at His command, lice, throughout their country.
content_old: 31 Swarms of insects came at His command, lice, throughout their country.

content: 32 He gave them hail for rain, and flaming fire in their land.
content_old: 32 He gave them hail for rain, and flaming fire in their land.

content: 33 He struck their vines and fig trees, broke down the trees of their country.
content_old: 33 He struck their vines and fig trees, broke down the trees of their country.

content: 34 Locusts came at His command, grasshoppers without number.
content_old: 34 Locusts came at His command, grasshoppers without number.

content: 35 They devoured every green thing in the land; they consumed the produce of the soil.
content_old: 35 They devoured every green thing in the land; they consumed the produce of the soil.

content: 36 He struck down every first-born in the land, the first fruit of their vigor.
content_old: 36 He struck down every first-born in the land, the first fruit of their vigor.

content: 37 He led Israel out with silver and gold; none among their tribes faltered.
content_old: 37 He led Israel out with silver and gold; none among their tribes faltered.

content: 38 Egypt rejoiced when they left, for dread of Israel had fallen upon them.
