content_old: 38 Egypt rejoiced when they left, for dread of Israel had fallen upon them.

content: 39 He spread a cloud for a cover, and fire to light up the night.
content_old: 39 He spread a cloud for a cover, and fire to light up the night.

content: 40 They asked and He brought them quail, and satisfied them with food from heaven.
content_old: 40 They asked and He brought them quail, and satisfied them with food from heaven.

content: 41 He opened a rock so that water gushed forth; it flowed as a stream in the parched land.
content_old: 41 He opened a rock so that water gushed forth; it flowed as a stream in the parched land.

content: 42 Mindful of His sacred promise to His servant Abraham,
content_old: 42 Mindful of His sacred promise to His servant Abraham,

content: 43 He led His people out in gladness, His chosen ones with joyous song.
content_old: 43 He led His people out in gladness, His chosen ones with joyous song.

content: 44 He gave them the lands of nations; they inherited the wealth of peoples,
content_old: 44 He gave them the lands of nations; they inherited the wealth of peoples,

content: 1 Hallelujah. Praise the LORD for He is good; His steadfast love is eternal.
content_old: 1 Hallelujah. Praise the LORD for He is good; His steadfast love is eternal.

content: 2 Who can tell the mighty acts of the LORD, proclaim all His praises?
content_old: 2 Who can tell the mighty acts of the LORD, proclaim all His praises?

content: 3 Happy are those who act justly, who do right at all times.
content_old: 3 Happy are those who act justly, who do right at all times.

content: 4 Be mindful of me, O LORD, when You favor Your people; take note of me when You deliver them,
content_old: 4 Be mindful of me, O LORD, when You favor Your people; take note of me when You deliver them,

content: 5 that I may enjoy the prosperity of Your chosen ones, share the joy of Your nation, glory in Your very own people.
content_old: 5 that I may enjoy the prosperity of Your chosen ones, share the joy of Your nation, glory in Your very own people.

content: 6 We have sinned like our forefathers; we have gone astray, done evil.
content_old: 6 We have sinned like our forefathers; we have gone astray, done evil.

content: 7 Our forefathers in Egypt did not perceive Your wonders; they did not remember Your abundant love, but rebelled at the sea, at the Sea of Reeds.
content_old: 7 Our forefathers in Egypt did not perceive Your wonders; they did not remember Your abundant love, but rebelled at the sea, at the Sea of Reeds.

content: 8 Yet He saved them, as befits His name, to make known His might.
content_old: 8 Yet He saved them, as befits His name, to make known His might.

content: 9 He sent His blast against the Sea of Reeds; it became dry; He led them through the deep as through a wilderness.
content_old: 9 He sent His blast against the Sea of Reeds; it became dry; He led them through the deep as through a wilderness.

content: 10 He delivered them from the foe, redeemed them from the enemy.
content_old: 10 He delivered them from the foe, redeemed them from the enemy.

content: 11 Water covered their adversaries; not one of them was left.
content_old: 11 Water covered their adversaries; not one of them was left.

content: 12 Then they believed His promise, and sang His praises.
content_old: 12 Then they believed His promise, and sang His praises.

content: 13 But they soon forgot His deeds; they would not wait to learn His plan.
content_old: 13 But they soon forgot His deeds; they would not wait to learn His plan.

content: 14 They were seized with craving in the wilderness, and put God to the test in the wasteland.
content_old: 14 They were seized with craving in the wilderness, and put God to the test in the wasteland.

content: 15 He gave them what they asked for, then made them waste away.
content_old: 15 He gave them what they asked for, then made them waste away.

content: 16 There was envy of Moses in the camp, and of Aaron, the holy one of the LORD.
content_old: 16 There was envy of Moses in the camp, and of Aaron, the holy one of the LORD.

content: 17 The earth opened up and swallowed Dathan, closed over the party of Abiram.
content_old: 17 The earth opened up and swallowed Dathan, closed over the party of Abiram.

content: 18 A fire blazed among their party, a flame that consumed the wicked.
content_old: 18 A fire blazed among their party, a flame that consumed the wicked.

content: 19 They made a calf at Horeb and bowed down to a molten image.
content_old: 19 They made a calf at Horeb and bowed down to a molten image.

content: 20 They exchanged their glory for the image of a bull that feeds on grass.
content_old: 20 They exchanged their glory for the image of a bull that feeds on grass.

content: 21 They forgot God who saved them, who performed great deeds in Egypt,
content_old: 21 They forgot God who saved them, who performed great deeds in Egypt,

content: 22 wondrous deeds in the land of Ham, awesome deeds at the Sea of Reeds.
content_old: 22 wondrous deeds in the land of Ham, awesome deeds at the Sea of Reeds.

content: 23 He would have destroyed them had not Moses His chosen one confronted Him in the breach to avert His destructive wrath.
content_old: 23 He would have destroyed them had not Moses His chosen one confronted Him in the breach to avert His destructive wrath.

content: 24 They rejected the desirable land, and put no faith in His promise.
content_old: 24 They rejected the desirable land, and put no faith in His promise.

content: 25 They grumbled in their tents and disobeyed the LORD.
content_old: 25 They grumbled in their tents and disobeyed the LORD.

content: 26 So He raised His hand in oath to make them fall in the wilderness,
content_old: 26 So He raised His hand in oath to make them fall in the wilderness,

content: 27 to disperse their offspring among the nations and scatter them through the lands.
content_old: 27 to disperse their offspring among the nations and scatter them through the lands.

content: 28 They attached themselves to Baal Peor, ate sacrifices offered to the dead.
content_old: 28 They attached themselves to Baal Peor, ate sacrifices offered to the dead.

content: 29 They provoked anger by their deeds, and a plague broke out among them.
content_old: 29 They provoked anger by their deeds, and a plague broke out among them.

content: 30 Phinehas stepped forth and intervened, and the plague ceased.
content_old: 30 Phinehas stepped forth and intervened, and the plague ceased.

content: 31 It was reckoned to his merit for all generations, to eternity.
content_old: 31 It was reckoned to his merit for all generations, to eternity.

content: 32 They provoked wrath at the waters of Meribah and Moses suffered on their account,
content_old: 32 They provoked wrath at the waters of Meribah and Moses suffered on their account,

content: 33 because they rebelled against Him and he spoke rashly.
content_old: 33 because they rebelled against Him and he spoke rashly.

content: 34 They did not destroy the nations as the LORD had commanded them,
content_old: 34 They did not destroy the nations as the LORD had commanded them,

content: 35 but mingled with the nations and learned their ways.
content_old: 35 but mingled with the nations and learned their ways.

content: 36 They worshiped their idols, which became a snare for them.
content_old: 36 They worshiped their idols, which became a snare for them.

content: 37 Their own sons and daughters they sacrificed to demons.
content_old: 37 Their own sons and daughters they sacrificed to demons.

content: 38 They shed innocent blood, the blood of their sons and daughters, whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan; so the land was polluted with bloodguilt.
content_old: 38 They shed innocent blood, the blood of their sons and daughters, whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan; so the land was polluted with bloodguilt.

content: 1 “Praise the LORD, for He is good; His steadfast love is eternal!”

content: 2 Thus let the redeemed of the LORD say, those He redeemed from adversity,

content: 3 whom He gathered in from the lands, from east and west, from the north and from the sea.
content_old: 3 whom He gathered in from the lands, from east and west, from the north and from the sea.

content: 4 Some lost their way in the wilderness, in the wasteland; they found no settled place.
content_old: 4 Some lost their way in the wilderness, in the wasteland; they found no settled place.

content: 5 Hungry and thirsty, their spirit failed.

content: 8 Let them praise the LORD for His steadfast love, His wondrous deeds for mankind;

content: 9 for He has satisfied the thirsty, filled the hungry with all good things.
content_old: 9 for He has satisfied the thirsty, filled the hungry with all good things.

content: 13 In their adversity they cried to the LORD, and He rescued them from their troubles.

content: 14 He brought them out of deepest darkness, broke their bonds asunder.

content: 15 Let them praise the LORD for His steadfast love, His wondrous deeds for mankind,

content: 16 For He shattered gates of bronze, He broke their iron bars.

content: 19 In their adversity they cried to the LORD and He saved them from their troubles.

content: 21 Let them praise the LORD for His steadfast love, His wondrous deeds for mankind.

content_old: 32 Let them exalt Him in the congregation of the people, acclaim Him in the assembly of the elders.

content_old: 34 fruitful land into a salt marsh, because of the wickedness of its inhabitants.

content: 1 A song. A psalm of David.
content_old: 1 A song. A psalm of David.

content: 2 My heart is firm, O God; I will sing and chant a hymn with all my soul.
content_old: 2 My heart is firm, O God; I will sing and chant a hymn with all my soul.

content: 3 Awake, O harp and lyre! I will wake the dawn.
content_old: 3 Awake, O harp and lyre! I will wake the dawn.

content: 4 I will praise You among the peoples, O LORD, sing a hymn to You among the nations;
content_old: 4 I will praise You among the peoples, O LORD, sing a hymn to You among the nations;

content: 5 for Your faithfulness is higher than the heavens; Your steadfastness reaches to the sky.
content_old: 5 for Your faithfulness is higher than the heavens; Your steadfastness reaches to the sky.

content: 6 Exalt Yourself over the heavens, O God; let Your glory be over all the earth!
content_old: 6 Exalt Yourself over the heavens, O God; let Your glory be over all the earth!

content: 7 That those whom You love may be rescued, deliver with Your right hand and answer me.
content_old: 7 That those whom You love may be rescued, deliver with Your right hand and answer me.

content: 8 God promised in His sanctuary that I would exultingly divide up Shechem, and measure the Valley of Sukkoth;
content_old: 8 God promised in His sanctuary that I would exultingly divide up Shechem, and measure the Valley of Sukkoth;

content: 9 Gilead and Manasseh would be mine, Ephraim my chief stronghold, Judah my scepter;
content_old: 9 Gilead and Manasseh would be mine, Ephraim my chief stronghold, Judah my scepter;

content: 10 Moab would be my washbasin; on Edom I would cast my shoe; I would raise a shout over Philistia.
content_old: 10 Moab would be my washbasin; on Edom I would cast my shoe; I would raise a shout over Philistia.

content: 11 Would that I were brought to the bastion! Would that I were led to Edom!
content_old: 11 Would that I were brought to the bastion! Would that I were led to Edom!

content: 12 But You have rejected us, O God; God, You do not march with our armies.
content_old: 12 But You have rejected us, O God; God, You do not march with our armies.

content: 13 Grant us Your aid against the foe, for the help of man is worthless.
content_old: 13 Grant us Your aid against the foe, for the help of man is worthless.

content: 1 For the leader. Of David. A psalm. O God of my praise, do not keep aloof,
content_old: 1 For the leader. Of David. A psalm. O God of my praise, do not keep aloof,

content: 2 for the wicked and the deceitful open their mouth against me; they speak to me with lying tongue.
content_old: 2 for the wicked and the deceitful open their mouth against me; they speak to me with lying tongue.

content: 3 They encircle me with words of hate; they attack me without cause.
content_old: 3 They encircle me with words of hate; they attack me without cause.

content: 4 They answer my love with accusation and I must stand judgment.
content_old: 4 They answer my love with accusation and I must stand judgment.

content: 5 They repay me with evil for good, with hatred for my love.
content_old: 5 They repay me with evil for good, with hatred for my love.

content: 6 Appoint a wicked man over him; may an accuser stand at his right side;
content_old: 6 Appoint a wicked man over him; may an accuser stand at his right side;

content: 7 may he be tried and convicted; may he be judged and found guilty.
content_old: 7 may he be tried and convicted; may he be judged and found guilty.

content: 8 May his days be few; may another take over his position.
content_old: 8 May his days be few; may another take over his position.

content: 9 May his children be orphans, his wife a widow.
content_old: 9 May his children be orphans, his wife a widow.

content: 10 May his children wander from their hovels, begging in search of bread.
content_old: 10 May his children wander from their hovels, begging in search of bread.

content: 11 May his creditor seize all his possessions; may strangers plunder his wealth.
content_old: 11 May his creditor seize all his possessions; may strangers plunder his wealth.

content: 12 May no one show him mercy; may none pity his orphans;
content_old: 12 May no one show him mercy; may none pity his orphans;

content_old: 13 may his posterity be cut off; may their names be blotted out in the next generation.

content: 14 May God be ever mindful of his father’s iniquity, and may the sin of his mother not be blotted out.
content_old: 14 May God be ever mindful of his father’s iniquity, and may the sin of his mother not be blotted out.

content: 15 May the LORD be aware of them always and cause their names to be cut off from the earth,
content_old: 15 May the LORD be aware of them always and cause their names to be cut off from the earth,

content: 16 because he was not minded to act kindly, and hounded to death the poor and needy man, one crushed in spirit.
content_old: 16 because he was not minded to act kindly, and hounded to death the poor and needy man, one crushed in spirit.

content: 17 He loved to curse—may a curse come upon him! He would not bless—may blessing be far from him!
content_old: 17 He loved to curse—may a curse come upon him! He would not bless—may blessing be far from him!

content: 18 May he be clothed in a curse like a garment, may it enter his body like water, his bones like oil.
content_old: 18 May he be clothed in a curse like a garment, may it enter his body like water, his bones like oil.

content: 19 Let it be like the cloak he wraps around him, like the belt he always wears.
content_old: 19 Let it be like the cloak he wraps around him, like the belt he always wears.

content: 20 May the LORD thus repay my accusers, all those who speak evil against me.
content_old: 20 May the LORD thus repay my accusers, all those who speak evil against me.

content: 21 Now You, O God, my Lord, act on my behalf as befits Your name. Good and faithful as You are, save me.
content_old: 21 Now You, O God, my Lord, act on my behalf as befits Your name. Good and faithful as You are, save me.

content: 25 I am the object of their scorn; when they see me, they shake their head.

content: 1 Of David. A psalm. The LORD said to my lord, “Sit at My right hand while I make your enemies your footstool.”

content: 2 The LORD will stretch forth from Zion your mighty scepter; hold sway over your enemies!
content_old: 2 The LORD will stretch forth from Zion your mighty scepter; hold sway over your enemies!

content: 3 Your people come forward willingly on your day of battle. In majestic holiness, from the womb, from the dawn, yours was the dew of youth.

content: 1 Hallelujah. Happy is the man who fears the LORD, who is ardently devoted to His commandments.

content: 2 His descendants will be mighty in the land, a blessed generation of upright men.

content: 5 All goes well with the man who lends generously, who conducts his affairs with equity.

content: 1 Not to us, O LORD, not to us but to Your name bring glory for the sake of Your love and Your faithfulness.

content_old: 2 Let the nations not say, “Where, now, is their God?”

content: 3 when our God is in heaven and all that He wills He accomplishes.

content: 5 They have mouths, but cannot speak, eyes, but cannot see;

content: 9 O Israel, trust in the LORD! He is their help and shield.

content: 2 Let Israel declare, “His steadfast love is eternal.”
content_old: 2 Let Israel declare, “His steadfast love is eternal.”

content: 3 Let the house of Aaron declare, “His steadfast love is eternal.”
content_old: 3 Let the house of Aaron declare, “His steadfast love is eternal.”

content: 4 Let those who fear the LORD declare, “His steadfast love is eternal.”
content_old: 4 Let those who fear the LORD declare, “His steadfast love is eternal.”

content: 5 In distress I called on the LORD; the Lord answered me and brought me relief.
content_old: 5 In distress I called on the LORD; the Lord answered me and brought me relief.

content: 6 The LORD is on my side, I have no fear; what can man do to me?
content_old: 6 The LORD is on my side, I have no fear; what can man do to me?

content: 7 With the LORD on my side as my helper, I will see the downfall of my foes.
content_old: 7 With the LORD on my side as my helper, I will see the downfall of my foes.

content: 8 It is better to take refuge in the LORD than to trust in mortals;
content_old: 8 It is better to take refuge in the LORD than to trust in mortals;

content: 9 it is better to take refuge in the LORD than to trust in the great.
content_old: 9 it is better to take refuge in the LORD than to trust in the great.

content: 10 All nations have beset me; by the name of the LORD I will surely cut them down.
content_old: 10 All nations have beset me; by the name of the LORD I will surely cut them down.

content: 11 They beset me, they surround me; by the name of the LORD I will surely cut them down.
content_old: 11 They beset me, they surround me; by the name of the LORD I will surely cut them down.

content: 12 They have beset me like bees; they shall be extinguished like burning thorns; by the name of the LORD I will surely cut them down.
content_old: 12 They have beset me like bees; they shall be extinguished like burning thorns; by the name of the LORD I will surely cut them down.

content: 13 You pressed me hard, I nearly fell; but the LORD helped me.
content_old: 13 You pressed me hard, I nearly fell; but the LORD helped me.

content: 14 The LORD is my strength and might; He has become my deliverance.
content_old: 14 The LORD is my strength and might; He has become my deliverance.

content: 15 The tents of the victorious resound with joyous shouts of deliverance, “The right hand of the LORD is triumphant!
content_old: 15 The tents of the victorious resound with joyous shouts of deliverance, “The right hand of the LORD is triumphant!

content: 16 The right hand of the LORD is exalted! The right hand of the LORD is triumphant!”
content_old: 16 The right hand of the LORD is exalted! The right hand of the LORD is triumphant!”

content: 17 I shall not die but live and proclaim the works of the LORD.
content_old: 17 I shall not die but live and proclaim the works of the LORD.

content: 18 The LORD punished me severely, but did not hand me over to death.
content_old: 18 The LORD punished me severely, but did not hand me over to death.

content: 19 Open the gates of victory for me that I may enter them and praise the LORD.
content_old: 19 Open the gates of victory for me that I may enter them and praise the LORD.

content: 20 This is the gateway to the LORD— the victorious shall enter through it.
content_old: 20 This is the gateway to the LORD— the victorious shall enter through it.

content: 21 I praise You, for You have answered me, and have become my deliverance.
content_old: 21 I praise You, for You have answered me, and have become my deliverance.

content: 22 The stone that the builders rejected has become the chief cornerstone.
content_old: 22 The stone that the builders rejected has become the chief cornerstone.

content: 23 This is the LORD’s doing; it is marvelous in our sight.
content_old: 23 This is the LORD’s doing; it is marvelous in our sight.

content: 24 This is the day that the LORD has made— let us exult and rejoice on it.
content_old: 24 This is the day that the LORD has made— let us exult and rejoice on it.

content: 25 O LORD, deliver us! O LORD, let us prosper!
content_old: 25 O LORD, deliver us! O LORD, let us prosper!

content: 26 May he who enters be blessed in the name of the LORD; we bless you from the House of the LORD.
content_old: 26 May he who enters be blessed in the name of the LORD; we bless you from the House of the LORD.

content: 27 The LORD is God; He has given us light; bind the festal offering to the horns of the altar with cords.
content_old: 27 The LORD is God; He has given us light; bind the festal offering to the horns of the altar with cords.

content: 28 You are my God and I will praise You; You are my God and I will extol You.
content_old: 28 You are my God and I will praise You; You are my God and I will extol You.

content: 1 Happy are those whose way is blameless, who follow the teaching of the LORD.
content_old: 1 Happy are those whose way is blameless, who follow the teaching of the LORD.

content: 2 Happy are those who observe His decrees, who turn to Him wholeheartedly.
content_old: 2 Happy are those who observe His decrees, who turn to Him wholeheartedly.

content: 3 They have done no wrong, but have followed His ways.
content_old: 3 They have done no wrong, but have followed His ways.

content: 4 You have commanded that Your precepts be kept diligently.
content_old: 4 You have commanded that Your precepts be kept diligently.

content: 5 Would that my ways were firm in keeping Your laws;
content_old: 5 Would that my ways were firm in keeping Your laws;

content: 6 then I would not be ashamed when I regard all Your commandments.
content_old: 6 then I would not be ashamed when I regard all Your commandments.

content: 7 I will praise You with a sincere heart as I learn Your just rules.
content_old: 7 I will praise You with a sincere heart as I learn Your just rules.

content: 8 I will keep Your laws; do not utterly forsake me.
content_old: 8 I will keep Your laws; do not utterly forsake me.

content: 9 How can a young man keep his way pure?— by holding to Your word.
content_old: 9 How can a young man keep his way pure?— by holding to Your word.

content: 10 I have turned to You with all my heart; do not let me stray from Your commandments.
content_old: 10 I have turned to You with all my heart; do not let me stray from Your commandments.

content: 11 In my heart I treasure Your promise; therefore I do not sin against You.
content_old: 11 In my heart I treasure Your promise; therefore I do not sin against You.

content: 12 Blessed are You, O LORD; train me in Your laws.
content_old: 12 Blessed are You, O LORD; train me in Your laws.

content: 13 With my lips I rehearse all the rules You proclaimed.
content_old: 13 With my lips I rehearse all the rules You proclaimed.

content: 14 I rejoice over the way of Your decrees as over all riches.
content_old: 14 I rejoice over the way of Your decrees as over all riches.

content: 15 I study Your precepts; I regard Your ways;
content_old: 15 I study Your precepts; I regard Your ways;

content: 16 I take delight in Your laws; I will not neglect Your word.
content_old: 16 I take delight in Your laws; I will not neglect Your word.

content: 17 Deal kindly with Your servant, that I may live to keep Your word.
content_old: 17 Deal kindly with Your servant, that I may live to keep Your word.

content: 18 Open my eyes, that I may perceive the wonders of Your teaching.
content_old: 18 Open my eyes, that I may perceive the wonders of Your teaching.

content: 19 I am only a sojourner in the land; do not hide Your commandments from me.
content_old: 19 I am only a sojourner in the land; do not hide Your commandments from me.

content: 20 My soul is consumed with longing for Your rules at all times.
content_old: 20 My soul is consumed with longing for Your rules at all times.

content: 21 You blast the accursed insolent ones who stray from Your commandments.
content_old: 21 You blast the accursed insolent ones who stray from Your commandments.

content: 22 Take away from me taunt and abuse, because I observe Your decrees.
content_old: 22 Take away from me taunt and abuse, because I observe Your decrees.

content: 23 Though princes meet and speak against me, Your servant studies Your laws.
content_old: 23 Though princes meet and speak against me, Your servant studies Your laws.

content: 24 For Your decrees are my delight, my intimate companions.
content_old: 24 For Your decrees are my delight, my intimate companions.

content: 25 My soul clings to the dust; revive me in accordance with Your word.
content_old: 25 My soul clings to the dust; revive me in accordance with Your word.

content: 26 I have declared my way, and You have answered me; train me in Your laws.
content_old: 26 I have declared my way, and You have answered me; train me in Your laws.

content: 27 Make me understand the way of Your precepts, that I may study Your wondrous acts.
content_old: 27 Make me understand the way of Your precepts, that I may study Your wondrous acts.

content: 28 I am racked with grief; sustain me in accordance with Your word.
content_old: 28 I am racked with grief; sustain me in accordance with Your word.

content: 29 Remove all false ways from me; favor me with Your teaching.
content_old: 29 Remove all false ways from me; favor me with Your teaching.

content: 30 I have chosen the way of faithfulness; I have set Your rules before me.
content_old: 30 I have chosen the way of faithfulness; I have set Your rules before me.

content: 31 I cling to Your decrees; O LORD, do not put me to shame.
content_old: 31 I cling to Your decrees; O LORD, do not put me to shame.

content: 32 I eagerly pursue Your commandments, for You broaden my understanding.
content_old: 32 I eagerly pursue Your commandments, for You broaden my understanding.

content: 33 Teach me, O LORD, the way of Your laws; I will observe them to the utmost.
content_old: 33 Teach me, O LORD, the way of Your laws; I will observe them to the utmost.

content: 34 Give me understanding, that I may observe Your teaching and keep it wholeheartedly.
content_old: 34 Give me understanding, that I may observe Your teaching and keep it wholeheartedly.

content: 35 Lead me in the path of Your commandments, for that is my concern.
content_old: 35 Lead me in the path of Your commandments, for that is my concern.

content: 36 Turn my heart to Your decrees and not to love of gain.
content_old: 36 Turn my heart to Your decrees and not to love of gain.

content: 37 Avert my eyes from seeing falsehood; by Your ways preserve me.
content_old: 37 Avert my eyes from seeing falsehood; by Your ways preserve me.

content: 38 Fulfill Your promise to Your servant, which is for those who worship You.
content_old: 38 Fulfill Your promise to Your servant, which is for those who worship You.

content: 39 Remove the taunt that I dread, for Your rules are good.
content_old: 39 Remove the taunt that I dread, for Your rules are good.

content: 40 See, I have longed for Your precepts; by Your righteousness preserve me.
content_old: 40 See, I have longed for Your precepts; by Your righteousness preserve me.

content: 41 May Your steadfast love reach me, O LORD, Your deliverance, as You have promised.
content_old: 41 May Your steadfast love reach me, O LORD, Your deliverance, as You have promised.

content: 42 I shall have an answer for those who taunt me, for I have put my trust in Your word.
content_old: 42 I shall have an answer for those who taunt me, for I have put my trust in Your word.

content: 43 Do not utterly take the truth away from my mouth, for I have put my hope in Your rules.
content_old: 43 Do not utterly take the truth away from my mouth, for I have put my hope in Your rules.

content: 44 I will always obey Your teaching, forever and ever.
content_old: 44 I will always obey Your teaching, forever and ever.

content: 45 I will walk about at ease, for I have turned to Your precepts.
content_old: 45 I will walk about at ease, for I have turned to Your precepts.

content: 46 I will speak of Your decrees, and not be ashamed in the presence of kings.
content_old: 46 I will speak of Your decrees, and not be ashamed in the presence of kings.

content: 47 I will delight in Your commandments, which I love.
content_old: 47 I will delight in Your commandments, which I love.

content: 48 I reach out for Your commandments, which I love; I study Your laws.
content_old: 48 I reach out for Your commandments, which I love; I study Your laws.

content: 49 Remember Your word to Your servant through which You have given me hope.
content_old: 49 Remember Your word to Your servant through which You have given me hope.

content: 50 This is my comfort in my affliction, that Your promise has preserved me.
content_old: 50 This is my comfort in my affliction, that Your promise has preserved me.

content: 51 Though the arrogant have cruelly mocked me, I have not swerved from Your teaching.
content_old: 51 Though the arrogant have cruelly mocked me, I have not swerved from Your teaching.

content: 52 I remember Your rules of old, O LORD, and find comfort in them.
content_old: 52 I remember Your rules of old, O LORD, and find comfort in them.

content: 53 I am seized with rage because of the wicked who forsake Your teaching.
content_old: 53 I am seized with rage because of the wicked who forsake Your teaching.

content: 54 Your laws are a source of strength to me wherever I may dwell.
content_old: 54 Your laws are a source of strength to me wherever I may dwell.

content: 55 I remember Your name at night, O LORD, and obey Your teaching.
content_old: 55 I remember Your name at night, O LORD, and obey Your teaching.

content: 56 This has been my lot, for I have observed Your precepts.
content_old: 56 This has been my lot, for I have observed Your precepts.

content: 57 The LORD is my portion; I have resolved to keep Your words.
content_old: 57 The LORD is my portion; I have resolved to keep Your words.

content: 58 I have implored You with all my heart; have mercy on me, in accordance with Your promise.
content_old: 58 I have implored You with all my heart; have mercy on me, in accordance with Your promise.

content: 59 I have considered my ways, and have turned back to Your decrees.
content_old: 59 I have considered my ways, and have turned back to Your decrees.

content: 60 I have hurried and not delayed to keep Your commandments.
content_old: 60 I have hurried and not delayed to keep Your commandments.

content: 61 Though the bonds of the wicked are coiled round me, I have not neglected Your teaching.
content_old: 61 Though the bonds of the wicked are coiled round me, I have not neglected Your teaching.

content: 62 I arise at midnight to praise You for Your just rules.
content_old: 62 I arise at midnight to praise You for Your just rules.

content: 63 I am a companion to all who fear You, to those who keep Your precepts.
content_old: 63 I am a companion to all who fear You, to those who keep Your precepts.

content: 64 Your steadfast love, O LORD, fills the earth; teach me Your laws.
content_old: 64 Your steadfast love, O LORD, fills the earth; teach me Your laws.

content: 65 You have treated Your servant well, according to Your word, O LORD.
content_old: 65 You have treated Your servant well, according to Your word, O LORD.

content: 66 Teach me good sense and knowledge, for I have put my trust in Your commandments.
content_old: 66 Teach me good sense and knowledge, for I have put my trust in Your commandments.

content: 67 Before I was humbled I went astray, but now I keep Your word.
content_old: 67 Before I was humbled I went astray, but now I keep Your word.

content: 68 You are good and beneficent; teach me Your laws.
content_old: 68 You are good and beneficent; teach me Your laws.

content: 69 Though the arrogant have accused me falsely, I observe Your precepts wholeheartedly.
content_old: 69 Though the arrogant have accused me falsely, I observe Your precepts wholeheartedly.

content: 70 Their minds are thick like fat; as for me, Your teaching is my delight.
content_old: 70 Their minds are thick like fat; as for me, Your teaching is my delight.

content: 71 It was good for me that I was humbled, so that I might learn Your laws.
content_old: 71 It was good for me that I was humbled, so that I might learn Your laws.

content: 72 I prefer the teaching You proclaimed to thousands of gold and silver pieces.
content_old: 72 I prefer the teaching You proclaimed to thousands of gold and silver pieces.

content: 73 Your hands made me and fashioned me; give me understanding that I may learn Your commandments.
content_old: 73 Your hands made me and fashioned me; give me understanding that I may learn Your commandments.

content: 74 Those who fear You will see me and rejoice, for I have put my hope in Your word.
content_old: 74 Those who fear You will see me and rejoice, for I have put my hope in Your word.

content: 75 I know, O LORD, that Your rulings are just; rightly have You humbled me.
content_old: 75 I know, O LORD, that Your rulings are just; rightly have You humbled me.

content: 76 May Your steadfast love comfort me in accordance with Your promise to Your servant.
content_old: 76 May Your steadfast love comfort me in accordance with Your promise to Your servant.

content: 77 May Your mercy reach me, that I might live, for Your teaching is my delight.
content_old: 77 May Your mercy reach me, that I might live, for Your teaching is my delight.

content: 78 Let the insolent be dismayed, for they have wronged me without cause; I will study Your precepts.
content_old: 78 Let the insolent be dismayed, for they have wronged me without cause; I will study Your precepts.

content: 79 May those who fear You, those who know Your decrees, turn again to me.
content_old: 79 May those who fear You, those who know Your decrees, turn again to me.

content: 80 May I wholeheartedly follow Your laws so that I do not come to grief.
content_old: 80 May I wholeheartedly follow Your laws so that I do not come to grief.

content: 81 I long for Your deliverance; I hope for Your word.
content_old: 81 I long for Your deliverance; I hope for Your word.

content: 82 My eyes pine away for Your promise; I say, “When will You comfort me?”
content_old: 82 My eyes pine away for Your promise; I say, “When will You comfort me?”

content: 83 Though I have become like a water-skin dried in smoke, I have not neglected Your laws.
content_old: 83 Though I have become like a water-skin dried in smoke, I have not neglected Your laws.

content: 84 How long has Your servant to live? when will You bring my persecutors to judgment?
content_old: 84 How long has Your servant to live? when will You bring my persecutors to judgment?

content: 85 The insolent have dug pits for me, flouting Your teaching.
content_old: 85 The insolent have dug pits for me, flouting Your teaching.

content: 86 All Your commandments are enduring; I am persecuted without cause; help me!
content_old: 86 All Your commandments are enduring; I am persecuted without cause; help me!

content: 87 Though they almost wiped me off the earth, I did not abandon Your precepts.
content_old: 87 Though they almost wiped me off the earth, I did not abandon Your precepts.

content: 88 As befits Your steadfast love, preserve me, so that I may keep the decree You proclaimed.
content_old: 88 As befits Your steadfast love, preserve me, so that I may keep the decree You proclaimed.

content: 89 The LORD exists forever; Your word stands firm in heaven.
content_old: 89 The LORD exists forever; Your word stands firm in heaven.

content: 90 Your faithfulness is for all generations; You have established the earth, and it stands.
content_old: 90 Your faithfulness is for all generations; You have established the earth, and it stands.

content: 91 They stand this day to Your rulings, for all are Your servants.
content_old: 91 They stand this day to Your rulings, for all are Your servants.

content: 92 Were not Your teaching my delight I would have perished in my affliction.
content_old: 92 Were not Your teaching my delight I would have perished in my affliction.

content: 93 I will never neglect Your precepts, for You have preserved my life through them.
content_old: 93 I will never neglect Your precepts, for You have preserved my life through them.

content: 94 I am Yours; save me! For I have turned to Your precepts.
content_old: 94 I am Yours; save me! For I have turned to Your precepts.

content: 95 The wicked hope to destroy me, but I ponder Your decrees.
content_old: 95 The wicked hope to destroy me, but I ponder Your decrees.

content: 96 I have seen that all things have their limit, but Your commandment is broad beyond measure.
content_old: 96 I have seen that all things have their limit, but Your commandment is broad beyond measure.

content: 97 O how I love Your teaching! It is my study all day long.
content_old: 97 O how I love Your teaching! It is my study all day long.

content: 98 Your commandments make me wiser than my enemies; they always stand by me.
content_old: 98 Your commandments make me wiser than my enemies; they always stand by me.

content: 99 I have gained more insight than all my teachers, for Your decrees are my study.
content_old: 99 I have gained more insight than all my teachers, for Your decrees are my study.

content: 100 I have gained more understanding than my elders, for I observe Your precepts.
content_old: 100 I have gained more understanding than my elders, for I observe Your precepts.

content: 101 I have avoided every evil way so that I may keep Your word.
content_old: 101 I have avoided every evil way so that I may keep Your word.

content: 102 I have not departed from Your rules, for You have instructed me.
content_old: 102 I have not departed from Your rules, for You have instructed me.

content: 103 How pleasing is Your word to my palate, sweeter than honey.
content_old: 103 How pleasing is Your word to my palate, sweeter than honey.

content: 104 I ponder Your precepts; therefore I hate every false way.
content_old: 104 I ponder Your precepts; therefore I hate every false way.

content: 105 Your word is a lamp to my feet, a light for my path.
content_old: 105 Your word is a lamp to my feet, a light for my path.

content: 106 I have firmly sworn to keep Your just rules.
content_old: 106 I have firmly sworn to keep Your just rules.

content: 107 I am very much afflicted; O LORD, preserve me in accordance with Your word.
content_old: 107 I am very much afflicted; O LORD, preserve me in accordance with Your word.

content: 108 Accept, O LORD, my freewill offerings; teach me Your rules.
content_old: 108 Accept, O LORD, my freewill offerings; teach me Your rules.

content: 109 Though my life is always in danger, I do not neglect Your teaching.
content_old: 109 Though my life is always in danger, I do not neglect Your teaching.

content: 110 Though the wicked have set a trap for me, I have not strayed from Your precepts.
content_old: 110 Though the wicked have set a trap for me, I have not strayed from Your precepts.

content: 111 Your decrees are my eternal heritage; they are my heart’s delight.
content_old: 111 Your decrees are my eternal heritage; they are my heart’s delight.

content: 112 I am resolved to follow Your laws to the utmost forever.
content_old: 112 I am resolved to follow Your laws to the utmost forever.

content: 113 I hate men of divided heart, but I love Your teaching.
content_old: 113 I hate men of divided heart, but I love Your teaching.

content: 114 You are my protection and my shield; I hope for Your word.
content_old: 114 You are my protection and my shield; I hope for Your word.

content: 115 Keep away from me, you evildoers, that I may observe the commandments of my God.
content_old: 115 Keep away from me, you evildoers, that I may observe the commandments of my God.

content: 116 Support me as You promised, so that I may live; do not thwart my expectation.
content_old: 116 Support me as You promised, so that I may live; do not thwart my expectation.

content: 117 Sustain me that I may be saved, and I will always muse upon Your laws.
content_old: 117 Sustain me that I may be saved, and I will always muse upon Your laws.

content: 118 You reject all who stray from Your laws, for they are false and deceitful.
content_old: 118 You reject all who stray from Your laws, for they are false and deceitful.

content: 119 You do away with the wicked as if they were dross; rightly do I love Your decrees.
content_old: 119 You do away with the wicked as if they were dross; rightly do I love Your decrees.

content: 120 My flesh creeps from fear of You; I am in awe of Your rulings.
content_old: 120 My flesh creeps from fear of You; I am in awe of Your rulings.

content: 121 I have done what is just and right; do not abandon me to those who would wrong me.
content_old: 121 I have done what is just and right; do not abandon me to those who would wrong me.

content: 122 Guarantee Your servant’s well-being; do not let the arrogant wrong me.
content_old: 122 Guarantee Your servant’s well-being; do not let the arrogant wrong me.

content: 123 My eyes pine away for Your deliverance, for Your promise of victory.
content_old: 123 My eyes pine away for Your deliverance, for Your promise of victory.

content: 124 Deal with Your servant as befits Your steadfast love; teach me Your laws.
content_old: 124 Deal with Your servant as befits Your steadfast love; teach me Your laws.

content: 125 I am Your servant; give me understanding, that I might know Your decrees.
content_old: 125 I am Your servant; give me understanding, that I might know Your decrees.

content: 126 It is a time to act for the LORD, for they have violated Your teaching.
content_old: 126 It is a time to act for the LORD, for they have violated Your teaching.

content: 127 Rightly do I love Your commandments more than gold, even fine gold.
content_old: 127 Rightly do I love Your commandments more than gold, even fine gold.

content: 128 Truly by all Your precepts I walk straight; I hate every false way.
content_old: 128 Truly by all Your precepts I walk straight; I hate every false way.

content: 129 Your decrees are wondrous; rightly do I observe them.
content_old: 129 Your decrees are wondrous; rightly do I observe them.

content: 130 The words You inscribed give light, and grant understanding to the simple.
content_old: 130 The words You inscribed give light, and grant understanding to the simple.

content: 131 I open my mouth wide, I pant, longing for Your commandments.
content_old: 131 I open my mouth wide, I pant, longing for Your commandments.

content: 132 Turn to me and be gracious to me, as is Your rule with those who love Your name.
content_old: 132 Turn to me and be gracious to me, as is Your rule with those who love Your name.

content: 133 Make my feet firm through Your promise; do not let iniquity dominate me.
content_old: 133 Make my feet firm through Your promise; do not let iniquity dominate me.

content: 134 Redeem me from being wronged by man, that I may keep Your precepts.
content_old: 134 Redeem me from being wronged by man, that I may keep Your precepts.

content: 135 Show favor to Your servant, and teach me Your laws.
content_old: 135 Show favor to Your servant, and teach me Your laws.

content: 136 My eyes shed streams of water because men do not obey Your teaching.
content_old: 136 My eyes shed streams of water because men do not obey Your teaching.

content: 137 You are righteous, O LORD; Your rulings are just.
content_old: 137 You are righteous, O LORD; Your rulings are just.

content: 138 You have ordained righteous decrees; they are firmly enduring.
content_old: 138 You have ordained righteous decrees; they are firmly enduring.

content: 139 I am consumed with rage over my foes’ neglect of Your words.
content_old: 139 I am consumed with rage over my foes’ neglect of Your words.

content: 140 Your word is exceedingly pure, and Your servant loves it.
content_old: 140 Your word is exceedingly pure, and Your servant loves it.

content: 141 Though I am belittled and despised, I have not neglected Your precepts.
content_old: 141 Though I am belittled and despised, I have not neglected Your precepts.

content: 142 Your righteousness is eternal; Your teaching is true.
content_old: 142 Your righteousness is eternal; Your teaching is true.

content: 143 Though anguish and distress come upon me, Your commandments are my delight.
content_old: 143 Though anguish and distress come upon me, Your commandments are my delight.

content: 144 Your righteous decrees are eternal; give me understanding, that I might live.
content_old: 144 Your righteous decrees are eternal; give me understanding, that I might live.

content: 145 I call with all my heart; answer me, O LORD, that I may observe Your laws.
content_old: 145 I call with all my heart; answer me, O LORD, that I may observe Your laws.

content: 146 I call upon You; save me, that I may keep Your decrees.
content_old: 146 I call upon You; save me, that I may keep Your decrees.

content: 147 I rise before dawn and cry for help; I hope for Your word.
content_old: 147 I rise before dawn and cry for help; I hope for Your word.

content: 148 My eyes greet each watch of the night, as I meditate on Your promise.
content_old: 148 My eyes greet each watch of the night, as I meditate on Your promise.

content: 149 Hear my voice as befits Your steadfast love; O LORD, preserve me, as is Your rule.
content_old: 149 Hear my voice as befits Your steadfast love; O LORD, preserve me, as is Your rule.

content: 150 Those who pursue intrigue draw near; they are far from Your teaching.
content_old: 150 Those who pursue intrigue draw near; they are far from Your teaching.

content: 151 You, O LORD, are near, and all Your commandments are true.
content_old: 151 You, O LORD, are near, and all Your commandments are true.

content: 152 I know from Your decrees of old that You have established them forever.
content_old: 152 I know from Your decrees of old that You have established them forever.

content: 153 See my affliction and rescue me, for I have not neglected Your teaching.
content_old: 153 See my affliction and rescue me, for I have not neglected Your teaching.

content: 154 Champion my cause and redeem me; preserve me according to Your promise.
content_old: 154 Champion my cause and redeem me; preserve me according to Your promise.

content: 155 Deliverance is far from the wicked, for they have not turned to Your laws.
content_old: 155 Deliverance is far from the wicked, for they have not turned to Your laws.

content: 156 Your mercies are great, O LORD; as is Your rule, preserve me.
content_old: 156 Your mercies are great, O LORD; as is Your rule, preserve me.

content: 157 Many are my persecutors and foes; I have not swerved from Your decrees.
content_old: 157 Many are my persecutors and foes; I have not swerved from Your decrees.

content: 158 I have seen traitors and loathed them, because they did not keep Your word in mind.
content_old: 158 I have seen traitors and loathed them, because they did not keep Your word in mind.

content: 159 See that I have loved Your precepts; O LORD, preserve me, as befits Your steadfast love.
content_old: 159 See that I have loved Your precepts; O LORD, preserve me, as befits Your steadfast love.

content: 160 Truth is the essence of Your word; Your just rules are eternal.
content_old: 160 Truth is the essence of Your word; Your just rules are eternal.

content: 161 Princes have persecuted me without reason; my heart thrills at Your word.
content_old: 161 Princes have persecuted me without reason; my heart thrills at Your word.

content: 162 I rejoice over Your promise as one who obtains great spoil.
content_old: 162 I rejoice over Your promise as one who obtains great spoil.

content: 163 I hate and abhor falsehood; I love Your teaching.
content_old: 163 I hate and abhor falsehood; I love Your teaching.

content: 164 I praise You seven times each day for Your just rules.
content_old: 164 I praise You seven times each day for Your just rules.

content: 165 Those who love Your teaching enjoy well-being; they encounter no adversity.
content_old: 165 Those who love Your teaching enjoy well-being; they encounter no adversity.

content: 166 I hope for Your deliverance, O LORD; I observe Your commandments.
content_old: 166 I hope for Your deliverance, O LORD; I observe Your commandments.

content: 167 I obey Your decrees and love them greatly.
content_old: 167 I obey Your decrees and love them greatly.

content: 168 I obey Your precepts and decrees; all my ways are before You.
content_old: 168 I obey Your precepts and decrees; all my ways are before You.

content: 169 May my plea reach You, O LORD; grant me understanding according to Your word.
content_old: 169 May my plea reach You, O LORD; grant me understanding according to Your word.

content: 170 May my petition come before You; save me in accordance with Your promise.
content_old: 170 May my petition come before You; save me in accordance with Your promise.

content: 171 My lips shall pour forth praise, for You teach me Your laws.
content_old: 171 My lips shall pour forth praise, for You teach me Your laws.

content: 172 My tongue shall declare Your promise, for all Your commandments are just.
content_old: 172 My tongue shall declare Your promise, for all Your commandments are just.

content: 173 Lend Your hand to help me, for I have chosen Your precepts.
content_old: 173 Lend Your hand to help me, for I have chosen Your precepts.

content: 174 I have longed for Your deliverance, O LORD; Your teaching is my delight.
content_old: 174 I have longed for Your deliverance, O LORD; Your teaching is my delight.

content: 175 Let me live, that I may praise You; may Your rules be my help;
content_old: 175 Let me live, that I may praise You; may Your rules be my help;

content: 1 A song of ascents. In my distress I called to the LORD and He answered me.
content_old: 1 A song of ascents. In my distress I called to the LORD and He answered me.

content: 2 O LORD, save me from treacherous lips, from a deceitful tongue!
content_old: 2 O LORD, save me from treacherous lips, from a deceitful tongue!

content: 3 What can you profit, what can you gain, O deceitful tongue?
content_old: 3 What can you profit, what can you gain, O deceitful tongue?

content: 4 A warrior’s sharp arrows, with hot coals of broom-wood.
content_old: 4 A warrior’s sharp arrows, with hot coals of broom-wood.

content: 5 Woe is me, that I live with Meshech, that I dwell among the clans of Kedar.
content_old: 5 Woe is me, that I live with Meshech, that I dwell among the clans of Kedar.

content: 6 Too long have I dwelt with those who hate peace.
content_old: 6 Too long have I dwelt with those who hate peace.

content: 1 A song for ascents. I turn my eyes to the mountains; from where will my help come?
content_old: 1 A song for ascents. I turn my eyes to the mountains; from where will my help come?

content: 2 My help comes from the LORD, maker of heaven and earth.
content_old: 2 My help comes from the LORD, maker of heaven and earth.

content: 3 He will not let your foot give way; your guardian will not slumber;
content_old: 3 He will not let your foot give way; your guardian will not slumber;

content: 4 See, the guardian of Israel neither slumbers nor sleeps!
content_old: 4 See, the guardian of Israel neither slumbers nor sleeps!

content: 5 The LORD is your guardian, the LORD is your protection at your right hand.
content_old: 5 The LORD is your guardian, the LORD is your protection at your right hand.

content: 6 By day the sun will not strike you, nor the moon by night.
content_old: 6 By day the sun will not strike you, nor the moon by night.

content: 7 The LORD will guard you from all harm; He will guard your life.
content_old: 7 The LORD will guard you from all harm; He will guard your life.

content: 1 A song of ascents. Of David. I rejoiced when they said to me, “We are going to the House of the LORD.”
content_old: 1 A song of ascents. Of David. I rejoiced when they said to me, “We are going to the House of the LORD.”

content: 2 Our feet stood inside your gates, O Jerusalem,
content_old: 2 Our feet stood inside your gates, O Jerusalem,

content: 3 Jerusalem built up, a city knit together,
content_old: 3 Jerusalem built up, a city knit together,

content: 4 to which tribes would make pilgrimage, the tribes of the LORD, —as was enjoined upon Israel— to praise the name of the LORD.
content_old: 4 to which tribes would make pilgrimage, the tribes of the LORD, —as was enjoined upon Israel— to praise the name of the LORD.

content: 5 There the thrones of judgment stood, thrones of the house of David.
content_old: 5 There the thrones of judgment stood, thrones of the house of David.

content: 6 Pray for the well-being of Jerusalem; “May those who love you be at peace.
content_old: 6 Pray for the well-being of Jerusalem; “May those who love you be at peace.

content: 7 May there be well-being within your ramparts, peace in your citadels.”
content_old: 7 May there be well-being within your ramparts, peace in your citadels.”

content: 8 For the sake of my kin and friends, I pray for your well-being;
content_old: 8 For the sake of my kin and friends, I pray for your well-being;

content: 1 A song of ascents. To You, enthroned in heaven, I turn my eyes.
content_old: 1 A song of ascents. To You, enthroned in heaven, I turn my eyes.

content: 2 As the eyes of slaves follow their master’s hand, as the eyes of a slave-girl follow the hand of her mistress, so our eyes are toward the LORD our God, awaiting His favor.
content_old: 2 As the eyes of slaves follow their master’s hand, as the eyes of a slave-girl follow the hand of her mistress, so our eyes are toward the LORD our God, awaiting His favor.

content: 3 Show us favor, O LORD, show us favor! We have had more than enough of contempt.
content_old: 3 Show us favor, O LORD, show us favor! We have had more than enough of contempt.

content: 1 A song of ascents. Of David. Were it not for the LORD, who was on our side, let Israel now declare,
content_old: 1 A song of ascents. Of David. Were it not for the LORD, who was on our side, let Israel now declare,

content: 2 were it not for the LORD, who was on our side when men assailed us,
content_old: 2 were it not for the LORD, who was on our side when men assailed us,

content: 3 they would have swallowed us alive in their burning rage against us;
content_old: 3 they would have swallowed us alive in their burning rage against us;

content: 4 the waters would have carried us off, the torrent would have swept over us;
content_old: 4 the waters would have carried us off, the torrent would have swept over us;

content: 5 over us would have swept the seething waters.
content_old: 5 over us would have swept the seething waters.

content: 6 Blessed is the LORD, who did not let us be ripped apart by their teeth.
content_old: 6 Blessed is the LORD, who did not let us be ripped apart by their teeth.

content: 7 We are like a bird escaped from the fowler’s trap; the trap broke and we escaped.
content_old: 7 We are like a bird escaped from the fowler’s trap; the trap broke and we escaped.

content: 1 A song of ascents. Those who trust in the LORD are like Mount Zion that cannot be moved, enduring forever.
content_old: 1 A song of ascents. Those who trust in the LORD are like Mount Zion that cannot be moved, enduring forever.

content: 2 Jerusalem, hills enfold it, and the LORD enfolds His people now and forever.
content_old: 2 Jerusalem, hills enfold it, and the LORD enfolds His people now and forever.

content: 3 The scepter of the wicked shall never rest upon the land allotted to the righteous, that the righteous not set their hand to wrongdoing.
content_old: 3 The scepter of the wicked shall never rest upon the land allotted to the righteous, that the righteous not set their hand to wrongdoing.

content: 4 Do good, O LORD, to the good, to the upright in heart.
content_old: 4 Do good, O LORD, to the good, to the upright in heart.

content: 1 A song of ascents. When the LORD restores the fortunes of Zion —we see it as in a dream—
content_old: 1 A song of ascents. When the LORD restores the fortunes of Zion —we see it as in a dream—

content: 2 our mouths shall be filled with laughter, our tongues, with songs of joy. Then shall they say among the nations, “The LORD has done great things for them!”
content_old: 2 our mouths shall be filled with laughter, our tongues, with songs of joy. Then shall they say among the nations, “The LORD has done great things for them!”

content: 3 The LORD will do great things for us and we shall rejoice.
content_old: 3 The LORD will do great things for us and we shall rejoice.

content: 4 Restore our fortunes, O LORD, like watercourses in the Negeb.
content_old: 4 Restore our fortunes, O LORD, like watercourses in the Negeb.

content: 5 They who sow in tears shall reap with songs of joy.
content_old: 5 They who sow in tears shall reap with songs of joy.

content: 1 A song of ascents. Of Solomon. Unless the LORD builds the house, its builders labor in vain on it; unless the LORD watches over the city, the watchman keeps vigil in vain.
content_old: 1 A song of ascents. Of Solomon. Unless the LORD builds the house, its builders labor in vain on it; unless the LORD watches over the city, the watchman keeps vigil in vain.

content: 2 In vain do you rise early and stay up late, you who toil for the bread you eat; He provides as much for His loved ones while they sleep.
content_old: 2 In vain do you rise early and stay up late, you who toil for the bread you eat; He provides as much for His loved ones while they sleep.

content: 3 Sons are the provision of the LORD; the fruit of the womb, His reward.
content_old: 3 Sons are the provision of the LORD; the fruit of the womb, His reward.

content: 4 Like arrows in the hand of a warrior are sons born to a man in his youth.
content_old: 4 Like arrows in the hand of a warrior are sons born to a man in his youth.

content: 1 A song of ascents. Happy are all who fear the LORD, who follow His ways.
content_old: 1 A song of ascents. Happy are all who fear the LORD, who follow His ways.

content: 2 You shall enjoy the fruit of your labors; you shall be happy and you shall prosper.
content_old: 2 You shall enjoy the fruit of your labors; you shall be happy and you shall prosper.

content: 3 Your wife shall be like a fruitful vine within your house; your sons, like olive saplings around your table.
content_old: 3 Your wife shall be like a fruitful vine within your house; your sons, like olive saplings around your table.

content: 4 So shall the man who fears the LORD be blessed.
content_old: 4 So shall the man who fears the LORD be blessed.

content: 5 May the LORD bless you from Zion; may you share the prosperity of Jerusalem all the days of your life,
content_old: 5 May the LORD bless you from Zion; may you share the prosperity of Jerusalem all the days of your life,

content: 1 A song of ascents. Since my youth they have often assailed me, let Israel now declare,
content_old: 1 A song of ascents. Since my youth they have often assailed me, let Israel now declare,

content: 2 since my youth they have often assailed me, but they have never overcome me.
content_old: 2 since my youth they have often assailed me, but they have never overcome me.

content: 3 Plowmen plowed across my back; they made long furrows.
content_old: 3 Plowmen plowed across my back; they made long furrows.

content: 4 The LORD, the righteous one, has snapped the cords of the wicked.
content_old: 4 The LORD, the righteous one, has snapped the cords of the wicked.

content: 5 Let all who hate Zion fall back in disgrace.
content_old: 5 Let all who hate Zion fall back in disgrace.

content: 6 Let them be like grass on roofs that fades before it can be pulled up,
content_old: 6 Let them be like grass on roofs that fades before it can be pulled up,

content: 7 that affords no handful for the reaper, no armful for the gatherer of sheaves,
content_old: 7 that affords no handful for the reaper, no armful for the gatherer of sheaves,

content: 1 A song of ascents. Out of the depths I call You, O LORD.
content_old: 1 A song of ascents. Out of the depths I call You, O LORD.

content: 2 O Lord, listen to my cry; let Your ears be attentive to my plea for mercy.
content_old: 2 O Lord, listen to my cry; let Your ears be attentive to my plea for mercy.

content: 3 If You keep account of sins, O LORD, Lord, who will survive?
content_old: 3 If You keep account of sins, O LORD, Lord, who will survive?

content: 4 Yours is the power to forgive so that You may be held in awe.
content_old: 4 Yours is the power to forgive so that You may be held in awe.

content: 5 I look to the LORD; I look to Him; I await His word.
content_old: 5 I look to the LORD; I look to Him; I await His word.

content: 6 I am more eager for the Lord than watchmen for the morning, watchmen for the morning.
content_old: 6 I am more eager for the Lord than watchmen for the morning, watchmen for the morning.

content: 7 O Israel, wait for the LORD; for with the LORD is steadfast love and great power to redeem.
content_old: 7 O Israel, wait for the LORD; for with the LORD is steadfast love and great power to redeem.

content: 1 A song of ascents. Of David. O LORD, my heart is not proud nor my look haughty; I do not aspire to great things or to what is beyond me;
content_old: 1 A song of ascents. Of David. O LORD, my heart is not proud nor my look haughty; I do not aspire to great things or to what is beyond me;

content: 2 but I have taught myself to be contented like a weaned child with its mother; like a weaned child am I in my mind.
content_old: 2 but I have taught myself to be contented like a weaned child with its mother; like a weaned child am I in my mind.

content: 1 A song of ascents. O LORD, remember in David’s favor his extreme self-denial,
content_old: 1 A song of ascents. O LORD, remember in David’s favor his extreme self-denial,

content: 2 how he swore to the LORD, vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob,
content_old: 2 how he swore to the LORD, vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob,

content: 3 “I will not enter my house, nor will I mount my bed,
content_old: 3 “I will not enter my house, nor will I mount my bed,

content: 4 I will not give sleep to my eyes, or slumber to my eyelids
content_old: 4 I will not give sleep to my eyes, or slumber to my eyelids

content: 5 until I find a place for the LORD, an abode for the Mighty One of Jacob.”
content_old: 5 until I find a place for the LORD, an abode for the Mighty One of Jacob.”

content: 6 We heard it was in Ephrath; we came upon it in the region of Jaar.
content_old: 6 We heard it was in Ephrath; we came upon it in the region of Jaar.

content: 7 Let us enter His abode, bow at His footstool.
content_old: 7 Let us enter His abode, bow at His footstool.

content: 8 Advance, O LORD, to Your resting-place, You and Your mighty Ark!
content_old: 8 Advance, O LORD, to Your resting-place, You and Your mighty Ark!

content: 9 Your priests are clothed in triumph; Your loyal ones sing for joy.
content_old: 9 Your priests are clothed in triumph; Your loyal ones sing for joy.

content: 10 For the sake of Your servant David do not reject Your anointed one.
content_old: 10 For the sake of Your servant David do not reject Your anointed one.

content: 11 The LORD swore to David a firm oath that He will not renounce, “One of your own issue I will set upon your throne.
content_old: 11 The LORD swore to David a firm oath that He will not renounce, “One of your own issue I will set upon your throne.

content: 12 If your sons keep My covenant and My decrees that I teach them, then their sons also, to the end of time, shall sit upon your throne.”
content_old: 12 If your sons keep My covenant and My decrees that I teach them, then their sons also, to the end of time, shall sit upon your throne.”

content: 13 For the LORD has chosen Zion; He has desired it for His seat.
content_old: 13 For the LORD has chosen Zion; He has desired it for His seat.

content: 14 “This is my resting-place for all time; here I will dwell, for I desire it.
content_old: 14 “This is my resting-place for all time; here I will dwell, for I desire it.

content: 15 I will amply bless its store of food, give its needy their fill of bread.
content_old: 15 I will amply bless its store of food, give its needy their fill of bread.

content: 16 I will clothe its priests in victory, its loyal ones shall sing for joy.
content_old: 16 I will clothe its priests in victory, its loyal ones shall sing for joy.

content: 17 There I will make a horn sprout for David; I have prepared a lamp for My anointed one.
content_old: 17 There I will make a horn sprout for David; I have prepared a lamp for My anointed one.

content: 1 A song of ascents. Of David. How good and how pleasant it is that brothers dwell together.
content_old: 1 A song of ascents. Of David. How good and how pleasant it is that brothers dwell together.

content: 2 It is like fine oil on the head running down onto the beard, the beard of Aaron, that comes down over the collar of his robe;
content_old: 2 It is like fine oil on the head running down onto the beard, the beard of Aaron, that comes down over the collar of his robe;

content: 1 A song of ascents. Now bless the LORD, all you servants of the LORD who stand nightly in the house of the LORD.
content_old: 1 A song of ascents. Now bless the LORD, all you servants of the LORD who stand nightly in the house of the LORD.

content: 2 Lift your hands toward the sanctuary and bless the LORD.
content_old: 2 Lift your hands toward the sanctuary and bless the LORD.

content: 1 Hallelujah. Praise the name of the LORD; give praise, you servants of the LORD
content_old: 1 Hallelujah. Praise the name of the LORD; give praise, you servants of the LORD

content: 2 who stand in the house of the LORD, in the courts of the house of our God.
content_old: 2 who stand in the house of the LORD, in the courts of the house of our God.

content: 3 Praise the LORD, for the LORD is good; sing hymns to His name, for it is pleasant.
content_old: 3 Praise the LORD, for the LORD is good; sing hymns to His name, for it is pleasant.

content: 4 For the LORD has chosen Jacob for Himself, Israel, as His treasured possession.
content_old: 4 For the LORD has chosen Jacob for Himself, Israel, as His treasured possession.

content: 5 For I know that the LORD is great, that our LORD is greater than all gods.
content_old: 5 For I know that the LORD is great, that our LORD is greater than all gods.

content: 6 Whatever the LORD desires He does in heaven and earth, in the seas and all the depths.
content_old: 6 Whatever the LORD desires He does in heaven and earth, in the seas and all the depths.

content: 7 He makes clouds rise from the end of the earth; He makes lightning for the rain; He releases the wind from His vaults.
content_old: 7 He makes clouds rise from the end of the earth; He makes lightning for the rain; He releases the wind from His vaults.

content: 8 He struck down the first-born of Egypt, man and beast alike;
content_old: 8 He struck down the first-born of Egypt, man and beast alike;

content: 9 He sent signs and portents against Egypt, against Pharaoh and all his servants;
content_old: 9 He sent signs and portents against Egypt, against Pharaoh and all his servants;

content: 10 He struck down many nations and slew numerous kings—
content_old: 10 He struck down many nations and slew numerous kings—

content: 11 Sihon, king of the Amorites, Og, king of Bashan, and all the royalty of Canaan—
content_old: 11 Sihon, king of the Amorites, Og, king of Bashan, and all the royalty of Canaan—

content: 12 and gave their lands as a heritage, as a heritage to His people Israel.
content_old: 12 and gave their lands as a heritage, as a heritage to His people Israel.

content: 13 O LORD, Your name endures forever, Your fame, O LORD, through all generations;
content_old: 13 O LORD, Your name endures forever, Your fame, O LORD, through all generations;

content: 14 for the LORD will champion His people, and obtain satisfaction for His servants.
content_old: 14 for the LORD will champion His people, and obtain satisfaction for His servants.

content: 15 The idols of the nations are silver and gold, the work of men’s hands.
content_old: 15 The idols of the nations are silver and gold, the work of men’s hands.

content: 16 They have mouths, but cannot speak; they have eyes, but cannot see;
content_old: 16 They have mouths, but cannot speak; they have eyes, but cannot see;

content: 17 they have ears, but cannot hear, nor is there breath in their mouths.
content_old: 17 they have ears, but cannot hear, nor is there breath in their mouths.

content: 18 Those who fashion them, all who trust in them, shall become like them.
content_old: 18 Those who fashion them, all who trust in them, shall become like them.

content: 19 O house of Israel, bless the LORD; O house of Aaron, bless the LORD;
content_old: 19 O house of Israel, bless the LORD; O house of Aaron, bless the LORD;

content: 20 O house of Levi, bless the LORD; you who fear the LORD, bless the LORD.
content_old: 20 O house of Levi, bless the LORD; you who fear the LORD, bless the LORD.

content: 1 Praise the LORD; for He is good, His steadfast love is eternal.
content_old: 1 Praise the LORD; for He is good, His steadfast love is eternal.

content: 2 Praise the God of gods, His steadfast love is eternal.
content_old: 2 Praise the God of gods, His steadfast love is eternal.

content: 3 Praise the Lord of lords, His steadfast love is eternal;
content_old: 3 Praise the Lord of lords, His steadfast love is eternal;

content: 4 Who alone works great marvels, His steadfast love is eternal;
content_old: 4 Who alone works great marvels, His steadfast love is eternal;

content: 5 Who made the heavens with wisdom, His steadfast love is eternal;
content_old: 5 Who made the heavens with wisdom, His steadfast love is eternal;

content: 6 Who spread the earth over the water, His steadfast love is eternal;
content_old: 6 Who spread the earth over the water, His steadfast love is eternal;

content: 7 Who made the great lights, His steadfast love is eternal;
content_old: 7 Who made the great lights, His steadfast love is eternal;

content: 8 the sun to dominate the day, His steadfast love is eternal;
content_old: 8 the sun to dominate the day, His steadfast love is eternal;

content: 9 the moon and the stars to dominate the night, His steadfast love is eternal;
content_old: 9 the moon and the stars to dominate the night, His steadfast love is eternal;

content: 10 Who struck Egypt through their first-born, His steadfast love is eternal;
content_old: 10 Who struck Egypt through their first-born, His steadfast love is eternal;

content: 11 and brought Israel out of their midst, His steadfast love is eternal;
content_old: 11 and brought Israel out of their midst, His steadfast love is eternal;

content: 12 with a strong hand and outstretched arm, His steadfast love is eternal;
content_old: 12 with a strong hand and outstretched arm, His steadfast love is eternal;

content: 13 Who split apart the Sea of Reeds, His steadfast love is eternal;
content_old: 13 Who split apart the Sea of Reeds, His steadfast love is eternal;

content: 14 and made Israel pass through it, His steadfast love is eternal;
content_old: 14 and made Israel pass through it, His steadfast love is eternal;

content: 15 Who hurled Pharaoh and his army into the Sea of Reeds, His steadfast love is eternal;
content_old: 15 Who hurled Pharaoh and his army into the Sea of Reeds, His steadfast love is eternal;

content: 16 Who led His people through the wilderness, His steadfast love is eternal;
content_old: 16 Who led His people through the wilderness, His steadfast love is eternal;

content: 17 Who struck down great kings, His steadfast love is eternal;
content_old: 17 Who struck down great kings, His steadfast love is eternal;

content: 18 and slew mighty kings— His steadfast love is eternal;
content_old: 18 and slew mighty kings— His steadfast love is eternal;

content: 19 Sihon, king of the Amorites, His steadfast love is eternal;
content_old: 19 Sihon, king of the Amorites, His steadfast love is eternal;

content: 20 Og, king of Bashan— His steadfast love is eternal;
content_old: 20 Og, king of Bashan— His steadfast love is eternal;

content: 21 and gave their land as a heritage, His steadfast love is eternal;
content_old: 21 and gave their land as a heritage, His steadfast love is eternal;

content: 22 a heritage to His servant Israel, His steadfast love is eternal;
content_old: 22 a heritage to His servant Israel, His steadfast love is eternal;

content: 23 Who took note of us in our degradation, His steadfast love is eternal;
content_old: 23 Who took note of us in our degradation, His steadfast love is eternal;

content: 24 and rescued us from our enemies, His steadfast love is eternal;
content_old: 24 and rescued us from our enemies, His steadfast love is eternal;

content: 25 Who gives food to all flesh, His steadfast love is eternal.
content_old: 25 Who gives food to all flesh, His steadfast love is eternal.

content: 1 By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat, sat and wept, as we thought of Zion.
content_old: 1 By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat, sat and wept, as we thought of Zion.

content: 2 There on the poplars we hung up our lyres,
content_old: 2 There on the poplars we hung up our lyres,

content: 3 for our captors asked us there for songs, our tormentors, for amusement, “Sing us one of the songs of Zion.”
content_old: 3 for our captors asked us there for songs, our tormentors, for amusement, “Sing us one of the songs of Zion.”

content: 4 How can we sing a song of the LORD on alien soil?
content_old: 4 How can we sing a song of the LORD on alien soil?

content: 5 If I forget you, O Jerusalem, let my right hand wither;
content_old: 5 If I forget you, O Jerusalem, let my right hand wither;

content: 6 let my tongue stick to my palate if I cease to think of you, if I do not keep Jerusalem in memory even at my happiest hour.
content_old: 6 let my tongue stick to my palate if I cease to think of you, if I do not keep Jerusalem in memory even at my happiest hour.

content: 7 Remember, O LORD, against the Edomites the day of Jerusalem’s fall; how they cried, “Strip her, strip her to her very foundations!”
content_old: 7 Remember, O LORD, against the Edomites the day of Jerusalem’s fall; how they cried, “Strip her, strip her to her very foundations!”

content: 8 Fair Babylon, you predator, a blessing on him who repays you in kind what you have inflicted on us;
content_old: 8 Fair Babylon, you predator, a blessing on him who repays you in kind what you have inflicted on us;

content: 1 Of David. I praise You with all my heart, sing a hymn to You before the divine beings;
content_old: 1 Of David. I praise You with all my heart, sing a hymn to You before the divine beings;

content: 2 I bow toward Your holy temple and praise Your name for Your steadfast love and faithfulness, because You have exalted Your name, Your word, above all.
content_old: 2 I bow toward Your holy temple and praise Your name for Your steadfast love and faithfulness, because You have exalted Your name, Your word, above all.

content: 3 When I called, You answered me, You inspired me with courage.
content_old: 3 When I called, You answered me, You inspired me with courage.

content: 4 All the kings of the earth shall praise You, O LORD, for they have heard the words You spoke.
content_old: 4 All the kings of the earth shall praise You, O LORD, for they have heard the words You spoke.

content: 5 They shall sing of the ways of the LORD, “Great is the majesty of the LORD!”
content_old: 5 They shall sing of the ways of the LORD, “Great is the majesty of the LORD!”

content: 6 High though the LORD is, He sees the lowly; lofty, He perceives from afar.
content_old: 6 High though the LORD is, He sees the lowly; lofty, He perceives from afar.

content: 7 Though I walk among enemies, You preserve me in the face of my foes; You extend Your hand; with Your right hand You deliver me.
content_old: 7 Though I walk among enemies, You preserve me in the face of my foes; You extend Your hand; with Your right hand You deliver me.

content: 1 For the leader. Of David. A psalm. O LORD, You have examined me and know me.
content_old: 1 For the leader. Of David. A psalm. O LORD, You have examined me and know me.

content: 2 When I sit down or stand up You know it; You discern my thoughts from afar.
content_old: 2 When I sit down or stand up You know it; You discern my thoughts from afar.

content: 3 You observe my walking and reclining, and are familiar with all my ways.
content_old: 3 You observe my walking and reclining, and are familiar with all my ways.

content: 4 There is not a word on my tongue but that You, O LORD, know it well.
content_old: 4 There is not a word on my tongue but that You, O LORD, know it well.

content: 5 You hedge me before and behind; You lay Your hand upon me.
content_old: 5 You hedge me before and behind; You lay Your hand upon me.

content: 6 It is beyond my knowledge; it is a mystery; I cannot fathom it.
content_old: 6 It is beyond my knowledge; it is a mystery; I cannot fathom it.

content: 7 Where can I escape from Your spirit? Where can I flee from Your presence?
content_old: 7 Where can I escape from Your spirit? Where can I flee from Your presence?

content: 8 If I ascend to heaven, You are there; if I descend to Sheol, You are there too.
content_old: 8 If I ascend to heaven, You are there; if I descend to Sheol, You are there too.

content: 9 If I take wing with the dawn to come to rest on the western horizon,
content_old: 9 If I take wing with the dawn to come to rest on the western horizon,

content: 10 even there Your hand will be guiding me, Your right hand will be holding me fast.
content_old: 10 even there Your hand will be guiding me, Your right hand will be holding me fast.

content: 11 If I say, “Surely darkness will conceal me, night will provide me with cover,”
content_old: 11 If I say, “Surely darkness will conceal me, night will provide me with cover,”

content: 12 darkness is not dark for You; night is as light as day; darkness and light are the same.
content_old: 12 darkness is not dark for You; night is as light as day; darkness and light are the same.

content: 13 It was You who created my conscience; You fashioned me in my mother’s womb.
content_old: 13 It was You who created my conscience; You fashioned me in my mother’s womb.

content: 14 I praise You, for I am awesomely, wondrously made; Your work is wonderful; I know it very well.
