content_old: 14 I praise You, for I am awesomely, wondrously made; Your work is wonderful; I know it very well.

content: 15 My frame was not concealed from You when I was shaped in a hidden place, knit together in the recesses of the earth.
content_old: 15 My frame was not concealed from You when I was shaped in a hidden place, knit together in the recesses of the earth.

content: 16 Your eyes saw my unformed limbs; they were all recorded in Your book; in due time they were formed, to the very last one of them.
content_old: 16 Your eyes saw my unformed limbs; they were all recorded in Your book; in due time they were formed, to the very last one of them.

content: 17 How weighty Your thoughts seem to me, O God, how great their number!
content_old: 17 How weighty Your thoughts seem to me, O God, how great their number!

content: 18 I count them—they exceed the grains of sand; I end—but am still with You.
content_old: 18 I count them—they exceed the grains of sand; I end—but am still with You.

content: 19 O God, if You would only slay the wicked— you murderers, away from me!—
content_old: 19 O God, if You would only slay the wicked— you murderers, away from me!—

content: 20 who invoke You for intrigue, Your enemies who swear by You falsely.
content_old: 20 who invoke You for intrigue, Your enemies who swear by You falsely.

content: 21 O LORD, You know I hate those who hate You, and loathe Your adversaries.
content_old: 21 O LORD, You know I hate those who hate You, and loathe Your adversaries.

content: 22 I feel a perfect hatred toward them; I count them my enemies.
content_old: 22 I feel a perfect hatred toward them; I count them my enemies.

content: 23 Examine me, O God, and know my mind; probe me and know my thoughts.
content_old: 23 Examine me, O God, and know my mind; probe me and know my thoughts.

content: 1 For the leader. A psalm of David.
content_old: 1 For the leader. A psalm of David.

content: 2 Rescue me, O LORD, from evil men; save me from the lawless,
content_old: 2 Rescue me, O LORD, from evil men; save me from the lawless,

content: 3 whose minds are full of evil schemes, who plot war every day.
content_old: 3 whose minds are full of evil schemes, who plot war every day.

content: 4 They sharpen their tongues like serpents; spiders’ poison is on their lips. Selah.
content_old: 4 They sharpen their tongues like serpents; spiders’ poison is on their lips. Selah.

content: 5 O LORD, keep me out of the clutches of the wicked; save me from lawless men who scheme to make me fall.
content_old: 5 O LORD, keep me out of the clutches of the wicked; save me from lawless men who scheme to make me fall.

content: 6 Arrogant men laid traps with ropes for me; they spread out a net along the way; they set snares for me. Selah.
content_old: 6 Arrogant men laid traps with ropes for me; they spread out a net along the way; they set snares for me. Selah.

content: 7 I said to the LORD: You are my God; give ear, O LORD, to my pleas for mercy.
content_old: 7 I said to the LORD: You are my God; give ear, O LORD, to my pleas for mercy.

content: 8 O GOD, my Lord, the strength of my deliverance, You protected my head on the day of battle.
content_old: 8 O GOD, my Lord, the strength of my deliverance, You protected my head on the day of battle.

content: 9 O LORD, do not grant the desires of the wicked; do not let their plan succeed, else they be exalted. Selah.
content_old: 9 O LORD, do not grant the desires of the wicked; do not let their plan succeed, else they be exalted. Selah.

content: 10 May the heads of those who beset me be covered with the mischief of their lips.
content_old: 10 May the heads of those who beset me be covered with the mischief of their lips.

content: 11 may coals of fire drop down upon them, and they be cast into pits, never to rise again.
content_old: 11 may coals of fire drop down upon them, and they be cast into pits, never to rise again.

content: 12 Let slanderers have no place in the land; let the evil of the lawless man drive him into corrals.
content_old: 12 Let slanderers have no place in the land; let the evil of the lawless man drive him into corrals.

content: 13 I know that the LORD will champion the cause of the poor, the right of the needy.
content_old: 13 I know that the LORD will champion the cause of the poor, the right of the needy.

content: 1 A psalm of David. I call You, O LORD, hasten to me; give ear to my cry when I call You.
content_old: 1 A psalm of David. I call You, O LORD, hasten to me; give ear to my cry when I call You.

content: 2 Take my prayer as an offering of incense, my upraised hands as an evening sacrifice.
content_old: 2 Take my prayer as an offering of incense, my upraised hands as an evening sacrifice.

content: 3 O LORD, set a guard over my mouth, a watch at the door of my lips;
content_old: 3 O LORD, set a guard over my mouth, a watch at the door of my lips;

content: 4 let my mind not turn to an evil thing, to practice deeds of wickedness with men who are evildoers; let me not feast on their dainties.
content_old: 4 let my mind not turn to an evil thing, to practice deeds of wickedness with men who are evildoers; let me not feast on their dainties.

content: 5 Let the righteous man strike me in loyalty, let him reprove me; let my head not refuse such choice oil. My prayers are still against their evil deeds.
content_old: 5 Let the righteous man strike me in loyalty, let him reprove me; let my head not refuse such choice oil. My prayers are still against their evil deeds.

content: 6 May their judges slip on the rock, but let my words be heard, for they are sweet.
content_old: 6 May their judges slip on the rock, but let my words be heard, for they are sweet.

content: 7 As when the earth is cleft and broken up our bones are scattered at the mouth of Sheol.
content_old: 7 As when the earth is cleft and broken up our bones are scattered at the mouth of Sheol.

content: 8 My eyes are fixed upon You, O GOD my Lord; I seek refuge in You, do not put me in jeopardy.
content_old: 8 My eyes are fixed upon You, O GOD my Lord; I seek refuge in You, do not put me in jeopardy.

content: 9 Keep me from the trap laid for me, and from the snares of evildoers.
content_old: 9 Keep me from the trap laid for me, and from the snares of evildoers.

content: 1 A maskil of David, while he was in the cave. A prayer.
content_old: 1 A maskil of David, while he was in the cave. A prayer.

content: 2 I cry aloud to the LORD; I appeal to the LORD loudly for mercy.
content_old: 2 I cry aloud to the LORD; I appeal to the LORD loudly for mercy.

content: 3 I pour out my complaint before Him; I lay my trouble before Him
content_old: 3 I pour out my complaint before Him; I lay my trouble before Him

content: 4 when my spirit fails within me. You know my course; they have laid a trap in the path I walk.
content_old: 4 when my spirit fails within me. You know my course; they have laid a trap in the path I walk.

content: 5 Look at my right and see— I have no friend; there is nowhere I can flee, no one cares about me.
content_old: 5 Look at my right and see— I have no friend; there is nowhere I can flee, no one cares about me.

content: 6 So I cry to You, O LORD; I say, “You are my refuge, all I have in the land of the living.”
content_old: 6 So I cry to You, O LORD; I say, “You are my refuge, all I have in the land of the living.”

content: 7 Listen to my cry, for I have been brought very low; save me from my pursuers, for they are too strong for me.
content_old: 7 Listen to my cry, for I have been brought very low; save me from my pursuers, for they are too strong for me.

content: 1 A psalm of David. O LORD, hear my prayer; give ear to my plea, as You are faithful; answer me, as You are beneficent.
content_old: 1 A psalm of David. O LORD, hear my prayer; give ear to my plea, as You are faithful; answer me, as You are beneficent.

content: 2 Do not enter into judgment with Your servant, for before You no creature is in the right.
content_old: 2 Do not enter into judgment with Your servant, for before You no creature is in the right.

content: 3 My foe hounded me; he crushed me to the ground; he made me dwell in darkness like those long dead.
content_old: 3 My foe hounded me; he crushed me to the ground; he made me dwell in darkness like those long dead.

content: 4 My spirit failed within me; my mind was numbed with horror.
content_old: 4 My spirit failed within me; my mind was numbed with horror.

content: 5 Then I thought of the days of old; I rehearsed all Your deeds, recounted the work of Your hands.
content_old: 5 Then I thought of the days of old; I rehearsed all Your deeds, recounted the work of Your hands.

content: 6 I stretched out my hands to You, longing for You like thirsty earth. Selah.
content_old: 6 I stretched out my hands to You, longing for You like thirsty earth. Selah.

content: 7 Answer me quickly, O LORD; my spirit can endure no more. Do not hide Your face from me, or I shall become like those who descend into the Pit.
content_old: 7 Answer me quickly, O LORD; my spirit can endure no more. Do not hide Your face from me, or I shall become like those who descend into the Pit.

content: 8 Let me learn of Your faithfulness by daybreak, for in You I trust; let me know the road I must take, for on You I have set my hope.
content_old: 8 Let me learn of Your faithfulness by daybreak, for in You I trust; let me know the road I must take, for on You I have set my hope.

content: 9 Save me from my foes, O LORD; to You I look for cover.
content_old: 9 Save me from my foes, O LORD; to You I look for cover.

content: 10 Teach me to do Your will, for You are my God. Let Your gracious spirit lead me on level ground.
content_old: 10 Teach me to do Your will, for You are my God. Let Your gracious spirit lead me on level ground.

content: 11 For the sake of Your name, O LORD, preserve me; as You are beneficent, free me from distress.
content_old: 11 For the sake of Your name, O LORD, preserve me; as You are beneficent, free me from distress.

content: 1 Of David. Blessed is the LORD, my rock, who trains my hands for battle, my fingers for warfare;
content_old: 1 Of David. Blessed is the LORD, my rock, who trains my hands for battle, my fingers for warfare;

content: 2 my faithful one, my fortress, my haven and my deliverer, my shield, in whom I take shelter, who makes peoples subject to me.
content_old: 2 my faithful one, my fortress, my haven and my deliverer, my shield, in whom I take shelter, who makes peoples subject to me.

content: 3 O LORD, what is man that You should care about him, mortal man, that You should think of him?
content_old: 3 O LORD, what is man that You should care about him, mortal man, that You should think of him?

content: 4 Man is like a breath; his days are like a passing shadow.
content_old: 4 Man is like a breath; his days are like a passing shadow.

content: 5 O LORD, bend Your sky and come down; touch the mountains and they will smoke.
content_old: 5 O LORD, bend Your sky and come down; touch the mountains and they will smoke.

content: 6 Make lightning flash and scatter them; shoot Your arrows and rout them.
content_old: 6 Make lightning flash and scatter them; shoot Your arrows and rout them.

content: 7 Reach Your hand down from on high; rescue me, save me from the mighty waters, from the hands of foreigners,
content_old: 7 Reach Your hand down from on high; rescue me, save me from the mighty waters, from the hands of foreigners,

content: 8 whose mouths speak lies, and whose oaths are false.
content_old: 8 whose mouths speak lies, and whose oaths are false.

content: 9 O God, I will sing You a new song, sing a hymn to You with a ten-stringed harp,
content_old: 9 O God, I will sing You a new song, sing a hymn to You with a ten-stringed harp,

content: 10 to You who give victory to kings, who rescue His servant David from the deadly sword.
content_old: 10 to You who give victory to kings, who rescue His servant David from the deadly sword.

content: 11 Rescue me, save me from the hands of foreigners, whose mouths speak lies, and whose oaths are false.
content_old: 11 Rescue me, save me from the hands of foreigners, whose mouths speak lies, and whose oaths are false.

content: 12 For our sons are like saplings, well-tended in their youth; our daughters are like cornerstones trimmed to give shape to a palace.
content_old: 12 For our sons are like saplings, well-tended in their youth; our daughters are like cornerstones trimmed to give shape to a palace.

content: 13 Our storehouses are full, supplying produce of all kinds; our flocks number thousands, even myriads, in our fields;
content_old: 13 Our storehouses are full, supplying produce of all kinds; our flocks number thousands, even myriads, in our fields;

content: 14 our cattle are well cared for. There is no breaching and no sortie, and no wailing in our streets.
content_old: 14 our cattle are well cared for. There is no breaching and no sortie, and no wailing in our streets.

content: 1 A song of praise. Of David. I will extol You, my God and king, and bless Your name forever and ever.
content_old: 1 A song of praise. Of David. I will extol You, my God and king, and bless Your name forever and ever.

content: 2 Every day will I bless You and praise Your name forever and ever.
content_old: 2 Every day will I bless You and praise Your name forever and ever.

content: 3 Great is the LORD and much acclaimed; His greatness cannot be fathomed.
content_old: 3 Great is the LORD and much acclaimed; His greatness cannot be fathomed.

content: 4 One generation shall laud Your works to another and declare Your mighty acts.
content_old: 4 One generation shall laud Your works to another and declare Your mighty acts.

content: 5 The glorious majesty of Your splendor and Your wondrous acts will I recite.
content_old: 5 The glorious majesty of Your splendor and Your wondrous acts will I recite.

content: 6 Men shall talk of the might of Your awesome deeds, and I will recount Your greatness.
content_old: 6 Men shall talk of the might of Your awesome deeds, and I will recount Your greatness.

content: 7 They shall celebrate Your abundant goodness, and sing joyously of Your beneficence.
content_old: 7 They shall celebrate Your abundant goodness, and sing joyously of Your beneficence.

content: 8 The LORD is gracious and compassionate, slow to anger and abounding in kindness.
content_old: 8 The LORD is gracious and compassionate, slow to anger and abounding in kindness.

content: 9 The LORD is good to all, and His mercy is upon all His works.
content_old: 9 The LORD is good to all, and His mercy is upon all His works.

content: 10 All Your works shall praise You, O LORD, and Your faithful ones shall bless You.
content_old: 10 All Your works shall praise You, O LORD, and Your faithful ones shall bless You.

content: 11 They shall talk of the majesty of Your kingship, and speak of Your might,
content_old: 11 They shall talk of the majesty of Your kingship, and speak of Your might,

content: 12 to make His mighty acts known among men and the majestic glory of His kingship.
content_old: 12 to make His mighty acts known among men and the majestic glory of His kingship.

content: 13 Your kingship is an eternal kingship; Your dominion is for all generations.
content_old: 13 Your kingship is an eternal kingship; Your dominion is for all generations.

content: 14 The LORD supports all who stumble, and makes all who are bent stand straight.
content_old: 14 The LORD supports all who stumble, and makes all who are bent stand straight.

content: 15 The eyes of all look to You expectantly, and You give them their food when it is due.
content_old: 15 The eyes of all look to You expectantly, and You give them their food when it is due.

content: 16 You give it openhandedly, feeding every creature to its heart’s content.
content_old: 16 You give it openhandedly, feeding every creature to its heart’s content.

content: 17 The LORD is beneficent in all His ways and faithful in all His works.
content_old: 17 The LORD is beneficent in all His ways and faithful in all His works.

content: 18 The LORD is near to all who call Him, to all who call Him with sincerity.
content_old: 18 The LORD is near to all who call Him, to all who call Him with sincerity.

content: 19 He fulfills the wishes of those who fear Him; He hears their cry and delivers them.
content_old: 19 He fulfills the wishes of those who fear Him; He hears their cry and delivers them.

content: 20 The LORD watches over all who love Him, but all the wicked He will destroy.
content_old: 20 The LORD watches over all who love Him, but all the wicked He will destroy.

content: 1 Hallelujah. Praise the LORD, O my soul!
content_old: 1 Hallelujah. Praise the LORD, O my soul!

content: 2 I will praise the LORD all my life, sing hymns to my God while I exist.
content_old: 2 I will praise the LORD all my life, sing hymns to my God while I exist.

content: 3 Put not your trust in the great, in mortal man who cannot save.
content_old: 3 Put not your trust in the great, in mortal man who cannot save.

content: 4 His breath departs; he returns to the dust; on that day his plans come to nothing.
content_old: 4 His breath departs; he returns to the dust; on that day his plans come to nothing.

content: 5 Happy is he who has the God of Jacob for his help, whose hope is in the LORD his God,
content_old: 5 Happy is he who has the God of Jacob for his help, whose hope is in the LORD his God,

content: 6 maker of heaven and earth, the sea and all that is in them; who keeps faith forever;
content_old: 6 maker of heaven and earth, the sea and all that is in them; who keeps faith forever;

content: 7 who secures justice for those who are wronged, gives food to the hungry. The LORD sets prisoners free;
content_old: 7 who secures justice for those who are wronged, gives food to the hungry. The LORD sets prisoners free;

content: 8 The LORD restores sight to the blind; the LORD makes those who are bent stand straight; the LORD loves the righteous;
content_old: 8 The LORD restores sight to the blind; the LORD makes those who are bent stand straight; the LORD loves the righteous;

content: 9 The LORD watches over the stranger; He gives courage to the orphan and widow, but makes the path of the wicked tortuous.
content_old: 9 The LORD watches over the stranger; He gives courage to the orphan and widow, but makes the path of the wicked tortuous.

content: 1 Hallelujah. It is good to chant hymns to our God; it is pleasant to sing glorious praise.
content_old: 1 Hallelujah. It is good to chant hymns to our God; it is pleasant to sing glorious praise.

content: 2 The LORD rebuilds Jerusalem; He gathers in the exiles of Israel.
content_old: 2 The LORD rebuilds Jerusalem; He gathers in the exiles of Israel.

content: 3 He heals their broken hearts, and binds up their wounds.
content_old: 3 He heals their broken hearts, and binds up their wounds.

content: 4 He reckoned the number of the stars; to each He gave its name.
content_old: 4 He reckoned the number of the stars; to each He gave its name.

content: 5 Great is our LORD and full of power; His wisdom is beyond reckoning.
content_old: 5 Great is our LORD and full of power; His wisdom is beyond reckoning.

content: 6 The LORD gives courage to the lowly, and brings the wicked down to the dust.
content_old: 6 The LORD gives courage to the lowly, and brings the wicked down to the dust.

content: 7 Sing to the LORD a song of praise, chant a hymn with a lyre to our God,
content_old: 7 Sing to the LORD a song of praise, chant a hymn with a lyre to our God,

content: 8 who covers the heavens with clouds, provides rain for the earth, makes mountains put forth grass;
content_old: 8 who covers the heavens with clouds, provides rain for the earth, makes mountains put forth grass;

content: 9 who gives the beasts their food, to the raven’s brood what they cry for.
content_old: 9 who gives the beasts their food, to the raven’s brood what they cry for.

content: 10 He does not prize the strength of horses, nor value the fleetness of men;
content_old: 10 He does not prize the strength of horses, nor value the fleetness of men;

content: 11 but the LORD values those who fear Him, those who depend on His faithful care.
content_old: 11 but the LORD values those who fear Him, those who depend on His faithful care.

content: 12 O Jerusalem, glorify the LORD; praise your God, O Zion!
content_old: 12 O Jerusalem, glorify the LORD; praise your God, O Zion!

content: 13 For He made the bars of your gates strong, and blessed your children within you.
content_old: 13 For He made the bars of your gates strong, and blessed your children within you.

content: 14 He endows your realm with well-being, and satisfies you with choice wheat.
content_old: 14 He endows your realm with well-being, and satisfies you with choice wheat.

content: 15 He sends forth His word to the earth; His command runs swiftly.
content_old: 15 He sends forth His word to the earth; His command runs swiftly.

content: 16 He lays down snow like fleece, scatters frost like ashes.
content_old: 16 He lays down snow like fleece, scatters frost like ashes.

content: 17 He tosses down hail like crumbs— who can endure His icy cold?
content_old: 17 He tosses down hail like crumbs— who can endure His icy cold?

content: 18 He issues a command—it melts them; He breathes—the waters flow.
content_old: 18 He issues a command—it melts them; He breathes—the waters flow.

content: 19 He issued His commands to Jacob, His statutes and rules to Israel.
content_old: 19 He issued His commands to Jacob, His statutes and rules to Israel.

content: 1 Hallelujah. Praise the LORD from the heavens; praise Him on high.
content_old: 1 Hallelujah. Praise the LORD from the heavens; praise Him on high.

content: 2 Praise Him, all His angels, praise Him, all His hosts.
content_old: 2 Praise Him, all His angels, praise Him, all His hosts.

content: 3 Praise Him, sun and moon, praise Him, all bright stars.
content_old: 3 Praise Him, sun and moon, praise Him, all bright stars.

content: 4 Praise Him, highest heavens, and you waters that are above the heavens.
content_old: 4 Praise Him, highest heavens, and you waters that are above the heavens.

content: 5 Let them praise the name of the LORD, for it was He who commanded that they be created.
content_old: 5 Let them praise the name of the LORD, for it was He who commanded that they be created.

content: 6 He made them endure forever, establishing an order that shall never change.
content_old: 6 He made them endure forever, establishing an order that shall never change.

content: 7 Praise the LORD, O you who are on earth, all sea monsters and ocean depths,
content_old: 7 Praise the LORD, O you who are on earth, all sea monsters and ocean depths,

content: 8 fire and hail, snow and smoke, storm wind that executes His command,
content_old: 8 fire and hail, snow and smoke, storm wind that executes His command,

content: 9 all mountains and hills, all fruit trees and cedars,
content_old: 9 all mountains and hills, all fruit trees and cedars,

content: 10 all wild and tamed beasts, creeping things and winged birds,
content_old: 10 all wild and tamed beasts, creeping things and winged birds,

content: 11 all kings and peoples of the earth, all princes of the earth and its judges,
content_old: 11 all kings and peoples of the earth, all princes of the earth and its judges,

content: 12 youths and maidens alike, old and young together.
content_old: 12 youths and maidens alike, old and young together.

content: 13 Let them praise the name of the LORD, for His name, His alone, is sublime; His splendor covers heaven and earth.
content_old: 13 Let them praise the name of the LORD, for His name, His alone, is sublime; His splendor covers heaven and earth.

content: 1 Hallelujah. Sing to the LORD a new song, His praises in the congregation of the faithful.
content_old: 1 Hallelujah. Sing to the LORD a new song, His praises in the congregation of the faithful.

content: 2 Let Israel rejoice in its maker; let the children of Zion exult in their king.
content_old: 2 Let Israel rejoice in its maker; let the children of Zion exult in their king.

content: 3 Let them praise His name in dance; with timbrel and lyre let them chant His praises.
content_old: 3 Let them praise His name in dance; with timbrel and lyre let them chant His praises.

content: 4 For the LORD delights in His people; He adorns the lowly with victory.
content_old: 4 For the LORD delights in His people; He adorns the lowly with victory.

content: 5 Let the faithful exult in glory; let them shout for joy upon their couches,
content_old: 5 Let the faithful exult in glory; let them shout for joy upon their couches,

content: 6 with paeans to God in their throats and two-edged swords in their hands,
content_old: 6 with paeans to God in their throats and two-edged swords in their hands,

content: 7 to impose retribution upon the nations, punishment upon the peoples,
content_old: 7 to impose retribution upon the nations, punishment upon the peoples,

content: 8 binding their kings with shackles, their nobles with chains of iron,
content_old: 8 binding their kings with shackles, their nobles with chains of iron,

content: 1 Hallelujah. Praise God in His sanctuary; praise Him in the sky, His stronghold.
content_old: 1 Hallelujah. Praise God in His sanctuary; praise Him in the sky, His stronghold.

content: 2 Praise Him for His mighty acts; praise Him for His exceeding greatness.
content_old: 2 Praise Him for His mighty acts; praise Him for His exceeding greatness.

content: 3 Praise Him with blasts of the horn; praise Him with harp and lyre.
content_old: 3 Praise Him with blasts of the horn; praise Him with harp and lyre.

content: 4 Praise Him with timbrel and dance; praise Him with lute and pipe.
content_old: 4 Praise Him with timbrel and dance; praise Him with lute and pipe.

content: 5 Praise Him with resounding cymbals; praise Him with loud-clashing cymbals.
content_old: 5 Praise Him with resounding cymbals; praise Him with loud-clashing cymbals.
